Reviews.Title: “Hotel Like Home”
Reviews.Author: PlayaTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Playa Maya Hotel on the beach in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico the end of Jan. 2012. It was our fist stay there and it will not be our last! The rooms were clean and nice, almost all with ocean views!! The staff was extremely nice, all of them always talked to you whenever they saw you, even if it was in another part of town. The food was excellent!! We recommend the coconut shrimp!!! If you are planning on a stay in Playa Del Carmen, please think about this Hotel, well worth cost. The only thing, it is not all inclusive. You get your room, breakfast every morning, and a beach chair every day, but otherwise you have to fend for yourself, but that is not all bad. There are many excellent restuarants in Playa Del Carmen and many are reasonable as long as your set on eating on 5th Avenue. Get off the beaten path and you will far well. Have a great time~!!! Teresa & Chris

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: packerfan2
Reviews.Content: When we decided to try to squeeze in a short trip to Mexico this year, there was only one choice for us. Our hearts nearly broke when we were told at first that we wouldn't be able to stay here, but Steve worked with us even though we could only stay 4 nights which is under the minimum for this time of year. He made an exception since we were repeat customers. That is the kind of service you can expect from everyone at Playa Maya. When we got there, our room wasn't quite ready, so we went to the beach for lunch. We sat down, our waiter came over, and said, "I remember you. You stayed here two years ago!" Unbelievable!! This time we stayed in the jacuzzi garden. I loved the garden area, and the whirlpool tub was very relaxing after an exhausting day on the beach! The room was beautiful, quiet, and clean beyond belief. My husband loved the room too, but he admits he missed the superior balcony we had last time because he loves to sit on the balcony and watch the waves at night. Every part of our stay was fabulous...the room, the food, the drinks, and most of all the people. They really do go out of their way to make your stay the best it can be. It was very reassuring to return to our room after strolling 5th Avenue in the evening to have a security guard checking your room key to be sure you belonged there. I can't really say anything else that hasn't already been said about this place. I do know that we won't stay anywhere else when we come to PDC. You have got to give this place a try!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent excellence”
Reviews.Author: YWGDon
Reviews.Content: The previous 4 or 5 reviewers all stayed at Playa Maya around the same time we were there, it seems, and everything they said has been true for a very long time! This was our 8th stay there, 4 for 2 weeks and 4 for 3 weeks, so with 20 weeks spent there now, I can advise you that much hasn't changed in 8 years, and the things that have were small and evolutionary, addressing the most-often voiced complaints. What is there to like about Playa Maya? First, and foremost, the staff! Many of them are long-time employees and you can't beat the feeling of landing on the beach at the foot of 8th street to be greeted by a round of handshakes and hugs as they grab the bags. Watching them day after day, they truly seem to be one big happy family. They eat lunch together in the afternoons and the restautrant is often filled with laughter. Long-time employees are the essence of consistent delivery. Along with that, the rooms are generous, the housekeeping is top notch, the food is amongst the best in Playa del Carmen, there is always a beach chair waiting for you, the service never stops and you are right around the corner from all that Playa del Carmen has to offer. And, just enough around the corner to enjoy a peaceful night's sleep while the disco's boom a few blocks away. There are a few things some won't like: only beach access, so kick off your shoes on 8th Street built-in StairMaster (it's 58 steps from the beach to the third floor, but I happen to like that) dipping pool, so no Olympic practice available With another 3-week stay concluded and next year's already booked, what more is there to say.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Cottonhead
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 1st trip to Playa del Carmen and can't say enough about our stay at Playa Maya. The location is great and the hotel is safe, very clean and well maintained. Bathrooms are modern with good water pressure and the AC works well. We had a flat screen TV in the two rooms we stayed in. We had to change rooms mid-week due to availability and for us, the jacuzzi room with no view turned out to be our favorite. (The other room we stayed in was Studio A near the pool which has a queen bed and trundle as well as a table for 4 and kitchen area which is probably perfect for a family or someone who doesnt want stairs ) the jacuzzzi room was oversized, the king-size bed was comfortable and the bathroom and shower were pretty large.After a day in the sun, we enjoyed having our own private garden room open to the sky but shaded by trees. It gave us privacy and a place to sit outside our room which was perfect if one of us was sleeping etc. We were also able to sit outside when it rained. There is always a place available to lounge on the beach and the staff is nearby to assist if you need anything whether it's an umbrella, a drink or lunch.They don't push - they just keep an eye on things and appear when you need help. Breakfast on the beach is included and delicious. Lunch couldn't be beat either so why go elsewhere -- we never left the beach during the day. The staff is excellent and helped with anything we needed. When we first arrived, they simply appeared to carry our luggage across the beach to the hotel since Calle 8 deadends at the beach. Although this not a fancy luxury resort hotel, you will have everything you need and more. The refigerator was stocked with some drinks for our enjoyment and a large bottle of water was delivered daily. It is a testament to Playa Maya that most guests were repeat customers and the staff mentioned their goal was to make sure we relaxed and enjoyed our stay so we would come back -- they've got it right IMO. The hotel is one block from all the action on 5th Ave and we enjoyed walking and people watching each night after trying different restaurants. For transportation, we relied on Cancun Shuttle as recommended by the hotel and had no problems - we did call to confirm a meeting spot when they picked us up at the end of our stay since there is no car access to the hotel and we didn't want any problems getting to the airport. It worked out perfectly. We will definitely return to Playa Maya and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Top 10 Reasons Playa Maya is Still our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: NorthPaw42
Reviews.Content: 10) One block from 5th Avenue...close to the action yet quiet at night. You are no more than a few blocks from the best restaurants and shopping. 9) Friendly security guard on duty by the only entrance all night ...with nothing to do all night -- the whole area feels safer than an airport 8) Small and intimate -- feels like you are coming home after having dinner in Playa. 7) Did I mention the only entrance is from the beach -- how quaint is that? 6) Most of the guests are return visitors -- what does that tell you about the place? 5) Great beach and beach chairs (padded chaise lounges) The beach HAS washed out quite a bit from 2011, but still plenty of room 4) Spotlessly clean, beautifully maintained The staff are constantly cleaning, painting, scrubbing, sweeping. The property in immaculate and they still find things to do 3) Wonderful breakfasts (included) under the palapas on the beach at 8:00 AM 2) Great lunch menu served on tables under the palapas, or on your beach chairs Lift one finger and the waiters and cabana boys are right there. 1) Fantastic staff -- the waiters, cooks, housekeepers, desk staff, and cabana boys are the friendliest, happiest, and most appreciative we've found anywhere...and the same staff are here year after year -- what does that tell you about this being a great place to stay and to work.

Reviews.Title: “Not Enough Superlatives”
Reviews.Author: Mcmemo
Reviews.Content: After many years of vacations on the (quite beautiful) resorts that dot the Riviera Maya, we decided to break out this year and vacation on our own terms. A lucky reservation cancellation landed us a room (two different rooms, actually - we changed rooms midweek by choice) at the Playa Maya during the week of February 17. Who knew that we had secured a reservation at what is undoubtedly one of the finest (and very likely the finest small) hotel in Playa del Carmen?!! My husband and I have agreed that the week we spent in Playa del Carmen was the best vacation that we have had in the 15 years we have been together - and our stay at the Playa Maya absolutely played a major part in our experience. A staff that caters to their guests generally defines the quality of a hotel stay, and there are simply not enough superlatives to describe all of the staff that served our every want and need while we stayed. They are generous with their time and attention, and cheerful and gregarious with their interactions with their guests. If you stay, you will immediately recognize the following: "FrontDesk" Pedro, Julianna, Maria, "Bar Pedro," Rasael, Carla, Carlos, the "Juans"... The cleaning staff is marvelously efficient; the beach crew is every bit attentive as everyone else. This is a small hotel, and it felt like home. We stayed in the Jacuzzi Garden room and in a Deluxe Balcony with Hammock room - and the accommodations were completely satisfying. We feel quite sure that we could have stayed in any of the rooms at the hotel and have been equally pleased. We met many wonderful people on the beach, hopefully linking to long-term relationships. As others have noted, the breakfast that is part of the lodging fee is more than sufficient. Both breakfast and lunch menus are extensive - and the food is great! And the drinks that they serve up are no "resort" watered-down beverages, either. We also tip our hat to Stephen Ryeberg who has put together such a wonderful staff - and who was also so attentive to all of the emails I sent, answering all of my questions and making suggestions in an amazingly quick response-time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel by the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Joy S
Reviews.Content: The staff are really friendly and helpful. This is our first time at playa Maya and definitely will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, beach & breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Dosmojito
Reviews.Content: This was our first time going non-AI in this area, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We stayed for 11 nights in February 2012. Playa Maya is in a fantastic location, and it had a nice home-away-from-home feel to it. Noise was never a problem. I was worried about this, given the central location. I am a light sleeper, and I could hear some bass from Fusion during the night, but it was not enough to keep me awake. We were right close to all the action on 5th Ave and never had to walk far to find a great restaurant, or even just to pick up a mid-day gelato. There was a security guard who would ask for our room number each evening when we returned to the hotel from dinner. Cleanliness was excellent. The staff were all very pleasant. At the beach, Juan, Jesus and Lucio were attentive and pleasant at all times. Juan would even notice when I was trying to adjust my lounger, and would come and lend a hand! At the same time, they were never intrusive. We visited Mamita’s beach club and Wicky’s, but we liked the staff best at Playa Maya, and found the loungers more comfortable too. Food was very reasonably priced, in my opinion. Beer was $20 pesos (cheaper than water). Cocktails varied, but were very large and ones I tried were in the $60 to $70 pesos range. Some of the items we enjoyed included mango margaritas, pina coladas, coconut shrimp, chicken tacos, nachos, guac and chips with fresh pico de gallo, chicken strips and fries (for our daughter). Hamburgers were average. There is a small pool, which was never busy. I personally prefer the beach, but our daughter also liked the pool. It is 4 feet deep at the deepest end, so enough for her to swim in a bit. There was also a sitting area above the pool. There was usually someone at the front desk, and they were all willing to help with any questions we had; Pablo even walked with us to the store where we bought a phone card that didn’t work, to help us get a refund. Each morning there was a pot of coffee at the front desk and a bowl of packaged granola bars and/or cookies for guests to take. There are umbrellas for guest use too – something we found out after buying one for $15 US! Throughout the booking process, and my many questions! Stephen was very quick at responding. We stayed in room 304, a “Superior Ocean View” for most of our visit, and then in room 105, a “Jacuzzi Garden” room. I will give a bit of a comparison of the rooms: Superior Ocean View had a small balcony with two chairs and a nice ocean view. We made use of the small coffee pot and mini fridge, which was always stocked with water. There was plenty of space in the room. The bathroom was nice – a bit small, but with a large shower – never a problem with water temperature, though the pressure was poor (we often find this in Mexico). Air conditioning was excellent. I would definitely stay in this room type again. The view was just like the photos on the website. Jacuzzi Garden was large and lovely. The outdoor area is very nice, completely private with a fabulous large Jacuzzi tub surrounded by white curtains and a little bistro table and chairs. This would be a wonderful honeymoon suite. Due to the privacy of the room, however, you cannot see outside at all. For our purposes, we preferred the Ocean View room overall, because we liked having the ocean view. What we liked the most, overall: 1) The beautiful beach!! And we never had a problem getting loungers, even if we slept in. 2) The delicious breakfast! My favourite choice was waffles with bacon, fresh tropical fruit, juice and coffee. We loved having our toes in the sand and watching the waves while having a leisurely breakfast. 3) The staff, including Stephen during the booking process. The only negative I can think of is that beach towels were not available until about 9:30 or 10 a.m., so if you are an early riser this may be a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Hedotwo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our daughter and her husband just returned yesterday from a week long stay at Playa Maya. To begin with, the entire booking process, and personal emails from manager Stephen Ryberg, was excellent. We had a small mixup with our reservations regarding rooms, but Stephen made it right for us and all turned out well. The staff of Playa were outstanding and the rooms (we had room 301) were kept spotless. We unfortunately had our room air conditioner die the second day of our stay and the hotel had it replaced on the same day. Our included morning breakfasts were outstanding and my wife and I ate lunch 5 of the 7 days at Playa and found the meals to be a good value and very filling. As is often mentioned here, the fish tacos and coconut shrimp were excellent, but I think my favorite was their caribbean fish plate. The weather during our week was nice for the most part, with spotty rain in the evenings and a persistent wind on the beach which admittedly wore us down by weeks' end. My only complaint (almost embarrassed to admit) was that the pillows were lumpy (although with 5 on the king sized bed I found one that was acceptable). I can recommend Playa Maya and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “lousy organization; worst ever”
Reviews.Author: grambo07
Reviews.Content: i have not been to playa maya in playa del carmen but i have been impressed by the ratings. however, my attempts to get information from this alleged hotel have been totally disappointing and i would not encourage anyone to go there. their web page lists rates only through july. do you know anyone who wants to go to cancun in july? i called three times and asked what the room rates were for november and december. i got someone each time who did not speak english and could not answer one question. not one. my advice is go elsewhere. this is a broken down operation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moses-CJ
Reviews.Content: Very friendly small hotel located right on the beach. Felt like coming home! Clean, modern, safe, secure, very friendly, right in the heart of Playa, and very quiet - which was a concern of mine as i knew there are the all-night boom-boom clubs in the area. Minimal noise - i slept with the sliding door open, could hear the waves all night, and smell the coffee in the morning! Everything from making the reservation to checking out was effortless. Great full breakfasts are included - restaurant right on the beach. I met many long-term Playa vacationers that come spend the day here at the beach renting chairs (as opposed to other hotels or a beach club) - they said it was very friendly, knew the staff, and they come for the food as the restaurant is excellent. Hotel is located off 8th St North, nestled in with many other hotels big and small. Just 4 blocks from the ADO bus from the airport - no need for cab. Bustling 5th Ave is just up the street, with many excellent restaurants very close by. The entire area is very walkable. I ventured out deeper into town for more local diners (better prices). On different nights of the week different clubs have a band and thats 'the place to be' for happy hour/dancing/meeting others. I went as a single (50 y.o.) and had no problem meeting people and feeling very safe. Many of these clubs were right down the beach, so close to 'home' when the night was over. There are a lot of small hotels in town. The advantage of Playa Maya is that you're right on the beach - no need to put on shoes for most of the day, availability for great restaurant/snacks/refreshments with consistently friendly service, and are assured a beach chair and great service! Playa in general has really developed and is getting more pricey and sophisticated, with North Americans owning homes/condos, and many europeans opening up small inns and cafes - you can find most any activity/sport/yoga/health food, etc etc. For food, I tried to keep it local but found a great variety of choices - if you head off the tourist area, you can find great meals and get back into the ole'Mexico budget. Restaurants - these were recommended by others and I found consistently excellent food: Mexican - Carboncitos, just off 5th ave on 4th St - tortilla soup is a meal in itself Fogans - more local, on calle 20 just before 30th ave - great food = lots of tourists+locals Italian - Titi Panini - calle 10, b/w 10th and 15th ave; excellent healthy salad bar, wonderful owners. Thai - Babe's Noodles - calle 10 b/w 5th and 10th ave; half orders available also el Diez ("10") - Argentinian (after their Soccer player #10) - steaks, seafood, grilled veg's, great pizza - right on 5th ave and calle 26. Thank you Playa Maya!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Jcatita
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Playa Maya Hotel in August of 2011. We were there for 7 nights and enjoyed the hotel very much. As said in many other reviews, the staff are so friendly and welcoming - especially Juan. When we were leaving the hotel to go home, we forgot a bag of clothes in the room, and Juan came all the way to the bus station to bring us the bag of clothes. What other hotel staff member would do that for a guest? The beach is beautiful, and the proximity to fifth avenue is awesome. If there were one thing I would change, it would be to have an all-inclusive option. That was the ONLY drawback for us. Please let me know if this ever changes and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Life Doesn't Get Any Better!”
Reviews.Author: Dakarrs
Reviews.Content: We arrived 1/8/12, this was our first time at Playa Maya and we soon realized we had made a great choice! The location can't be any better, right on the beach, just feet from the water and a constant breeze. We stayed in room 201, it had the best view each morning of the sun coming up and we enjoyed coffee there each day on the balcony.The room was quite nice and always clean. We ate all our meals at Playa Maya, the selection was great incluing the fish tacos,shrimp tacos,coconut shrimp, calamari,and the grouper! Yum! Our last night there they set up a special table{we were the last to eat} and Jesus took excellent care to make it perfect! Maria and Julianna helped us book side trips{Tulum and Selvatica} and guided us to all pick-up locations. The staff is friendly and helpful, the location is perfect{the busy shopping st., 5th is one block away} and the Beach,where you can find any shell you want! Want to relax with GREAT service,come to Playa Maya, you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “The best way to relax”
Reviews.Author: citygirlcountrygirl
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Playa Maya. This is a hotel where people care about their jobs and strive to do well. And they are wonderful. Let me share some additional information. This is a quaint hotel located in the middle of the beach between the gran Porto all inclusive, and the pier. There is a very small pool, but if you are a "pool person" do not come here. This is a hotel for beach travelers. The rooms are very clean, a small refrigerator, safe, closet, shower, tv, view. Large and comfy beds. There are two bars a couple of doors down on either side so if a light sleeper you may hear some noise. I did, but it wasn't a problem and there were many older travelers here so it's not a nightclub atmosphere just on saturday night you may hear something. More like really mellow, to each their own, be polite and not a big party type. We met great people. Food is excellent too many great restaurants around, but I recommend ceviche, guacamole, grouper fresh fish filet.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Johnos99
Reviews.Content: Playa Maya is a brilliant little hotel. we came back for the second time recently, and if anything, it was even better than before. It is right on the beach - any closer to the water it would have to be a submarine. breakfast is great, the staff are lovely, the beers are cold. its only 100 m walk to anenida quinta, the main drag in playa del carmen. And although the bar/restaurant closes early (no dinner), this keeps the place quiet, and a 50 m walk along the beach gets you to Fusion, a fabulous beach bar with outstanding food, so you get the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Best food on the beach”
Reviews.Author: hake0302
Reviews.Content: The food here is great - we ate lunch here 3 times over our 6 day trip. I highly recommend the fish tacos and their fresh pico de gallo and hot sauce. The staff members were all super friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: HonestTraveler1158
Reviews.Content: I am a single 53 yr. old woman that traveled to Playa del Carmen last August and stayed at the Playa Maya Hotel. This was my 3rd stay at the hotel but my first stay alone and I will definitely return summer of 2012! I felt 100% safe traveling and staying alone in Mexico and at this hotel. The staff is unbelievably friendly and professional. The food is wonderful and the drinks great! I stayed in a standard room and it was kept immaculate by the maid that came everyday, leaving cute towel art on the spare bed. I would go down every morning and have the complementary breakfast either on my lounge chair or under the palapa. The complementary breakfast was a full breakfast, not toast and coffee but you could have that too if that's all you want. I would meet up with a group in the evenings and we would go to dinner etc. Every night when I came back to the hotel, the guard would be right there by the gate and after the first night he recognized me and remembered what room number I was in so that made me feel like they were really keeping a close eye on things! Looking forward to making reservations for summer 2012 as soon as I decide when I want to travel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: stacbrit
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit and we were just as happy as the first time around. Playa Maya is a small hotel where the staff truly do their best to make your stay perfect. Everyone is very friendly, the service is top notch. The hotel itself is clean and the food is awesome! The location of the hotel is basically right around the corner form all the action on 5th avenue so you can either enjoy a quiet evening on the beach or walk up the road and get lost in all the shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach and value”
Reviews.Author: AgieLu
Reviews.Content: Playa Maya is situated on the beach right ahead of 5th Ave so perfect for beach time during the day and walking along 5th at night. The beach is perfectly clear of boats and there is an open swimming area which is great because I don't like the roped off swim areas. El Taj which is a luxury condo hotel just one hotel over, has a roped off area for boats so the people staying there don't really have direct access to the water. The rooms at Playa Maya are simple, clean and pretty big. Breakfast is included and there is a mini pool which is pretty much for hanging out with a drink. Staff is friendly and they offer cheap laundry service. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location, Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: MusicIsLife702
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya for 6 days towards the end of November. The hotel's only entrance is off the beach which we thought was pretty cool. We arrived about 4 hours too early for check in so we were given beach towels & grabbed a couple of beach chairs (both included in your hotel rates). Plenty of beach chairs & the staff was very attentive. Having been to Playa a few times, we've rented beach chairs before but would always have to track down a server to help us, but not here! There was always staff around ready to help us with a smile. There are several breakfast choices that are also included. We tried almost every dish & were never disappointed. For lunch I really enjoyed the chicken tacos & my fiancé still talks about the fish tacos. The rooms are cute & beachy, very clean & lots of room. We had a small fridge that was restocked with water every day which we thought was a nice touch. It was easy to get around town, short walk to 5th & a few blocks away from a Walmart & Mega, ferry to Cozumel is a just down beach & plenty of taxi's & collectivo's to take you to nearby places like Akumal & Tulum. We had a superior room with a view of the ocean & it was such a treat to see the sunrise in the morning. We truly enjoyed our stay here & are already planning our return trip in July. Special thanks to Jesus & Angelina, both always very helpful & friendly, & of course to Stephen for making the reservation process the easiest I have ever dealt with & for answering all my questions. Thank you so much! Stay here, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Small package, Big Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rasalus
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Playa Maya in early November. First off, this is not a big hotel. around 20 rooms total. No glitz here. No fancy, big nightclub. Just a hotel tucked away on one of the most beautiful beaches anywhere. You access the hotel from the beach. There is no direct roadside access. On arrival, you take your bags down to the end of 8th St (stops at the beach), and the hotel bell-hops take your bags around the beach into the hotel. Don’t bother renting a car. We didn’t need a car the whole week we were there. The 5th Ave. market is just a block away from the hotel. And there’s a Wal-Mart about 5 blocks up 8th St. from the hotel. The hotel itself was great. The front desk staff (Pablo, Maria & Yuliana) were most hospitable. They catered to our every need. They were always pleasant & professional to deal with. We had a few mechanical problems surface during our staff, but the hotel staff always accommodated us and usually provided a step-up solution. We relied on the hotel staff for recommendations on tours, instead of trying to deal with the time-share peddlers on 5th Ave. The staff set everything up for us with no hassle. The rooms were very comfortable and well cleaned. Some rooms had balconies. The balconies are not too big, but do offer a view of the beach. Wireless internet was provided at no additional charge. There is only 3 floors, and no elevator, so be prepared to take stairs up to the upper rooms. The hotel also has a nice restaurant where food & beverage can be purchased. You get a nice, free breakfast – and it is more than your standard continental breakfast. You can get eggs or pancakes if you wish. For the money, this place was a super deal. The beach accommodations are excellent. By staying in a room, you get access to a beach lounge chair (cushioned) with a large sun umbrella and one large beach towel. Drinks can be ordered through one of the restaurant staff members who keep a tab on the guests on the lounge chairs. Drinks were well made and a reasonable price. A great way to relax for the day. Early November seems to be one of the best times. It gets busy from January thru June with the European crowd, and of coarse it's busy at the Christmas holiday. Overall, this hotel is a gem. The front desk, restaurant and cleaning staff were all memorable. Mr. Ryberg (reservations) provided us with some great information in setting up our trip. Can’t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed are stay at the playa maya”
Reviews.Author: jjohns_11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Playa Maya Hotel. The location is excellent and the staff was vey accomodating and the service was personal. The food at the restraunt was some of the best that we had in Playa. The complimentry (I think) chips and salsa were delicious. My only reccomendation would be for future visitors to bring thier own toileries (shampoo and conditioner etc) and to also bring your own pillow if you are picky about a pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Am I glad we found this place!”
Reviews.Author: BriAnn0921
Reviews.Content: We've been to Playa del Carmen 6 times in the last 5 years but this was our first stay at Playa Maya - it won't be our last, in fact it became our go to hotel. Reservation making was easy, their communication prompt and thorough. Check in was a breeze, we were met at the end of calle 8 and the beach by a group of hotel staff that carried all our luggage into reception at the top of the stairs, finished some paperwork, checked in and they took our bags to our rooms. Rooms were big and comfortable. Wireless access available all over the grounds, big bathrooms and showers as well. Room had a table and two chairs, bed, small fridge and a flatscreen TV. Wireless was quick enough to be able to stream our home DVR to my iPad for late night TV viewing. Breakfast is included in the rate - choice of pancakes, waffles, eggs and a meat or fruit plate. Juice included too. We had breakfast every day, lunch and snacks on other days and the food was always very good. Beach service was excellent as well. We never used the pool or hottub but they were clean and always available. The location is fantastic. Right on the beach so off of sometimes noisy 5th ave, but close enough to be right in the heart of downtown. Rooms were always kept clean, plenty of towels and hot water and of course the towel art each day! Staff was always super friendly and helped with whatever we needed. Look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TinaSandFamily
Reviews.Content: Playa Maya is a wonderful little hotel perfectly located on the beach, one block from 5th Ave. The staff are friendly, the breakfast is included and delicious and you get to eat it with your feet in the sand, and the beach is fantastic. They stock your mini-fridge with water bottles every day, and their bar/restaurant prices are totally reasonable. On this trip I was with friends and stayed in a standard room with ocean view, which was clean and comfy with wireless access. Next time I go, I will be bringing my husband and kids and getting one of their two-room suites. Loved it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Pedestrian Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jcfpny
Reviews.Content: I’ve just returned from my sixth visit to PDC and fourth stay at Playa Maya. If you want to be on the beach, only steps from your room in a low-rise, safe, pedestrian area this is a great place at a fantastic price. The included (menu order) breakfast is legitimate – select from eggs, pancakes, waffles, bacon, ham, fruit, juice, coffee, etc. The restaurant/bar is open through around 6 pm. I bump all that is said about the staff – they keep the place nearly spotless in the difficult to maintain beachfront environment. A special note about housekeeper Angelina – along with great service, she’s the best towel artist ever. I didn’t have the heart to unravel any of her creations and she didn’t either – just kept adding more! By the end of my stay my room resembled Noah’s Ark and I must have had half of the hotel’s towels. Looking and booking at the hotel’s site is a bit awkward but work through it. Read the first part of the description carefully. To help figure some of the described room locations, first, on this site find a good photograph of the hotel taken from the beach (which incidentally runs north/south so the sunrise comes into your window and sunset is behind the hotel). The outer rooms on either side (orange/brown balconies, 2nd & top floors) are the “Deluxe Balcony” – widest balcony, top floor longest walk-up, but best view of sky. Closer in (blue balconies, 2nd & top floors) are “Superior Balcony” – king beds on picture’s south/left, double beds on north/right. View from the double bed rooms is slightly nicer because of some obstruction from the adjoining Hotel Alhambra. Same sky view situation as above. In the center (blue balconies, 2nd & top floors), looks wide but in actuality are connecting rooms - “Family Suites”. Other room categories are scattered around the 1st floor and pool area. A little study of the TA and hotel site pictures and you’ll figure out those room locations. Playa Maya’s site is a little intimidating when you want to check out room availability. Once you hit the blue “Reserve” button it asks you for your name, email address and dates before letting you see room availability. In the four years that they’ve had my email address I’ve never gotten any spam associated with this hotel. After entering your info, the next page shows some slightly different room descriptions. Don’t worry, keep going – click something and the next page lets you select “show all availability for these dates” along with the original room descriptions. After this, it’s all routine – a couple of quick emails, some credit card deposit faxing (again, all legit) and then you can start going through the TA PDC forums to see the food and fun options. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: dublinuru
Reviews.Content: Room was very confortable, just on the beach (very good area of the beach), location was great one block from 5th avenue, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better :-)”
Reviews.Author: loriluvstotravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is top notch. We have stayed here previously, enjoyed it so much that our wedding guests and our families stayed here for our wedding on their beach...Staff, facilities and management are top notch. The food is fabulous..love their club house, and the food for our wedding reception was delicious..We can't wait to go back ...

Reviews.Title: “Second time around”
Reviews.Author: T W
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Playa Maya before and it was excellent each time. Great location, great staff and great ceviche! It's a really nice stretch of beach along there, and Playa Maya is right in the center of it. The staff was quick to help us with anything we wanted or needed. The free water outside the rooms is a nice touch, we loved that, and really we only used a little. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and we especially loved the coffee. The rooms were clean and well organized with wifi in each, a nice television and no sign saying you couldn't flush the paper. All in all, this is a great place to stay and I know we'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “PLAYA MAYA EXCELLENTE”
Reviews.Author: TheMob
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!!!!!The walk from ADO bus station 10 minutes, reception was excellent, Nora and Maria very professional.The room was very nice and had plenty of room,bathroom had very big shower and Angelina kept room spotless all week long.The wait staff was excellent and took good care all week long,Jesus,Pedro and Luciano became my amigos.The food was great, breakfast very good, we ate lunch several days and enjoyed coconut shrimp,fish tacos,ceviche,chicken nachos and many XX's buckets. WE WILL RETURN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: SandyandSteve
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of everything. Just a short walk to 5th Street, the Ferry and great restaurants. There were several party places close by, however the hotel was quiet and peaceful when it was time to relax. The staff was amazing. Everyone was willing to help us out in everyway. I am a workout fanatic and they recommended that I go to "The Gym" closeby. There I was able to pay for the day and got a great workout in a couple of times during our stay. They have a Chiropractic Massage right there on the beach at the hotel, which was great for working out the kinks. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beach-Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prairie0644
Reviews.Content: Found this small (20 room) hotel on tripadvisor. Wouldn't have found it otherwise. It sounded too good to be true. We visited for five nights with our eleven-year-old grandson and it was all we expected and more. Would highly recommend. Right on the beach. Pool, hot tub, good swimming right in front. Spa services available. Excellent security. Just a block off the main tourist thoroughfare. Friendly staff, good service. Clean rooms. Fairly new hotel. We enjoyed the variety of towel sculptures awaiting us when we returned from our adventures each day. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A sweet little place!”
Reviews.Author: surlybooty
Reviews.Content: A fabulous view of the beach. We stayed on the top floor and enjoyed hanging out on the balcony in the down time after leaving the beach and before heading out for dinner. If you don't mind walking across a short stretch of sand, the location is perfect. So close to everything, but still so quiet. It's a three minute walk to the bus station and a five minute walk to the Cozumel ferry. The included breakfast was nice and we ate several lunches here while beach lounging. My faves were the ceviche and the fish tacos. The room was nice and spacious and includes a small fridge. The bathroom had several bottles on shampoo but no conditioner, so I don't know if they were out or just don't have it. The soap was kinda gritty which I didn't mind until I got badly sunburned. The staff were all super nice, but we're shy little folk so we didn't really make friends the way other guests seemed to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsG_2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in June and loved the hotel and especially the location. It is small and friendly and right on the beach, in a beautiful spot that isn't too crowded. The rooms are spacious and light and were cleaned to the highest standard every day. The breakfasts were delicious, large portions and a good selection. We ate here for lunch on several occassions too, having the food delivered straight to our sun loungers on the beach- perfect! The food was always of the highest standard and the staff were always polite and attentive. It was only a couple of minutes walk to busy 5th Avenue, but felt like a world away!

Reviews.Title: “A great honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: Wiggawood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent part of our honeymoon in Playa del Carmen at Playa Maya. We were welcomed into the room with a bed of roses, two towels shaped into swans, champagne on ice, some soft drinks, water, and beer. This was a great start to a great stay. The staff was always friendly and dropped off a bottle of water in our room each morning of the stay. The breakfast offered by the hotel was always delicious and great portions compared to other hotels. Playa Maya is right off the beach and it was great to walk out of the hotel, pull up a book and a chair, and sip on one of there great margaritas. The hotel is also two blocks from the main avenue in Playa del Carmen which offers great shopping and restaurants. You get a great view and a great bang for your buck staying at Playa Maya!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, on the beach and close to the main drag.”
Reviews.Author: Stranglersfan
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from our very first visit to Mexico. We decided a few months ago, after reading all the positive reviews on TA, to stay at Hotel Play Maya. I can only say that you are all correct! This is probably one of the nicest beach hotels in PDC. The staff, as most people have mentioned, are terrific! Special mentions ( As Stephen the owner mention to me that the staff like this part!) go to Nora and Maria at reception. Angelina, our wonderful room cleaner for the week (and her great towel art every day!). Jesus for the great service for lunch and drinks on the beach. The breakfast that is included is of very good quality as are the lunches when we decided to eat at the hotel beach area. Security i there after 10pm which is a nice touch also. The location is very good, it is a reasonably quite part of PDC, (in July anyway) and you can walk down La Quinta every day and be hassled to purchase mostly tacky junk from the local stores. That was without a doubt, the worst part of Play del carmen, but obviously nothing to do with this great hotel! The beach is clean and the sand does not get hot under your feet here! ( No idea why...I did ask a few people but no one seemed to know). My wife and I stayed in room 303 which had a decent view of the beach and Caribbean sea. My son and Mother in law stayed in a standard room on the first floor. Both rooms are of equal size except room 103 has a very small balcony with room for only 1 chair. Our room had room for 2 chairs on the balcony. The rooms themselves are spacious and clean. the bathrooms are a little small, and you do get to hear your neighbours showering everyday, as each bathroom faces out onto a neighbouring balcony!! ( that was a little weird but didn't bother me so much). All in all for the price, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. We would go back to Play May if we decided to stay in PDC again, but will probably try Akumel as it is not so touristy as PDC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Playa”
Reviews.Author: dcikon2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya from May 28 - June 5. We decided on Playa Maya after walking the beach and checking out the hotel on our previous visit to Playa del Carmen. This is a great hotel if you are looking for a nice, clean, and roomy place to stay directly on the beach. We booked 2 balcony rooms (superior and deluxe). The rooms had a dresser, closet, safe, and small refrigerator. I really appreciated the large towels in the bathroom. You rarely see hotels providing over-sized towels these days. We did have a little difficulty with the air conditioning at first, but found out we were setting the control on low instead of high. We did get the opportunity to check out other rooms at Playa Maya. The family suite is huge! If you are a couple or solor I definately recommend getting the deluxe or superior balcony room. I am glad that we did this. I like the views of Cozumel and the sea from these rooms. Breakfast is served in the dining room on the beach. We all ate the American breakfast the fast 2 days (eggs, bacon or ham, toast, and fruit). I then switched to pancakes a few times and then waffles. You can also order a lighter breakfast if desired. You do get your moneys worth in the amount of food served to you. Our nachos and chicken platter was full. It was also very tasty. One thing you MUST order is coconut shrimp. You get 6 jumbo shrimp in a mango sauce with rice and caulilower. I ate every drop of it! I had to compare this to the coconut shrimp that I age in Hawaii and this was probably better. There are beach chairs with umbrellas on the beach provided by the hotel. We spent time relaxing on the beach. It is nice being able to get up early in the morning and go for a swim. I need to comment on the staff. You will not find a friendlier or more helpful staff anywhere. We lost a new expensive digital camera while at Xel-Ha. Staff called the park every morning to check on the status of the camera. We did end up finding the camera. I can't thank the staff enough for their efforts in helping us. We will definately stay at this hotel again. This is one of our favorite hotels over places that we stayed in Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Cancun, etc. You can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: TysonDog37
Reviews.Content: I can't really write enough good things. Such a good value, such amazing staff, best possible location both in Playa, and in the area to explore, comfortable rooms, and a good value! And don't forget the free, made to order breakfast of eggs however you like them, meat, fruit, you name it! I would go back there the next chance I get. I have traveled all over Mexico and South America and this is one of my very favorite places. Oh and...the beach chairs and spot on the beach, in case you want to take a day off adventuring and exploring, is so comfortable! And the drinks and beach food brought right to you are also wonderful. Don't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise! We'll be back next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelrlynn
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in PDC, right on the beautiful, turquoise beach and right around the corner from Quinta Avenida. We walked from the ADO bus terminal to the hotel in about 5 - 10 minutes. When we got there, we weren't sure where to go as the hotels are located on the beach with no front entrances and in most cases no signs. Hubby started off looking, leaving me with the luggage at the end of Calle 8, on the beach and magically a wonderful Mayan with a Playa Maya shirt came running up, swept up my luggage and took me to the hotel, which, by the way is about 75 feet down the beach. I had to go back out and flag down my hubby who thought I'd been abducted luggage and all. Rooms and grounds are kept spotless by the excellent staff. Staff is very accommodating and most speak some if not fluent Engish. We rented a superior balcony room with views as nice as the deluxe, at a little less money. Rooms were cleaned and beds changed every day, with cute towel ar left behind. Breakfast, which is included, and is served under the palapas right on the beach, was delicious: a choice of 4 different entrees from fruit plate to eggs to waffles or pancakes. Plenty to eat and fresh squeezed juices. My only beef about breakfast is no coffee until 8AM. (I think they might have a Keurig in the lobby) We hiked a few blocks to Starbucks, but that got pricey. Starbucks in Mexico is expensive. Only ate 2 lunches there as we traveled about. Had the coconut shrimp, very good and the nachos very, very good. Multiple frozen margaritas and Daiquiris. Frozen Lime Daiquiri, yum! I hate to say too much as I want to be able to get a room when we go back next year! Fusion is just down the beach a few doors, nice to go and have a drink at night, you don't even need to put on shoes, and to listen to the music or see a fire show. Of note, if you stay in the "deluxe" rooms, you can hear the music from Fusion at night, we, on the other hand, staying in the superior, being set back in a little, never heard it when in the room. The Blue Parrot just up the beach also has a fire show at night. This was our first trip to Mexico and we fell in love with it. I felt like I'd come home, it's hard to describe. I plan to write some reviews of places we visited and things we did. Check my posts soon.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Playa Maya for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: bizzokiki
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my 5th stay at Playa Maya. This hotel has consistantly been great. This trip was an extra special one...honeymoon. Upon check in our towel art was especially lovely, decorated with rose petals. We were also given a complimentary bottle of champagne. As usual the room and entire hotel were extremely clean and we were greeted with many smiles. The front desk staff, Pedro and Nora, were especially friendly and helpful. Chairs were set up early ready for us to lay on the beach(comfortable cushions by the way). Breakfast(included in room price) was a good as ever! All of the food at the restaurant is so good. The coconut shrimp and fish tacos are in our top meals of all restaurants in Playa. The frozen drinks are some of the best in Playa too. Blended perfectly and very tasty mango and strawberry margaritas. We had a great vacation and perfect honeymoon, thank you to everyone at Playa Maya. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and value”
Reviews.Author: RicknMobile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week from 4/29-5/7/11. It was our second time to stay there. This was a repeat of our wonderful experience last year. The location cannot be beat. You are directly on the beach with excellent amenities, helpful staff and great food. We had a 3rd floor room facing the water giving us a great view of the Caribbean. Breakfast on the beach is included and always good. The staff is wonderful and friendly. They provide plenty of chairs and umbrellas for guests and bring the best food/drinks to you on the beach. We never wanted for anything. Should you want to plan any excursions the front desk will assist and make the arrangements. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Much Enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: theandys
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with three adult children stayed at the Playa Maya hotel for one week in january, 2011. The reservations were made by e mail with Stephen Ryberg who assisted me in ensuring that the three rooms booked were right for all of us. On arrival, the hotel staff looked after us and made us feel most welcome. The hotel is right on the beach (only access is from the beach) and also in the centre of town - so no car was required - we walked everywhere. Food at the hotel - breakfast (excellent) and lunches on the beach (with drinks) was also very good and we always felt well looked after by the staff who ensured that enough chairs and umbrellas were available for us right through the day. An assortment of restaurants are all around the hotel and we visited a different one each night and relaxed with some nice food with a few drinks. We felt safe at all times at the hotel and each day the staff checked with me to ensure we were happy and asked if there were any problems - we had none! The beach was nice and the water was clear, clean and warm. What more could one ask for - a nice comfortable hotel on a beach with good food and wonderful people looking after you!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to Mexico ever!”
Reviews.Author: numberfool
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to PDC and the Playa Maya hotel. If I told you everything wonderful about this hotel, it would only be repeating what so many have said before - it's great. The people there make the difference - I would name them all, but then this review would be too long - or I would forget someone!! We also made some new friends - from Canada and Syracuse, NY - I guess the best people just naturally stay at the best places! The restaurant serves delicious food, the drinks are great, the service is impeccable. We stayed in Rm 101 for 5 nites, but then had to move because we decided to stay for two more days and someone had specifically reserved the room we were in! We moved to Rm 102. Both are Deluxe Terrace w/ Hammock rooms. Rm 101 had a king bed, and Rm 102 had two doubles. But we actually liked 102 better - better (partial) ocean view and more shade in the morning as we drank our coffee on the terrace. Oh, and if you follow their instructions, and send someone around when you get there, they will come and get your bags so you don't have to "drag them through the sand". We got there at 9:00 p.m., and they were waiting for us and carried our heavy bags to the room. We were actually dropped off at 10th and 8th - the barricades were up - but it was a downhill two block walk to the beach down 8th - not bad at all. When we were picked up to leave they were able to come all the way down 8th - and again, our bags were carried across the sand for us. If there is anything you want, just ask. We had two Adirondack type chairs on our terrace - but it was difficult to get up out of them (we're old and out of shape) and we couldn't see over the terrace wall (too low to the ground) - so we asked if we could switch them out for two of the upright chairs like they had in the restaurant. No problem! Much more comfortable for us - and we could see! They even moved them again for us when we changed rooms. There are a lot of steps - and no elevator - so do consider that. Steve was very specific when we were deciding which room type we wanted - and it worked out fine. We couldn't have done the 2nd or 3rd floor balcony rooms. But we were perfectly happy where we were. Thanks, Steve - and please let your entire staff know how much we appreciate them!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best at Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: playadel50
Reviews.Content: When we arrived March 22nd , we were greeted by the staff on 8th ave . they carried our luggae to the front desk .. this hotel has the entrance on the beach . the staff is superb . Nora the front desk clerk greeted us with open arms , showed us the rooms . She was worderfull and very cheery and friendly . Looking forward to being back in 2012 but this time for 2 weeks . Love the idea of breakfast , feet in the sand . Wonderfull staff, Nora, Othman, Jesus , the cleaning staff . Nothing bad to say about this great hotel Loved it

Reviews.Title: “An incredible family vacation”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaShell33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I will be celebrating our 15 year anniversary in July as well as his 40th in May and what better way to celebrate than pick up our 11-year old and off to Mexico we go. Be warned that the lines at immigration in Cancun can take up to 90 minutes to get through and that's even before Customs! If you arrange for pick-up like us (we used Cancun Shuttle) then just keep this in mind. Now that I know how well the ADO buses work I would even recommend getting one of those straight outside the terminal and pay less for the trip to Playa del Carmen. Trip would probably take around an hour. The first thing to note about the hotel is that the entrance is only accessible via the beach. If your transportation is allowed to pass through the pedestrian zone of 5th Avenue then the nearest street is 8th, right at the entrance to the beach itself. You walk on the sand around the Alhambra Hotel and Playa Maya is the next one to it. We were dropped off on 6th and we had to drag our luggage over the sand past several hotels. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we went straight to the hotel's restaurant and ordered some food and drinks. Both came very quickly and we enjoyed fresh salsa and chips, sandwich with fries and some shrimp. Jesus was our waiter all week long and he did a great job. My son was already changed and in the swimming pool. It's not very large but enough to cool you off in the hot sun. As soon as our room was ready we headed up to 204. It was cool and perfect for the 3 of us. It was very clean, comfortable and had a fantastic view of the ocean. There was even a little hammock chair on our balcony. Now I would say that the only downfall to the room was the small balcony because it would have been hard for all three of us to sit there at the same time. There was a small fridge in the room that already had a few sodas, beers, candy, and bottled water. The beach was right on our doorstep and the sand was white and fine, the water a bit strong but warm and beautiful. It was funny to see a two foot wall of sand all along the beach. There's still plenty to walk on but I feel that in a few years they may have to fill it in again. If you love shells then you are going to love this beach! Breakfasts were filling - the ones included in your room price are pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon, juice and coffee. You can always get other things off the menu but you will have to pay for those. All this is served on the beach under the cabanas. Nothing like having sand between your toes early in the morning. Juan was the gentleman responsible for cleaning our room and he was brilliant. Not only did it always look immaculate but he made wonderful towel sculptures. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking along the many shops and restaurants of 5th Avenue. You will have many people trying to get your attention because they want to sell you a tour, or eat at their restaurant or buy silver and other stuff. Just keep walking if you are not interested. Plenty of yummy food out there - we ate at Agua Maya - tasty and fun to watch the waiters carrying drinks on their heads and then doing tricks with the flambees. Restaurant Parilla right on the corner of 8th and 5th was also extremely tasty. There is also plenty of gelato places and of course the American places like Subway, McDonalds, Haagen Daz if you need to eat that stuff. Try the really yummy sipping chocolate at Ah Cacao cafe - it's thick and sweet. We made trips to Xcaret Park and Tulum via the ADO buses and it worked out perfectly. The buses are air-conditioned and very comfortable and schedules and prices are good. The bus station is around 2nd and 5th Avenues. All in all this was an incredible family trip and I can't wait to return to Playa Maya hotel and Playa del Carmen sometime in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Better Late Than Never... I LOVE PLAYA MAYA!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ErinBrookeB
Reviews.Content: It took me awhile to get to this - but I am actually planning my trip back there again this year!!! The staff is incredible! and I have to mention them all...Lucio, Pedro (Peter), Jose Luis, Carlos, Jesus, Anesito, Nora, Othman, Juan and Felipe, they really made our stay unforgettable; I did not want to leave. I second everything my friend Susan wrote (a lot more timely that I did) - we had am AMAZING time and are already talking about how excited we are to go back!! I have been craving some of those amazing fish tacos and coconut shrimp - not to mention those wonderful breaksfast on the beach - so much to choose from!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: shellster
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd terrific stay at the Playa Maya.From our arrival in the evening where Mary greeted us so warmly and showed us up to our rooms until we left 2 weeks later it was a great stay. We love stretch of beach it is on .We loved our days lounging on our chairs under our umbrellas that had been set up for us.Jesus ,Carlos and Pedro were so attentive to us during our days to see if we wanted anything to drink or eat.I love the fact that you just run a tab and pay at the end that is so convenient so you don't need to bring cash down to the beach. This trip it was much warmer than last year when we were there so we used the pool as well as the ocean.It is a little pool but per sect for cooling off or a quick swim. The breakfast is a very generous portion.You get eggs ,meat a little fruit and toast ,coffee and juice.The service is great and so friendly . The rooms are a nice size with a small balcony .We had a hammock on ours and loved that. In our room we had a king bed that was very comfortable.The linens are nice and spotless.The bed is in between hard and soft ,we had no issues with it and slept very well each night.You may hear a little music from the hotel down the beach but really with the AC on not much at all.The rooms have a coffee pot in them with packets of coffee,that is nice if you are an early riser.My friend would get up each morning and sit on her balcony reading with her coffee until her husband woke.The decor is pleasant not too fancy. Again this year I will say honestly this is the CLEANEST hotel I have ever stayed in.Juan who cleaned our room for both stays does a super job.Everyday was spotless without a grain of sand to be found in the halls or our rooms.One day Kate went up to the room while he was working and he had the bed pulled out to the middle of the room cleaning under it.We tipped him well each day as he was a terrific cleaner and nice guy. We had lunch most days here as well and always had great food.I love the coconut shrimp but I think my new favorite is the fish tacos.My friend realy loved their soups and he is somewhat of a soup expert ,ha ha . Something we really enjoy about staying here is the size of the hotel.We were able to meet so many other guests.This makes it lots of fun,especially the one day when we had a storm and all gathered under the restaurants palapas for an impromptu party. Proximity to 5th Ave is super.Also a quick walk to Walmart or the Mega for supplies for the room. Booking handled very well and efficiently by Stephen .Any ? 's were answered promptly .He also had left us a bottle of Tequila for a welcome as we were return guests which was a very nice touch. The staff is the BEST !! Friendly,professional,helpful ,caring and fun.We have made some great friends at the Playa Maya. If anyone would like to private message me with any specific ?'s I am fine with that.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the beach, by far!”
Reviews.Author: Bumsi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week at Hotel Playa Maya. Much thanks to all the folks who gave advice and especially to Steve who made the reservation and financial transaction secure, efficient and painless. Steve kept us thoroughly informed, sent some local information and ensured we were well taken care of. Ok, Arriving at Cancun airport: This airport itself can only be described as a disorganized disaster. The luggage and customs process (lines) are in real need of efficiency tweaking (they should hire Steve), spring-break mobs did not help the disorganization at all. ;). Anyway, once we retrieved our luggage and made it through customs we walked on by all the timeshare, cab and other transportation hawks and just kept walking to the end of the terminal, the entire process took about 40 – 50 minutes. We stopped to change just a few dollars and headed out the door and went direct to the ADO buses. We were in luck and the bus was already at the gate and ready to roll. We bought our tickets for 110 pesos ($9) at the bus. The bus was basically empty for our 45 minute trip. GREAT way to travel, very comfortable, very clean and we highly recommend it! Any other mode of transportation is a rip off and you are just wasting your money. We arrived at the Playa del Carmen ADO bus station without incident, grabbed our bags and exited the bus station facing McDonalds on 5th Ave. We then made a left and strolled about four blocks down 5th avenue until 8th where we made a right towards the beach. When we hit the beach (150 - 160 yards), we turned right on the sand and approached Hotel Playa Maya (50 yards). One of the staff working on one of the Palapas once seeing us stopped working and immediately came and assisted us with our bags and escorted us to reception where Nora greeted us and made us feel very welcome. Check-in was fast and hassle free. Our room was not ready yet as we arrived around 10 am. However, our bags were secured and we were offered cold water, towels and asked to relax on the beach. We opted instead to go exploring on 5th and grab some lunch at one of the bazillion eateries lining the avenue. A cold Sol (a couple actually) and some chips and salsa while we watched all the folks walking by worked out fine. Around 2 p.m. we returned to Playa Maya and we were shown our room where we received an explanation of how everything in the room and hotel worked, breakfast times, TV, air conditioning, safe, etc. We stayed in room 301 (by far the best for ocean view on the premises and quiet, although there are no bad rooms), matter of fact we had an unobstructed view of the ocean even when lying in bed. The room itself was very clean and the maid kept it that way our entire stay. The bed was very comfortable, had several pillows and there was plenty of storage space unless you brought way too many things. Although, the bathroom could use a shelf for all that women stuff wives usually bring. The room also had a small table, two chairs, a fridge (stocked with two beers, two sodas and large bottled water – water only, is replenished daily), coffee pot, hair dryer, safe (uses a key which you must put the lock into the safe and then remove they key), great air-conditioning and a flat screen TV. Shower was large; had plenty of very hot water and the water pressure was fine. The balcony while very small fits two beach type chairs and a small drink table. It worked for us; we sat there at night or early morning for the fantastic breeze and beach watching. Towels and beach chairs with an umbrella are also provided with each room. The Playa Maya hotel staff was great, no make that fantastic! Everyone we encountered was very friendly and more than helpful. Food was good; drinks were cold and the beach was very nice (do not expect the super clean raked beaches of the big AI resorts. Way too many folks (slobs) unfortunately think the beach is a big personal ashtray and bottle cap receptacle. The beach chair area can get a bit crowded as chairs not being utilized by guests are rented out. However, this did not present any problems for us and we enjoyed every day. There were no large groups of spring breakers near the boutique hotels which was a welcome relief. All in all we had a fantastic mini vacation, great weather, great food and great staff. Highly recommended! Restaurants: Good restaurants are everywhere, read the reviews and print off the short and long list here on TA. I will say that we tried several, but found the best food at inexpensive prices at small mom & pop operations with just a few plastic chairs and tables with hardly any tourists. If you want excellent, inexpensive food, get off the big avenues and hit the side streets. Find El Fogon -- Tacos al Pastors is a must; do not let looks fool you. Also great is Las Cazuelas, and Las Brisas. Lastly, we would like to again thank and commend the entire staff at Playa Maya who ensured that our ever need was taken care of and our vacation was fantastic. They all went beyond just doing their job, they made our time with them fun, and ensured that we will be annual visitors. Regards, Jim

Reviews.Title: “Best Beachfront Hotel in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Maikaferin
Reviews.Content: I just cannot say enough good things about this hotel-- it was gorgeous, nicer than most of the hotels we have stayed at on the beach ( we usually just care about 4 walls and a clean room..) The staff was so friendly and kind, always working hard to keep everything neat and clean. The communication from the owner was top notch as we booked our trip. I was traveling with my Dad, and was so impressed!! Little details in the rooms-- modern conveniences, the rooms were not dated like others we had stayed at- the towel art was off the charts! Mermaids, swans, rabbits bedecked in seashells and hibiscus flowers! Maria at the front desk was so sweet- the wait staff were amazing- they were very kind to help us charge our phone ( it was a rental phone) and we had left the charger at home by accident. The coconut shrimp were SOOO yummy! All the food was superior- not only in taste but presentation. Everyone was accomodating and friendly. My Dad has since returned and we will continue to stay at Playa Maya whenever we find ourselves lucky enough to be in Playa! We only wish we had stayed at Playa Maya sooner-- the lack of beach had prevented us to do so in the past, but it was nice and sandy when we were there last. Go to Playa Maya- you will not regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: KSue63
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Playa Maya and we can't wait til the 4th. This hotel is a smaller personal hotel directly on the beach. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is outstanding, Pablo, Nora, Mary, Juan, and everyone at the bar and beach staff. Breakfast is included in your stay and there's nothing like having breakfast with your toes in the sand. I recommend trying the fish tacos and shrimp nachos. Yummy! You do have to access to the hotel from the beach. But it's a very short walk and if they see you coming they are right there to help with your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Yes!!!! to Playa Maya.”
Reviews.Author: DiJo2
Reviews.Content: We loved it; once again. Congratulations to Steve and the staff, they go above and beyond. Special mention to Pablo, Nora, (front desk) Othman (bartender), Raciel (restaurant and bar manager), Luciano, Peter, Carlos, Miguel, Jesus (waiters) and the beach guys Alberto and Luis. The rooms were cleaned daily by Fidel and his towel art was awesome. Six a.m. coffee and breakfast bars are a plus for us early morning walkers. Breakfast selections are varied and quite satisfying. We ate lunch and early dinners here several times during our stay. Dinner orders will be accepted until 5:30 p.m. Lots of items are large enough to be shared: shrimp nachos, club sandwich w/ fries. Their salsa is one of the best in town. Easy walk to nightlife and good music along the beach, as well as to anywhere around town. We felt very safe and comfortable here and in Playa del Carmen in general.

Reviews.Title: “we miss playa maya, the beach and the wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: lwspilates
Reviews.Content: We are back home in Denver now, cold weather and all. My husband and I had a wonderful week-long vacation in Playa del Carmen at Playa Maya. I found the hotel on tripadvisor and read all the reviews. Our room was on the top floor, had amazing views and was very clean! I liked the bathrooms a lot - they had pretty tile, updated shower and granite sink and the sounds of the surf came thru the window. Our small refrigerator served our needs and the complimentary beer on the first day and water everyday was very thoughtful. We became attached to all of the staff. They're the best! Loved the big breakfasts on the beach and couldn't find a reason to leave for lunch. The lunches were awesome! We loved the chicken nachos and fish tacos (split between the two of us) and the pico de gallo was the best we've had. Drinks were large and cold. A real treat. The only downside is they don't serve dinner, so we had to walk a few blocks into town for that. :) We loved the location, price, cleanliness, service and will definitely come back. Next time we will bring our teenagers! Warning - it is really hard to leave Playa Maya...

Reviews.Title: “Budget Travelers Dream”
Reviews.Author: Joeshu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this nice little hotel in the middle of vibrant Playa Del Carmen. Wife and I were first timers to Mexico and chose Playa Maya as our home base for a week in late Jan. Centrally located ON THE BEACH and one block off of bustling pedestrian fifth ave, this family atmosphere, cozy hotel has charm to spare. Value comes in bunches here. Booking with Steve exclusively through email was different but simple. He's never more than a few hours max to return any questions. Paying without actually talking to someone was a first for us. Clean, spacious rooms, beautiful ocean views, free wi-fi everywhere, and ample breakfast daily with your toes in the sand is all included. But it's the staff here that completes the perfect vacation equation. Nora, Mary, Othman, Pedro, Luis, and Fidel deserve particular mention for their warmth and helpful ways. Everyone wears a permanent smile and has a helpful response to your questions. We enjoyed fine massages with chiropractic adjustments on the beach here too. Two people, one hour was $50usd. We used their laundry service mid week also. Quick, clean, and really affordable (We're bringing half the luggage next time!). We took the ADO bus to/from the airport (4 blocks away) and used collectivo's (6 blocks away) to travel around the incredible local area safely and with ease. With so much to do around here, why would anyone ever want to stay stuck on an all inclusive resort??? The beach bar has perfect fishbowl margaritas and the food is freshly cooked and presented well. They don't offer dinner here but there must be 50 or more wonderfully different restaurants to experience within walking distance. What a fun town! Look elsewhere for expensive luxury rooms, isolated seclusion, over the top hand and foot service from snooty staff members. This is not your place. But for us average "pooristas", it's paradise found! Thanks Playa Maya! We'll be back again someday!

Reviews.Title: “It is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hxxallen
Reviews.Content: I spent lots of time searching hotels around Playa Del Carmen area in Mexico, based on the good review, we finally chose this hotel. So my expectation is high. The hotel is good, there is nothing wrong. But it is also not a dream vacation as some reviewers said.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel. Wonderful Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Teddison
Reviews.Content: Wanted to take my wife and kids (9 & 6) to somewhere warm and with great beaches. Playa Del Carmen was great. What made the trip even better was staying at Playa Maya. What a fabulous small hotel on the beach! Incredible service. GREAT food. Clean rooms. Quiet evenings (good sleep). RIGHT ON THE BEACH. Pedro, Nora, and Maria in the front desk are awesome. Always willing to help you (they even helped me retrieve my lost phone in a taxi). The restaurant staff is outstanding as well. Luiciano, Sergio, Padro, Jesus, Carlos, etc were all excellent. Always having a smile on their face and providing excellent service. Breakfast is included in the room rate. This is not a toast and jelly breakfast - it is a eggs, bacon, pancakes, fresh fruit, etc type breakfast. Great tasting coffee too. My kids loved eating breakfast on the beach and when done going out and playing while my wife and I finished eating (we could always see them because you eat on the beach!). Pool is small but you do not use it due to the Ocean (which was warm by the way). I highly recommend Playa Maya. Booking with Stephen was easy. They help you when you arrive, clean rooms, and great food & location. Tip the workers well - they deserve it. By the Way - My wife and I always felt safe the entire week there. Note: Playa Maya is probably NOT the place for you if you are looking for some hard partying, etc. Probably need to hit Cancun for that. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service during a family health crisis.”
Reviews.Author: Donna8708
Reviews.Content: Stephen, the hotel manager, is an absolute gentleman in the finest sense of the word. When emergency surgery forced our family to cancel our New Year's trip to Mexico, we knew that our hotel costs for the holiday week (over $2000) were non-refundable. Stephen was very understanding and immediately went to work trying to rent our rooms. He assured us that if the rooms could be rented at the last minute, he would refund the appropriate funds. He ran banners on their website offering the rooms at a discount and I got updates every few days. In the end, most of the rooms were rented and the hotel refunded virtually the entire amount to us. Unbelievable Customer Service! When I'm well enough to travel, we will definitely be heading to Playa Maya so that I can shake hands with these wonderful folks.

Reviews.Title: “Always The Best”
Reviews.Author: CiaoAmico
Reviews.Content: We have been to The Playa Maya many times. This hotel for us is so comfortable that it is like our 2nd home! They exceed every expectation we have every time we are there. There is no better!

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason the place gets good reviews”
Reviews.Author: yazzman13
Reviews.Content: I have to give props to playa maya. It's a well run little hotel right on the beach. I am always on the look out for a bargain and whilst you can get cheaper hotels in Playa ( a lot of the little B&B's go for around 45/50US$) I doubt you would get as good value for money and such a lovely setting. I had a basic room at 100$ a night with 150$ discount for staying 7 nights. If there are 2 of you its very good value. For me the main pluses were its location and value. Bang in the middle of the action , right on the beach yet secluded enough not to have to hear the 5th Ave hubbub. Free drinks on arrival, free bottles of water, free sunbeds + towels, free internet, free breakfast (a good breakfast as well) on the beach feet in the sand under a palapa. Pleasant staff. My only critiscism was that despite me asking for a quiet room I was in one just around the corner from reception area which meant I had to hear people milling about in the morning. Pay a bit more and you might get a room on a higher level where noise shouldnt be an issue. That said I put a couple of earplugs in and it was fine. In general I found Playa more touristy then I was used to. It's no Cancun but its still a major resort and not really a conventional town where the locals interact with travellers other then serving them at bars, shops and resturants. If you want to see some local colour get off 5th Avenue and go for a walk around. You will have wasted your time just hanging on the beach and seeing the very toursity 5th avenue. Saying that ,5th Ave has some suprisingly hip bars and restuarants The beach is wonderful if a little crowded. For those who want something a little more chilled I would suggest a colectivo ride to Akumal down the coast where you can snorkel with turtles on palm fringed beaches. I also recommend a visit to Coba, some jungle ruins where yuo can pretend you are Indiana Jones and climb one of the temples.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: cltutell
Reviews.Content: The Playa Maya was the perfect hotel for our stay in Playa del Carmen. The location was wonderful, right on the beach and only one block away from 5th Av. shopping. Our room was very clean and the towel art superb. We received a large bottle of water every day along with other refreshments. The bed was very comfortable, mush more so than the Mexican standard. The wait staff was excellent and attentive. The beach chairs were plentiful and comfortable. The beach was clean and wide. The decor of the hotel was striking with the blue and white.
