We did not get to use the pool but it looked beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful experience at Playa Maya.....”
Reviews.Author: Buffetfan79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 7 night stay at Playa Maya. We were there December 4th through the 11th. Once again we had a wonderful experience at this tiny little gem on the beach. Since I have already written 1 review on the this place I wont go into great detail. I would just like to say once again the staff are really what make Playa Maya truly your beachfront home. From the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out we they made us feel so welcome and comfortable. I would like to say big thank you to Nora who greeted us and got us settled in on our first day and also assisted us with our excursions throughout the week. Thank your to Lucio, Peter, Carlos, Othman, Jesus and all of the beach wait staff for making our trip so very relaxing. And also to Juan for keeping our room so nice and clean and for the wonderful towel art each day. This time around we stayed in room 302 which was a deluxe balcony room with an amazing oceanview. The room included a small coffee pot which was a nice addition from the last time we stayed. Also the new beach was amazing, the last time we were there was before the major beach restoration, it was a much wider beach this time. The only negative thing I can think of was the pool seemed to have a film on it, which made it not so inviting, and it is very small. Not a big deal to us at all because we would rather swim in the ocean anyways but if you are looking for a hotel to swim in the pool this place wouldn't be for you. All and all another great trip to Playa Maya!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront Bliss”
Reviews.Author: misslassie
Reviews.Content: This was the second stop on our honeymoon and our first visit to Mexico. We caught a taxi from the bus terminal in Playa and felt silly after we realised how close the hotel was. On arrival they initially couldn't find our reservation - so I'm glad I had printed out all our email correspondance and confirmations - but they had a free room with kitchenette so there wasn't a problem. After dropping off our bags to the room and changing into our swimmers we were on the beach in ten minutes! The hotel has an amazing beachfront - we spent most of our five days on the deck chairs in the sand and ate many lovely meals in their beachfront restaurant. The breakfasts were a lovely inclusion and we enjoyed the coconut shrimp and fish tacos on a few occasions for lunch. The only entrance/exit to the hotel is via the beach, which was slightly annoying as you'd always get sand in your shoes - but it always reminded us where we were! Our room was on the ground level between the pool and the reception - so to ensure privacy we always had to keep the curtains closed so we generally felt a little cooped in if we returned to the room during the day. In hindsight, I would have paid the extra to have one of the rooms higher up in the main building. We loved the towel art when we returned to the room each day - we got some really amazing ones when they realised we were on our honeymoon so ensured we tipped the housekeeper well - we loved the surpise each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel right ON THE BEACH!”
Reviews.Author: PhilandJulieMarko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Playa Maya a couple of weeks ago and it was everything we'd read about it on trip advisor. It's a cute little hotel RIGHT ON THE BEACH! We litterally walked out of our room, through the pool area and out onto the beach! The service is excellent! The food amazing! You MUST try their Fish Tacos they are awesome! And the hotel is clean and well kept. The staff are professional, courteous and helpful. We'd like to thank them for a loveley stay! All our great waiters! and their wonderful chef! The breakfast that comes with the room is plentiful and excellent! The beach is gorgeous! Aqua blue water and white sand. It's kept very clean! Laying on a lounge chair looking out at the blue water can make the hours go by very quickly! The Hotel is a great value for the money. When you try to find the hotel, don't look for it from the street! The ONLY entrance is from on the beach down Calle 8. You'll see their sign. The isolation of it makes it even more special! When we go back to Playa we plan on staying here again! One other recommendation! We took a tour with a tour company called Alltournative, their "Jungle Maya" Tour! Excellent! Fun all day long! Check out their website! I think it's Alltournative.com

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya is muy Padre!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Volaregirl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved staying at Playa Maya, it's a great small hotel, perfect location right on the beach! Not lux, but clean and nice! Making reservations was no problemo, and Steven the manager was great (there was some 'back and forth-ness' via e-mail on my part, as to how many nights, room we wanted, etc. and he was very accommodating). ALL of the staff were just great, warm and professional. The rooms were kept clean (and yes the 'towel animals' were a fun surprise every day! I stayed there with my mom and sister and they absolutely adored all of the employees too. It was cool that the entrance was right on the beach, really intimate. I loved coming 'home' at night and slipping right in while the 'waves were lapping out quietly in front. The breakfast (which was included) was excellent, e.g. eggs, fresh fruit, what a nice bonus (and eating right on the beach was great)! We hung out right in front of the hotel most days and swam, eat, drank, read because it was SO relaxing! There was an 'almost' hurricane (that never happened), and the staff were great, calm, and kept us in the loop about the whole thing! You can get a massage at the hotel right on the beach, fantastico! If you want to stay at a 'laid back' smallish hotel, with a perfect location, not noisy, with an awesome staff, then Playa Maya is for you!

Reviews.Title: “My First Choice to Stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Tmpy
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a stay at the most wonderful hotel in Playa. Do not hesitate to stay at Playa Maya! This was the best choice we made and love this hotel for many reasons. Location, employees, cleanliness and the fact it is right on the beach. We arrived, were quickly checked in and on the beach within 15 minutes. Room was much larger than others I have stayed in and the beds were very comfortable. Small refrigerator was stocked with different types of soda, a few beers and large bottle of water. Bathroom and shower was perfect size. Never had an issue with water pressure or hot water. I couldn’t get over how clean the room was. I always seem to find something wrong with a room and I could truthfully say I don’t have one complaint. Juan did a wonderful job keeping our room spotless and making the most beautiful towel art. Every morning we sat on the deck by the pool and enjoyed a cup of coffee, checked our email and the walked a few steps to the beach for breakfast. The breakfast that is included in the room price is wonderful. Eggs, bacon/ham, toast or your choice of pancakes or waffles. I don’t remember everything that you can choose from but there are four different combinations. The best thing about this is you are right on the beach. Nothing like greeting the morning on the beach looking at the ocean for as far as you can see. Employees were very attentive and always were there with more coffee or juice. Playa Maya is perfectly located. Close to everything, especially the hustle and bustle of 5th Avenue but far enough away from the evening noise. Right up the beach is Fusion and Bad Boys Beach Bar all within walking distance. Employees and everyone we met was very friendly and greeted us by our names. Nora and Maria at the front desk always had a smile and the waiters couldn’t do enough for us. They anticipated our every need and were always available to answer any questions we had about Playa, dinner choice or nightlife. There is a small pool but with the beach right there we didn’t use it. They were replacing the hot tub so we didn’t get to try that but will next time. Speaking of the beach the water was wonderful. Sand like flour and water was calm and peaceful. I didn’t come across any rocks or major seaweed. Umbrellas were placed strategically between the comfortable lounge chairs and drinks and food are brought to your chair whenever you want. One thing I must mention is the owner of this wonderful hotel. Out of the blue a hurricane popped up two days prior to our trip and was headed for the Yucatan. The day before we were to leave he emailed me as well as personally called to let us know all fees would be waived if we would like to cancel and postpone our trip. He was very personable and genuinely concerned. Unfortunately or should I say fortunately our airline would not postpone our flight without a fee so we decided to go. Thankfully the hurricane was very small and turned a little further north so Playa was unscathed. Beautiful weather for our trip! As soon as I got home he emailed me again to inform me that I left something in the room. How honest his employees are! He was so kind to notify me before I even realized it was not in my possession. The employees tried to come after us to give me the item but we were gone. We used Cancun Express to get to and from the airport and they were there waiting for us so we left immediately. Now he’s working on a way for me to get my items without having to pay an exorbitant fee for shipping internationally. I can highly recommend this hotel for quality, honesty, cleanliness, attention to their guests, and location. I can’t wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: susan040
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Playa Maya. The staff is incredible! I can't say enough about how great they are. Lucio, Pedro (Peter), Jose Luis, Carlos, Jesus, Anesito, Nora, Othman, Juan and Felipe made our stay unforgettable; I did not want to leave. I traveled with a friend and we had an economy room which was comfortable and fine for us since we basically used it only for sleeping (the beds were comfortable). It was fun to walk in everyday to see the new towel art - sometimes we hated to dismantle it because it was so pretty. Breakfast was included, and was very good, not your typical continental breakfast choices. The food and drinks are great. (Yes, the fish tacos and coconut shrimp are as good as everyone says, but we liked everything we tried.) The location is also wonderful, just a short walk from 5th street, but you feel miles away when you are relaxing in your beach chair looking out at the water. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Struck Gold with Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: AnnapolisMatt
Reviews.Content: What can I say, having been everywhere in the Caribbean and Central America I was apprehensive to stay in Mexico. Through the recommendations of a friend, they suggested Playa del Carmen. A little touristy, but close to a lot of things. Now, the most important decision, accommodations. Do we go all inclusive, boutique or somewhere in between. We are not big all you can eat people, or all the watered down drinks you can drink people. I spent about a week picking out possibilities and zeroed in on Playa Maya. Playa Maya is a smaller hotel, with only 18 rooms. However, it is one of the only smaller hotels that is nestled right on the beach. Location, location, location. You are also about the midway point on 5th street, so right in the mix of it. However, you can't see it from 5th Street. This is good, because at night, you do not hear any of the noise from the local clubs or bars, which can be an issue with some of the places that back up to 5th. It is technically at the corner of 8th and 5th....but on the beach. Your cab can take you down to the beach, he just has to signal to the Cop that typically is directing traffic at the corner by that time of the day. So, the amenities: We got a standard balcony and for 7 days it was $575 a pretty solid deal. Couple that with $600 for R/T airfare for two, it was a cheap vacation. The room was actually pretty big. Everyday, after the room service fixed up the room, we found a new towel animal. My wife loves these, I could take it or leave it. We still had a partial ocean view, even though we did not pay for one. The staff, I would say, is the second part of this equation that really made this an awesome trip. They are all really nice, and we especially enjoyed Lucio who was our waiter at the restaurant on the beach and the front desk staff. Don't worry about not speaking Spanish down here, most of them speak adequate English. You will not find a better place to eat, especially for the price, than the little beach restaurant at Playa Maya. You should really try the Octopus Tacos, they were phenomenal. It is opened everyday until 6pm. They will also bring you out food and drinks to your chairs if you desire. Every room comes with a daily continental breakfast. It is not what you would consider an "American Continental" breakfast (ie: an apple and muffin). It is in fact a full breakfast, eggs, meat, toast, potatoes and of course some type of pico di gallo. If you like habinero (which I do) you will love PdC, as it comes with every meal. Another important note, the section of the beach Playa Maya is on is perfect as there are not very many people there and they always had beach chairs open. What a lot of people fail to realize is the larger accommodations you stay in (number of guests/rooms) the more people the hotel has to cram into a small section of beach. This was by far the number one complaint other travelers voiced to us while we were out on town. No problem here, as there are only 18 rooms. You are also very close to the ferry to Cozumel; about a 5-10 minute walk. The water is crystal clear. On the days we didn't have a near miss from a tropical storm, it was incredible. They have a small pool, but it is mostly for decoration, no one ever gets in it. I only have one con, and its not that big of one. Since none of the bathrooms have fans in them (typical for most hotels-fire hazard), they have vents that either open directly to the outside, or into the hallway. Our vent opened up right around the corner from the Check-in desk, so you can imagine mornings where I had just a little bit too much habinaro and beer; we usually just ran the water to mask any noise. Others in the hotel, must not have realized that and I'll just leave it at that. Overall, I would say this hotel is perfect if you are looking for that quiet, beachfront and relaxing vacation. We had fantastic service and a great time. This is the first time my wife has ever said she would come back to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: thebillylids
Reviews.Content: We found Playa Maya and Playa Del Carmen thanks to Trip Advisor. My husband and I travelled from Australia and wanted a complete change with great food, drinks, entertainment, beach, shopping. Our holiday ticked all these boxes. We originally booked for 5 nights at Playa Maya but loved it so much we extended to 12. Playa Maya is in the best location on the Playa beach just a minutes walk down from 5th Avenue on 8th. The joy of arriving at a hotel where you had to cross the sand to gain access was a thrill from the start. No need for marble entry halls here ! The hotel is very small - I think 18 rooms which added to the personal feel. The pool was very refreshing after being in the ocean all day. Loved the decor - really felt like I was actually in Mexico and not in a large international hotel/resort. The rooms are fine - not marble/gold however very large, huge bed, spotlessly clean with fantastic views. We were in room 301 which was full oceanview. The staff were all fantastic. Everyone seemed to really enjoy working there. Alex (barman) served the best margarita's we tried in Playa (we tried a few) and the shrimp tacos on the beach were unbelievable. The office girls, Mary & Nora, was always there to help and basically you felt like this was your temporary home away from home. Luis, beach boy, would set up your beach chair/table/brolley and get anything you need with a smile ! Capitan Gracelle ran a tight ship and was always around for a friendly chat about life and living in Mexico. Everything from booking with Steven to departing 12 days later just went perfectly. Playa Del Carmen is now one of my favorite destinations - just wish it was closer to Australia !! We already are missing Playa Maya and Playa Del Carmen - cant wait to come back !! Thanks everyone !! ps - Gracelle - can you create a Facebook page so we can keep up with happenings of Playa Maya !

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Playa”
Reviews.Author: ColesL
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I haven't written a review on this hotel before now. My husband and I just had our third stay at Playa Maya this past April. I can't say enough good things about the place. The staff is wonderful...they treat you like family. After staying the first year, the staff recognized us when we visted the second year. Nora at the front desk is a joy. The hotel is very clean and near everything on 5th avenue. If you're looking for 5 star, this is not the place for you. Dont' get me wrong, I love swanky hotels, but this place is great. Right on the beach, and the food is excellent. The includes breakfast really is a "full" breakfast. Not too miss lunch choices include the chicken tacos, coconut shrimp, and even the Playa Maya burger. Lucio is a great waiter there. My husband and I are Michigan State fans, and we were there last year when MSU was playing in the Final Four for the NCAA basketball tournament. We brought four MSU white hats and gave them to the staff... they were very appreciative! You can't go wrong with this place. We've seen the same people there over the last three years, so that has to tell you something. We met a very nice couple with whom we've been going out with each time we've been there. We're in the process of booking for next year. BTW, we're a very young acting, early 40s couple, if that helps. I really don't think this is a place for young kids. There's a small pool, though, if you do have kids. Place is awesome...give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect in every respect”
Reviews.Author: KKE11Y
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at the Playa Maya in the 2 room delux suite for 8 days in July and we had a wonderful time. I will start with the employees which is the best asset of this hotel. Everyone at this hotel goes out of their way to provide the best service to all who stay here. Louise, Marie, Othman, Peter, Alex & EVERY employee bends over backwards with their unmatched service & desire to please. (sorry not to name everyone) The Playa Maya is a small beachfront hotel, with a nice refreshing pool, 2 palapas restaurant in the sand,with excellent food between 8th & 6th Aves. Perfect location, & the perfect vacation for people looking to stay close to 5th ave. There are about 20 rooms that are clean & have ample amenities. The cleaning service is excellent as well. The ONLY thing I would recommend to the management or owner is to get better bar stolls at the small bar. They are solid wood with no back to them.....small complaint, but if the chairs were more comfortable....i would of had a couple more happy hours here! The best things about this hotel are: The employees, the beach location, margaritas, ceviches, fish tacos & the best service .......Thanks Playa Maya personnel !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa Maya!”
Reviews.Author: yanitza7263
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Playa. Playa Maya is the perfect place to be, right on the beach and a short walk to 5th Aveunue. The room, the premises super clean. The staff absolutely nice, friendly and helpful. We stayed on a 3rd floor room with ocean view. Large room, plenty of storage. The girls were great in making sure our stay was pleasant. We did take a look at a room with a jacuzzi but we opted to stay in our room, the room we saw was just a little too dark for us and did not have an ocean view. I'm glad we stayed in our room. We had a lot of options for breakfast and lunch. The Coconut Shrimp and Fish Tacos were so good. Overall, you can't beat the location, everyone was great and I'm looking forward to our next visit to Playa Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value and location”
Reviews.Author: dksoeser
Reviews.Content: If your primary requirements are being on the beach, convenient location, and a clean/quiet room... look no further. Booking was a snap, with Stephen promptly responding to all of my e-mails and even going out of his way to assist me with a request after I'd arrived. Awesome manager. The beach in front of the hotel is lovely, with 2 rows of chairs including 1 right near the water. Apparently this wasn't permitted until recently. The front desk staff are sweet as can be and very eager to help. The restaurant serves the best Mexican food in the area. It's too bad they're only open for breakfast and lunch. I could live on their chips and Playa Maya shrimp. Most of the other places near 5th Avenue serve food that is either overpriced or mediocre. Speaking of which, Carboncitos is sooooo overrated. A couple of doors down on the beach is a place called Fusion. They have nice beachfront seating and great live music at night. If you want bargains and feel a little adventurous, venture far off 5th Avenue. You'll also escape the incredibly annoying and sketchy hawkers who'll have you saying "No Gracias" in your sleep after a couple of days. Go out of your way to load up on 10 peso coins. It seems like NO ONE has change in Mexico. This is true at the hotel, in restaurants, and in taxis. It got really annoying, unless you don't care about tipping people. Speaking of taxis... they're all looking to rip you off. Each one will quote you a different price for the same trip. This place desperately needs metered cabs. As far as service goes, don't expect people to fall over themselves trying to anticipate your requests. Sure, everyone is friendly enough, but if you want a check, or a drink, or a table, you'll usually have to flag someone down to get it. We used Cancun-Express for airport transfers. They are super reliable and professional. But again... no change. Cancun airport was a breeze, which was such a relief after hearing assorted horror stories about delays, crowds, and timeshare irritants. We had zero problems, though that might have had something to do with flying JetBlue. Other bits of info... we spent a day at Xplor. Tripadvisor reviews make this sound like the greatest place on earth. I can't fathom why. Also, I stayed in a jacuzzi-garden room. It was nice to have the outdoor space to dry our wet/sandy clothes. The jacuzzi was a cool evening luxury as well. Anyone going to the Playa who isn't looking for a big resort should definitely stay at Playa Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Paradise”
Reviews.Author: CTCOUPLE137
Reviews.Content: I must first say that this was our second trip to this little slice of paradise in Playa Del Carmen. After reading countless reviews last year, and despite the swine flu scare, my husband and I traveled to and stayed at Playa Maya for five days in 2009. What an incredible experience! Never in the time we've been together have we repeated a vacation destination, but this place warrants a return visit. That being said, I don't think we were even home a month last year and we began making plans for our return. This property is owned and managed by a gentleman named Steve who lives in the U.S. and corresponds solely via e-mail. Initially, I thought this might pose a problem...boy was I wrong. With ease I was able to ask questions, make reservations, and secure payment. All of his responses were timely, and prior to leaving I printed out my correspondence and receipts to make check-in and potential upgrades easier. That brings me to the staff at Playa Maya. What a competent group of individuals! Nora personally greets you daily, and not only is quick to offer a smile and helpful guidance, but exhibits a genuine interest in hearing about your plans for the day. Likewise, Pablo, who works 2nd shift, was always willing to assist us with our tours and offer some wonderful restaurant recommendations. I must say what impressed me the most was the work ethic demonstrated by all the individuals at Playa Maya. There are not too many places in the U.S. that could be managed from abroad as successfully. Upon arrival I inquired about a possible upgrade and was offered their "A" suite. Right up front, I was told that there was a possibility we may have to move at some point. However, since this stay was for a greater length of time, my husband and I opted for this extra space and we were not disappointed. The suite is located in front of the hotel entrance near the pool. We had a kitchen area complete with coffeemaker, fridge, and microwave, as well as dishes and storage containers. The hotel initially stocks the fridge with assorted beverages, provides a large bottle of water daily, and even had a canister of coffee for us to use. Closet space was ample and we could easily unpack and settle in. Noise was never a factor, and we enjoyed the close proximity to the pool and sundeck. Pablo kept us posted about our move, and as it turns out we only needed to relocate for the last two nights of our stay. Again we were given the opportunity to upgrade, and we spent our last two nights in a second floor room with an incredible ocean view! Housekeeping services and creativity with decorative towel art was impeccable throughout our stay. Daily breakfast is included, and choices are both ample and delicious. Coconut shrimp and fish tacos were an amazing lunch choice, and afternoon cocktails were generous in size. Thanks to all the guys, Lucio, Othman, Jesus, Carlos, and Peter, for your attentiveness, and for never letting my husband's coffee run out! The beach area has been renovated and is quite expansive when compared to last year. The hotel provides you with daily beach towels, upon your return of the used, and Alberto was always at the ready to set up an umbrella once our chairs had been selected. I must also say that the hotel now has a night guard. Although I never felt my safety was in question, it was nice to know that someone was actually there and was diligently checking room keys. Personally speaking, I admire the work that goes into Playa Maya everyday. It still amazes me to watch the employees completely assemble and disassemble the restaurant and beach area daily...no easy feat! I think we all should remember that unlike in the U.S., these individuals work for very meager wages and still manage to smile and accommodate. If we can't learn a lesson from their action, perhaps we could tip appropriately for the niceties we"re afforded! As far as our transfers and excursions,my husband does extensive reading and researching prior to any vacation. Fortunately, this often allows us to not only make the most of our time, but also of our money. First and foremost you should know that the public transportation system, or ADO bus, is a motorcoach complete with comfortable, air-conditoned seating, full length movies(in Spanish of course), and a bathroom. The ADO bus services the Cancun airport, and will transfer you to the bus station which is a short walk from Playa Maya for under $20. Just be patient! Upon arrival, there may not be a bus waiting, but there will be plenty of people and taxis trying to convince you to use their services for about triple the cost. Stop at information and ask for the ADO window...they're available in both terminals. We used the ADO buses throughout our stay, taking it to Xcaret, Coba, and finally back to the airport. Purchasing tickets was easy and they accept credit cards. It's recommended that you buy your return ticket to the airport the day before. Although they have a continual schedule starting early in the morning, you don't want to be told that the bus is full when you have a flight to catch. Speaking of flights and airports, do yourself a favor and eat or bring food with you to the airport...$6 dollars is a little crazy for a bag of M&M's Our excursions included a full day snorkel tour with Mexico Blue Dream, parasailing, Ek Balam and Rio Lagartos with Aldebaran tours, and as previously mentioned Coba and Xcaret. All experiences were amazing and highly recommended. Please e-mail me should you have any specific questions, or look for individual reviews that I will post about the specific tour companies listed. As far as dining experiences, we ate at different restaurants everyday...there's too many not to. The only one I would avoid is Casa Adela. Although I had read positive reviews, and the atmosphere was eclectic and interesting, I felt rushed, food quality was mediocre, and my 3 a.m. wake up call was a reminder for me not to repeat or recommend this experience. So many good choices, El Fogon, Java Joe's, Los Rancheros, El Pirata, Ajua Maya(amazing flambee), La Pesca, Carlos & Charlies, Tropical, Ristorante Da Bruno, 100% Natural, La Bodeguita(awesome atmosphere and Cuban food), Gelato Factory, Caio Gelato, Aldo Gelato, Dairy Queen, and Ah Cacao. Also, don't be afraid to eat from the street vendors by the ferry dock...great chorizo tacos and fresh fruit cups for under $5! I realize that I may have been a bit long winded, but with that being said, I certainly hope that I was able to convey some helpful insight. Will we return to Playa Maya?...we're already talking about it and we've only been home for 12 days. While 5th avenue and the shopping (hawkers) gets played out quickly, we both agree we would return not only to the sanctuary of Playa Maya, but to see the friends we made along the way! Thanks again for an incredible vacation experience!! Batman & Robin (Nora, that's just for you!)

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place...”
Reviews.Author: westernstargal
Reviews.Content: The owners have a beautiful place in Playa! The staff was attentive, and extrememly friendly...always with a smile. The restaurant offered delicious food, and very reasonable prices...and the service was outstanding!!! The rooms are perfect...exactly what you need to make your beach vacation....a little piece of heaven in Playa!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: MrBoingo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Playa Maya. We had a very nice stay in this small hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the location is perfect and the on-the-beach restaurant is pretty good. Breakfast is included and lunch prices are reasonable for being on the beach. Only minor quip would be a little more water pressure in the shower. The room was a little tight for 4 people (2 small kids), but I think the size was probably appropriate to the price. The A/C worked well. I would definitely recommend the Playa Maya, mainly because of the staff, the location and the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT, CANNOT WAIT TO RETURN!!!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheWayCA
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Playa Maya on May 29, got settled right into our room and went out to eat. Room was clean, front desk staff friendly and helpful and hotel was PERFECTLY located. We got a lot of restaurant recs from Pedro at the front desk (Nora was great too!!), and received wonderful service in the bar/restaurant and on the beach from Jesus and his coworkers. The food was wonderful - breakfast included 3 options: 1) continental w/tea/coffee/juice and toast, 2) all of number 1, plus fruit, or 3) all of number 1 and either eggs w/ham or bacon OR pancakes w/ham or bacon. Their fish tacos are delish, my husband LOVED the Playa Maya burger, and we both really liked the chicken nachos. Tip: If you get beer on the beach, splurge and get the bucket - they refill your ice and it keeps your beers cold longer, otherwise you need to drink it fast because it's so hot there. The pool was beautiful, although we opted to swim in the ocean instead, and our housekeeper was wonderful. All in all, we had a great experience, would recommend the hotel to anyone and absolutely cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place to experience the beauty and fun of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: KPGAtl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Playa Maya was a wonderful experience for us. We spent 4 nights there at the beginning of our trip to the Yucatan and would have loved to stay longer. It is a charming boutique hotel right on the beach only one block from the "happening strip" off restaurants at night. The staff is so pleasant and helpful and we loved eating on the beach with the sand under our feet. The rooms were very clean and pleasant with good views. Great location for activity if you can pry yourself away from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Spot in the World”
Reviews.Author: leighannryan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa for 10 days and it was the perfect vacation, spent 5 days in 2006 and vowed to come backk and stay much longer. All the great comments on this site are true and then some, there is not one negative to say. The management does an excellent job, the ratio of staff to guests is incredible. The staff is constantly cleaning, painting, repairing even though it looks perfect to me in the first place. Nora is a great assett, she was very helpful in offering advice on excursions and making calls for us. The room was cleaned thoroughly each day by Angelina and she made the most original towel art I have ever seen, and I have been on 10 cruises and have seen a lot of towel art. The staff seems to anticipate your need before you are even aware you have a need. Of course the food it to die for and the free breakfast included is awesome, it kept us full till late afternoon. The staff can't seem to do enough for the guests and if your looking for a carefree beach vacation this is the place, can't beat the price, the value you receive if something you don't run into very often. If you are in the market for a "jellyfish" the gourds that the locals make, try Ricardo on 6th st, just east of 5th avenue, superior to most I looked at and made with real glass not plastic, makes a difference when it is hanging up in your house or patio. Have travelled all over the world but the Playa Maya is my very favorite spot.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya is still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bizzokiki
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at Playa Maya and it is still wonderful. The hotel is super clean, great beach location & close to 5th Ave, staff is friendly and helpful, food is AWESOME. The coconut shrimp is still one of my favorite things to eat of all time. The included breakfasts are big and tasty. We ate eggs with bacon or ham everyday. Toast, juice and coffee were also included. The staff did an extra special job for me this time...they helped my boyfriend(now fiance) surprise me by creating a beautiful environment to propose to me. A table for 2 set up under their palapa in the sand with wine and candlelight. Thank you everyone at Playa Maya!

Reviews.Title: “Toes In The Sand”
Reviews.Author: catz9886
Reviews.Content: What a great beachfront location to spend 9 nights. From our third story balcony, we could see the beautiful ocean perfectly. The room was very comfortable, clean and suited us well with a mini frig. Juan cleaned the room with care each day and made sure we were always replenished with water and bath needs. Nora, at the front desk, greeted us by name upon our arrival and booked all our trips perfectly, even preparing a box lunch for us the morning we had to leave before the restaurant started serving breakfast. She is a great asset to Playa Maya. The servers in the restaurant took great care of us all day long while on the beach in the great chairs they provide. They learned our names, our drink preferences, what we liked first thing in the morning for breakfast and what we liked to end a day with! Thanks, Jesus, Carlos, Othman and Lucia. You guys rock. We loved our stay here and think you would to. While this is not a large, big AI with tons of amenities, it does have what we needed and wanted~ a small, quiet, intimate boutique hotel on the beach where you start your day with your toes in the sand for breakfast and well cared for! We had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “10 day fabulous stay at the Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: CJ99_Regina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playa Maya from April 25th to May 5 2010. Loved everything about the hotel! The location on the beach can't be beat. The maid cleaned the room spotlessly every day and the front desk and wait staff service was excellent. The rooms were roomy, clean, fresh and great a/c. Showers were great, lots of hot water. High speed internet access so we could contact our kids at home, made it easy to stay 10 days (and not want to leave). I would stay here again in a heartbeat, great value, excellent included breakfast with delicious coffee, juice and a choice of food items included with the room rate. We ate here several times for lunch and I had some of my favorite lunches here - excellent ceviche, delicious shrimp tacos and the Playa Maya coconut shrimp were awesome. Giant margaritas at a decent prices and buckets of beer for a good deal too. It was great being beachfront, with access to a lounger and umbrella and then going up to 5th and beyond for dinner after a day at the beach. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about my stay here, would recommend it to anyone for a fabulous vacation. Nora and Pablo at the front desk were courteous and helpful if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: smooey
Reviews.Content: We just returned and stayed outbound for one night in the Deluxe room as we have two kids (9 and 13). The place is very tidy and well cared for. The staff very friendly and professional. The breakfast which was included allowed you to choose from 3 generous options on the menu- not just a cheap buffet set up. The beach is very pretty and there is free wifi throughout the hotel. We really liked it and were very comfortable at the hotel. If we return to Playa Del Carmen we would definately stay here again. Thanks to the very nice staff who served us on April 25/26.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE OUR SECOND TRIP HERE”
Reviews.Author: MarthaBarrett
Reviews.Content: We loved the Playa Maya and this was our second trip to this great hotel. This trip we were able to stay two weeks. Staff are fabulous, breakfast is great, location is the best and love the towel decorations. However, this year ours were a little lacking in dazzle... . Always so much fun to see what towel creation is made each day. We will be back next year for sure. Martha & Barrett

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me...”
Reviews.Author: klb607
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights at Playa Maya at the end of March in room 204, a double with two beds and a small balcony with a beach/pool view. I had friend staying with me for a portion of my trip and the room was spacious and comfortable for two. The hotel is conveniently located on the beach just a couple of blocks from 5th avenue so it's easy to walk everywhere. Being on the beach with no roads on either side makes the place very quiet and peaceful in the evenings. During the day the beach area and restaurant were always lively. I really enjoyed meeting some of the other guests and all of the staff at the hotel and restaurant were wonderful. Getting towels, beach chairs and umbrellas was quick and easy and food and drink service on the beach was first rate. I loved this little hotel. it was spotlessly clean and well maintained and the whole place has a peaceful, happy vibe that all of the staff and other guests I met seemed to share. There was a mix of young couples, families with kids of all ages, grandparents and middle aged single travelers like myself and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves at Playa Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel One of our best vacations”
Reviews.Author: 4Gs
Reviews.Content: Took the ADO bus from CUN. About $32 for 4. Was easy. One stop about 7 blocks from the hotel. Took the collectivo from 2nd Calle and 15 Ave (about 8 blocks) for $3 each way to Akumal. Highly recommend Akumal and the collectivo (van/bus) Walked 5 blocks several times to Walmart for things we needed. Breakfast on the beach (included) was really great. Eggs and bacon, hotcakes or fruit. Small tip to have your umbrella set up was worth it. Several dive trips and dive/snorkel to dos ojos cenote with Dive Mike's. They did a great job. Restaurants-Ceviche and Fish Tacos and Playa Maya were great. Casa de Agua was the best. Fine dining. Resonable price for what you got. Recommend a trip to Alux for the bar but the food was slightly below average.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best”
Reviews.Author: Doris5555
Reviews.Content: We were at Playa Maya the last week in January. We chose this small hotel because it is right on the best beach and it is in the center of town. The hotel and and restaurant staff were very friendly and attentive, answering our questions and making us feel at home. The room was super clean, well maintained and the bed was very comfortable. I like that each room has its own water heater. There was plenty of very hot water for a really long shower. It was wonderful to be served a full breakfast under the palapa on the beach every morning. It is easy to see why so many people are return guests to Playa Maya, it is almost like having your own beach front home in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, basic & clean accomodations, minimal amenities”
Reviews.Author: esdugo
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the location...prime spot one block off 5th Ave, directly on a very wide beach. The only entrance to the hotel is from the beach- no street access. You have to walk on the beach past the Hotel Alhambra which is on the corner. This makes it a quiet location- no street sounds at night or loud clubs nearby, although music was played at the outdoor restaurant and by the neighboring hotels most of the day. You could often hear 3 different kinds of music being played at once while sitting on the beach relaxing. Suggest bringing ear plugs or your own MP3. The rooms are very small and basic. Don't recommend for more than 2 people. Mini fridge chilled very well, was stocked with bottled water. Bathrooms have built-in hairdyers, are very small and have little counter space or storage space for personal items. Our shower pressure was very low, but was fixed after we brought it to their attention. They even let us use the shower in another room until ours was repaired. Very impressive service by the front desk staff. We were given room 301 first because of the nicer view, but it had a king size bed (we had requested 2 doubles) and the balcony was tiny, only big enough for 2 chairs. They moved us to room 102 which was a little more spacious and had a large terrace with hammock, 2 lounge chairs and a small built-in table w/ 2 stools. Lots of space to dry your wet stuff in the sun. Room 102 was very conveniently located, which we really liked. Easy in & out for anyone who wants to avoid stairs, since there is no elevator. You have to walk up & down some stairs just to get into the hotel, so it is not handicap accessible. The A/C worked really well, though the remote control is a bit tricky. They have cable TV, with most channels in Spanish with subtitles. 2 or 3 channels in English. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. There is no clock in the room- we used the TV guide channel to tell time, and used the hotel wake-up call service when needed. Amenities are minimal. Nice open air restaurant on the sand, serving breakfast & lunch, with free breakfast for hotel guests. Recommend ordering the fruit plate, pancakes or scrambled eggs (w/cheese). Real good chicken nachos and ceviche. I tried the coconut shrimp because of all the rave reviews I read here, but found it to be overhyped. Too sweet for my taste. Service was very good, and you could even get food brought to your beach chair. The very small unheated swimming pool was cold & could not be used until May or June. The outdoor jacuzzi does not use hot water. It is the same temp as the pool, which was a big disappointment on the cool breezy days. The beach chairs are comfortable, with cushions on them. Apparently there is a local ordinance that does not allow placement of beach chairs more than 20 meters from the hotel. About 80% of the width of the beach is not chair-accessible. Unless you bring your own. (strange but true). This causes everyone to be packed close to each other. My husband moved our chairs closer to the water one morning and they warned us that was illegal, and moved the chairs back. Police on ATVs are regularly patroling up and down the beach and several life guard stations are nearby. You will be constantly approached by locals selling goods or services, which can get annoying when you're trying to relax, but they are not aggressive. The beach has been replenished and is now very wide and very nice. There was some seaweed floating in the water, not that big a deal, and the clarity was not what we have experienced in the past, probably due to recent rain and high winds. We are used to being able to see our feet when standing in the water, and this time visibility was maybe a foot or two. But when we went out scuba diving the visibility was much better, about 50-60 feet. One major advantage of staying here is that you don't need a car or taxi. Everything you could possibly need is in walking distance, and the terrain is so flat, you can walk pretty far very easily. Recommend walking down to Playa Mart located on 5th Ave. across from the ferry dock pier to get basic necessities, snacks, drinks, and souveniers (they take credit cards, which many stores don't). 5th Avenue is a pedestrian-only commercial zone about 2 miles long. This is the "touristy" part of PDC, kind of like a beach boardwalk, lined with shops, bars, restaurants, gelato/ice cream shops, good for strolling and people-watching. This is a great place to stay if you're looking for a basic, clean oceanfront room at a reasonable price, and plan to eat out and spend most of your time outdoors. If you are accustomed to all-inclusive resorts and high-end hotels with lots of amenities, you might want to look elsewhere. Feel free to contact us with questions.

Reviews.Title: “My grade for Playa Maya is "B"”
Reviews.Author: maumeeriverrats
Reviews.Content: We reviewed many, many hotels before deciding upon Playa Maya. We were there from March 11 to March 18, 2010. The reports on Trip Advisor are pretty accurate but I was disappointed that the water in the shower did not stay warm for very long. This was not a problem for my husband, who takes quick showers, but for me it was a real problem. I did mention this to the staff; they responded that I should mix more cold water in with my hot to make the hot last longer, but it doesn't help enough to give you time to shave your legs!! The location of the hotel is wonderful and the staff is great too. The food and drinks at the bar/restaurant were always delicious. The continental breakfast was more than the typical continental breakfast with bacon or sausage available and any style eggs, french toast, waffles or hot cakes, or even a fruit plate. There was some noise from neighboring bars if you went to bed early but it typically stopped around midnight. Friends of ours stayed at another hotel and had music until 4:30 a.m. The rooms are not five star but are very clean and have all you really need available, including a mini refrigerator. A fresh, large bottle of water is placed in the mini-frig each time the room is cleaned. There is also a mini-safe. I had many questions for Steve, the owner, before arriving, and they were always answered promptly. The beach is awesome since the restoration. We would consider staying at the Playa Maya again but would honestly investigate other possibilities just because of the shower issue.

Reviews.Title: “Like most others say, this was a great hotel that worked at all levels”
Reviews.Author: nycastle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Playa Maya in mid-March, 2010. We chose the hotel based on reviews from TA, and I will have to agree with all the positive things said. Playa Del Carmen is a fun town, albeit a bit too touristy. Staying at this hotel, on the beach and away from the crowds on the main drag, is fantastic. The rooms are comfortable in size, get good sunlight (but still have blackout shades) and are cleaned immaculately every day. The staff could not be more helpful, more friendly or more concerned with your well being. From the front desk people to the restaurant guys, even the maintenance man who fixed a minor problem with our shower (hot water was running out; fixed by the end of the day), they were all professional and courteous. By the end of the week, we were all friends and it made it all the more hard to leave. The breakfast that is included is a real breakfast, not just fruit and toast. It of course included fruit and toast though. I didn't have to put my shoes on until the end of the day when we would walk around town or go for dinner. Having breakfast while barefoot in the sand is the best way to start the day, every day. And, worth noting, the food at the hotel is quite good. Breakfasts were solid, and the fish tacos and coconut shrimp we had for lunch were excellent. If you like big, sprawling resorts where you don't get to explore outside those walls, this is not the place for you. If, on the other hand, you like smaller, boutique hotels with their own flavor and a real local feel, coupled with all the positive things mentioned above, The Playa Maya is a great choice. We will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: jherrle1
Reviews.Content: We opted for the Playa Maya based on the trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed. This hotel has a lot to offer -- direct access to the beach, right off 5th avenue where all the action is, helpful & friendly staff, clean rooms -- AND is very reasonably priced. The breakfasts included with the room are also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: spartanfan1992
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are accurate. When planning my trip to Playa Del Carmen I decided to split my stay up between a large all-inclusive resort and Playa Maya. Hands down Playa Maya won over the all inclusive. The location can't be beat as it's a block or 2 off of 5th Avenue. The service was excellent and the staff really goes out of their way to make sure you are taken care of. As a solo traveler I would recommend this hotel based on the service, and it's location near 5th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “One night, thanks to snow”
Reviews.Author: dwkestner
Reviews.Content: Our flight home was canceled and I wanted to be on the beach for at least one night. this was our third visit to this hotel but I had, for cost concerns, opted for a nice off beach hotel for the bulk of our trip. Booked a superior room, amenities similar to deluxe rooms previously stayed in. Beds as always very nice, and the lack of road frontage ensured the peace and quiet so sought for in a vacation. Included breakfast well above average and as in my past visits the restaurant/bar as good as always. Given the prices of this hotel, $10.00 us charge for wireless internet (there is complimentary use of wired computer in what used to be the fitness area) seems a little unreasonable. The beach is amazing, instead of the waves practically lapping at the front of the lounge chairs, the beach extends forever,. it seems. The staff was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Playa Maya!”
Reviews.Author: DiJo2
Reviews.Content: Once again, we were not disappointed with our stay at Playa Maya. The same excellent service, very clean rooms and an absolutely gorgeous beach. It just doesn't get any better than this. Knew most of the employees from the past 2 years and that speaks volumes in itself. The staff go above and beyond to make your stary enjoyable. The beach restoration has to been seen to be appreciated. It's actually "mind boggling". Can't say enough positive thing about Playa Maya. A new feature at breakfast were waffles if you chose the full American breakfast; each day the accompanying veggies varied. Home fries, cactus with chorizo, cactus salad, cheesy potatoes and fried potatoes, your choice of eggs, pancakes or you could have the fruit platter. In addition, there were several other breakfasts not included in your room. Either way it was a win/win situation. Kudos to Raciel for the service in the restaurant and on the beach. The coconut shrimp are wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Family atmosphere makes for great stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelLadySt_Paul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya the first week of February. This was our third time. What makes this hotel so special is the family atmosphere. The entire staff does their best to make your stay enjoyable. I attribute this to the management provided by Delmy and Steve. When you talk to the emplyees they tell you that they really enjoy working there. This year the beach had recently been expanded and was much deeper than other years. The fish tacos are the best I have had anywhere. The location is perfect for an easy walk to restaurants and night life on 5th avenue, and the hotel is quiet at night, making it easy to get a good night's rest. It is a great place to flush your mind of life's stresses.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: BeachDLT-50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Christmas break this year based on all the positive input from the Tripadvisor reviews. The reviews were right on the money. The staff is very pleasant and goes out of their way to make you feel like you're at home. The location is perfect! One block to the middle of 5th Avenue and you can walk in either direction to many great restaurants. We never felt uncomfortable and didn't worry about our 18 and 20 year old sons that stayed out at night. We're returning for the same period next year and would recommend this hotel highly. It's unpretentious and a nice break from the all-inclusives that we've stayed at up until now. We can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous small hotel on beach”
Reviews.Author: MOWO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya 24th to 27th Jan 2010. When we arrived 2 staff were there to greet us and carry our suitcases over the sand to the hotel. We were late booking so did not have a sea view but had a jacussi room which meant we had a small secluded shady space to sit in which was wonderful. The breakfast and lunches were great - basic and tasty. The staff were exceptionally friendly. Easy access to main street and all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I still daydream about our great time there!”
Reviews.Author: judark
Reviews.Content: I meant to write a review as soon as we returned home around this time last year. I never did, but have thought of our time at Playa Maya so frequently that I still wanted to say just a few words. The comfort, staff friendliness, beautiful beach, delicious food ...all were better than even expected! I POURED over tripadvisor when I planned our vacation & was SO happy that all those previous reviews were exactly right - I HAD indeed found the best beachfront hotel there was! We even decided to stay a bit longer than originally planned because of what a great time we were having, but they were booked after our reserved time. So, we just went over to Cozumel & tried out an all-inclusive. We quickly learned that that was NOT for us & that the charm, calmness & personal attention at Playa Maya was definitely the best. Oh, and we stayed in both the beachview & the garden room (we knew beforehand that we'd need to change rooms due to being booked). I must say that we thoroughly enjoyed both rooms. The beachview was, of course, beautiful, but the quiet, pretty garden space with a jacuzzi for the 2 of us was wonderful as well. Also, the hotel is very quiet at night (which we loved) but is also so close to everything that if you want restaurants, bars, etc...it's a VERY short walk away. HIGHLY recommend Playa Maya!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: msstylist
Reviews.Content: To sum it up Quick,...big group every february,..it's an annual thing....Love it every year! Great Staff, love them all, great mgmt! Rooms,..always clean with fresh stock of water, and cute towels on the bed to make ya smile,..restaurant awesome food and service,..pool not huge but will to to cool off if ya don't like the oceans salt.!! AWESOME! Can't wait to go this feb.! 2 weeks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can believe all the great reviews!”
Reviews.Author: liznash
Reviews.Content: Since I use Trip Advisor all the time to plan our trips, and thoroughly enjoy the reviews and forums, decided it was about time to post a review of my own. Without going into lots of detail, I would just like to confirm that ALL the good comments made here about Playa Maya are absolutely TRUE! Our trip was originally scheduled for the first week in May, during the height of the swine flu scare. Steve was more than accommodating in allowing us to cancel our reservation. We were very fortunate to be able to rebook for early December and the email reservation process was very easy. The first word I look for in any hotel review is CLEAN.....and the Playa Maya is CLEAN, CLEAN, CLEAN. The staff is wonderful.....friendly and attentive. LOCATION is perfect.....right on the beach, yet only one block from 5th. Included breakfasts are great. Enjoyed our evening strolls on 5th and trying a different restaurant for dinner every night. The pool is small, but we never used it, with the beach and ocean right out our front door. I would have liked a coffeemaker in our room, but this turned into a non-issue since fresh coffee was available in the lobby every morning at 7am. One morning, the beautiful sunrise woke me earlier.....took an enjoyable and uncrowded walk on 5th and found a Starbuck's a block away that opened at 6:30am (only made it there that one time). In my opinion, this is the perfect hotel for those travelers who would like to have a non-AI experience. Small, nothing fancy......just a wonderful location with a great and friendly staff, easy access to 5th, and very reasonable prices for both the rooms and food. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “It's a terrific place. We had a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: DebMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness is a top priority at this beach hotel. Quiet. Good value includes breakfast selections. The rooms are not elaborate but have everything you need plus flat screen TV & mini-refrig. We spent our days relaxing on the beach enjoying the service of the long-term friendly staff...delivering to us our orders of their delicious food and cold beverages. We've stayed here several times and we'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Week at a Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: packerfan2
Reviews.Content: I will start out by saying that this was our first trip to a non-AI after six visits to different AIs all over Mexico. Our main reason for the change was cost. As a teacher, I am pretty locked in when it comes to travel during the school year. That means I can go only at the peak times, like Christmas. When we started researching our trip, we found that AI prices at this time were sky high, so we decided to find a small hotel in the heart of Playa. We made a list of our must haves for a hotel, and then started at the top of TA’s list of hotels until we found the one with everything on our list. Playa Maya was the hotel we found, and wow, are we glad we did! I have to repeat what all the other reviews have said. The staff is what makes this place special! Everyone from the front desk people to the waiters to the cleaning staff went out of the way to make our stay incredible. We had a slight problem with our toilet the first night. We called the front desk, and someone was in our room within 1 minute to fix it. That is service you don’t get at very many places! I think the people alone are the reason we will return. Even booking was a breeze with Steve. We ended up changing our reservation, and he directed to the room type that best met our needs. He really payed attention to what we wanted. We had room 301, which is a superior balcony on the top floor. It was perfect. We had a great view of the beach, there was a small balcony to sit on, and we could listen to the waves in the evenings. We would have liked to sleep with the patio doors open, but music from some of the beach bars was a little loud. That’s okay, because it got pretty warm without the AC anyway. We thought the room was a nice size for our needs, and the bed and pillows were nice and comfy. The bottled water daily was really nice, and we like the fridge in the room too. Breakfast on the beach was fantastic. As others have said, there is nothing like having your toes in the sand right away in the morning! The included breakfast was more than enough for us, and the variety kept us satisfied all seven days, so we never ventured off resort. We really liked being able to get up from breakfast, walk a few feet, and be at our beach chairs for the day. Drinks and lunch were great too. We ate lunch here five times, we had drinks daily, and our bill at the end of the week was under $150 US, which we thought was really reasonable. Their Miami Vices are fabulous, by the way! :-) At night, we walked a block up the street to 5th Avenue, then meandered up and down side streets and the main drag. We never had a bad meal, although some stood out more than others. We loved El Bistro at La Tortuga, Bistro 524, and Carboncitos. We watched the Packers win at Tequila Barrel, the Badgers win at Bistro 524, and Minnesota lose at Carlos and Charlies and from the comfort of our balcony! There is nothing about our trip that we would change, except to make it longer if we could! Thank you to everyone at Playa Maya for making our vacation special. We are already planning our return trip, this time with the kids. And we honestly don't know if we will ever go back to an AI again!

Reviews.Title: “The kind of gem you look for, but rarely find”
Reviews.Author: NorthPaw42
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Playa Maya in January. Everything remains fabulous!! Small boutique hotel -- intimate, clean, reasonably priced, free breakfast served in a palapa on the beach, free wireless, wonderful food (try the octopus tacos!) and drinks on the beach or poolside patio. But the BEST part of Playa Maya is the STAFF. From the maids, to waiters, to desk staff, to beach/bellboys, everyone is so friendly, helpful, and truly intent on serving the customers. At the end of the week, we feel like we are leaving family. Henry and Chris Schultz

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: grp1121
Reviews.Content: We found Playa Maya on the internet and it was a true gem. We are used to staying at more luxurious hotels but we found that this hotel, though not as fancy, had everything we wanted and more. We loved being right on the beach and eating breakfast under the thatched roof in the sand. Everything was very clean and the staff was extremely friendly and attentive. We enjoyed massages on the beach which were great! The location was wonderful. We would spend the morning on our beach chairs and then walk over to 5th avenue for lunch at an outdoor cafe. Then back to the beach chairs. It was wonderful. We will go back to stay at Playa Maya again.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya-Simple, yet Sufficient!”
Reviews.Author: IlliniGuy01
Reviews.Content: Playa Maya's top attributes are cleanliness and simplicity. Rarely have I vacationed in Mexico and enjoyed such impeccable and attentive service. The staff is always available and willing to help in any way requested without being overbearing. While the rooms are in no way luxury they are above all sufficient and CLEAN and the location provides one of the absolute best locations on the beach in Playa to base your vacation. We thoroughly enjoyed the on-site, couples, beach massages for $50/hr/couple!!! We explored other hotels on the beach in Playa and could not find anything that appears to extend the same value as Playa Maya. A big thank you to Stephen and all of the staff. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple clean hotel with a great beachfront location.”
Reviews.Author: Buffetfan79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 7 night stay at Playa Maya yesturday. We found the hotel to be very simple but nice. The rooms were not huge by any means but they were plenty big enough for our needs. The room we stayed in #303 (superior oceanview) had a very small balcony with a nice oceanview. The neighbors bathroom window was on our balcony, kinda awkward but not too big of a deal. The one thing we thought the room was missing was a coffee pot. We like to get up early and sit and watch the sunrise from our balcony with a cup of coffee. We had to bring our own coffee pot which again wasnt too big of a deal but it would have been nice to just have one in our room. The location of this hotel is awesome. It is literally steps from calle 8 and 1 block up is 5th Ave. Right along calle 8 there is a little mini mart and currency exchange which was nice. The beach at the hotel seems to change day to day. When we first arrived it was really rocky, then mid trip it seemed to rebuild itself, then by the end of our trip back to being very rocky. This was a concern we had because we saw it from other posters pictures but it was not a big deal at all though because just steps down was a nice sandy beach. The staff at this hotel were really wonderful. They were all such nice people. They made us feel so welcome. Aide at the front desk was so sweet and Luicio one of the waiters on the beach did such an awesome job taking care of us on our trip. The free breakfast was very good, you could choose from eggs or pancakes with bacon or ham and it came with coffee or tea, juice and toast. The fish tacos and the chicken nachos were great for lunch. The frozen drinks were very good as well. Overall I would say if you are looking for a simple, clean, budget friendly hotel with a great beach location than this would be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “best reasonable beach place in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Melchic
Reviews.Content: Took us a while to get back to writing about our recent stay at Playa Maya but after checking in to see some comments we felt like we should. You just have to wonder what some people are expecting! I mean, fabulous location right on the beach, just a minute or two on foot and you're on La Quinta (in other words, where you want to be for both beach and in town stuff), great friendly people there (hi Juan and Alfredo!), very clean (cleanest place of the places we've stayed at in Mexico, which between us means a lot of places!), looks just like on the web site (better, in some ways), breezy booking with Steve (even after we asked for split arrangements, in 2 different room types, because of a latescheduling prob). But the best of all, and the reason Playa maya is 5 out of 5, is that you get all this at very reasonable prices! This is saying something especially the way prices have gone up in Playa on the beach over the past few years. We split our time between a standard room and a jr suite, and with the discount for a week, we ended paying barely over 100 bucks a night even with the taxes included per night. So 50 bucks a night for each of us for THIS place! Of course if you want Ritz rooms or something, there are many other places you can look at. And look at their prices, too! LOL We had nice clean comfy rooms with great AC and some late night TV to relax with if we weren't out or to catch up with the news on and all, and the kitchenette was nice in the jr suite one evening, though we usually ate out. Which reminds me, great food at their restaurant! We both thought it was as good as anywhere else we ate on our trip. We also recommend Carbonsitos, which they told us about at the desk. Easy short walk, but about everything is! In short, this is a great affordable beach hotel in Playa and you will only be disappointed if you are looking for luxury setting and amenities. If your happy with a regular level of that, and want to be treated right during your stay and also when paying for it, check them out. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but with great location and service”
Reviews.Author: TravelDreamin82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya whilst Ida was passing so we probably didnt get to see all that Playa had to offer, but there were a few days where we were stuck in our hotel room, which helps with this review! The room (Ocean View - good view) was quite basic but had all you need for a no-fuss beach holiday. The hotel itself is on the beach - literally, there is no street facing entrance! So gives the place a very safe and secluded feel to it. If your not really into seclusion, your steps away from busy 5th Avenue (I didnt once hear noise from the resturaunts or bars there). At times we felt a little unsafe and harrassed on 5th Avenue so Playa Maya was like our little home. The staff are all very friendly and the room is VERY clean. The boys in the resturaunt were always so attentive and friendly. The hotel's restuarant is on the sand, which is lovely in the morning for breakfast. This hotel would be great for guests wanting a cheap hotel on the beach that is close to everything (and clean) - I know I would stay here again for the pure convenience. It isnt overcrowded or noisy, more like the feeling of a cosy Bed and Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: hmoody
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with six other friends, vacationed in Playa del Carmen and stayed at Playa Maya hotel. I was very impressed with the exterior of the hotel, before we even checked in. The colors of this quaint hotel were bright and inviting and what I loved the most was the main entrance which is right on the sand, facing the beach. The entire hotel staff was ready to help us with our bags and anything else we needed upon check in. The service was impeccable. Playa Maya has a beach front restaurant with delicious food. Out of all the places we dined in Playa del Carmen, our favorite, by far, was Playa Maya’s. The fish tacos were amazing, and my husband ate them everyday for lunch. Even their frozen concoctions were delicious. I, everyday, enjoyed a mango and strawberry daiquiri, which were made with real fruit and just the right amount of liquor. Our whole group had a fantastic stay and would highly recommend this hotel. I couldn’t imagine a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Destination Playa Maya!”
Reviews.Author: Flotravels
Reviews.Content: Second time here; second fabulous stay!! It doesn't get any better than this... ON the beach, breakfast served daily under a palapa, free wireless this time which was great, fabulous oceanview room (Thanks Steve!), super food & drinks served all day on the beach or poolside patio, & the BEST staff anywhere!!!! We brought our daughter this time & she absolutely LOVED it!! I I think we may have more pics of the towel art than anything as she had to photograph it daily!! Here you can sit on the beach all day & do nothing or venture out and come back to this peaceful setting. It's located close to shops, restaurants, & night life, but far enough from the noise that you can sleep at night. Went on the Fat Cat Catamaran -HIGHLY recommend- an absolute blast !!! Also, "Hidden Worlds" is a great day out! They have cenotes you can snorkle in; you can repel, do zip lines or sky cycle! (bug repellent an absolute must here!) Also went to the Mayan ruins in Tulum; very interesting but VERY hot there- no shade at all. Also met Delmy this time- very nice and personable!!.."Hope you had a safe trip back Delmy!!" We have been to AI's & larger resorts, but much more enjoy the laid back relaxed style & personal touches the Playa Maya and it's EXCELLENT staff offer! On behalf of ourselves, & especially our daughter Kaeli- Hola to- Raciel, Othman, Nora, Carlos, Lucio, Pablo, Sergio, Jesus, Juan, Alberto, Aide, & Maria...You are THE BEST EVER!!!! And a special "Hola and I miss you!" from Kaeli to Jesus! And from Kaeli to Pablo, "Hola wopo and I miss you!" Lastly, from Kaeli, "I miss you all!" and she says it everyday, and never wanted to leave the Playa Maya! Til the next time-Can't be soon enough!!!! Randy, Flo & Kaeli Davis P.S. I hope to see every single one of you next time I come!- Love,Kaeli :-)

Reviews.Title: “The worst thing about Playa Maya is leaving!!! Excellent location/service.”
Reviews.Author: Tortolawinds
Reviews.Content: Our friends have been coming to Playa Maya for years and finally got us to go with them two years ago. We've just booked our stay for the third year in a row. We prefer the personal attention you get over any of the larger hotels and the location couldn't be better. Steps from the sand and walking distance to all the great restaurants and shops. We prefer the Jacuzzi Suite if we can get it. After spending all day on the beach, the room is a perfect getaway from the sun and sand to rest, clean up and head back out. Having your own little garden atrium to sit in the jacuzzi, read or enjoy drinks with friends is unbeatable. Can't say enough about the service and managment. For three years in a row now they have made booking our room a breeze. It feels like we go to visit old friends and we hate to leave. We start thinking about our plans to return as soon as we get home. We would do it more often if we could. Highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small is nice”
Reviews.Author: bleu-menthe
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 10 year old daughter. We very much enjoyed our stay at Playa Maya right on the beach. My first reaction was about how small the place is yet it's comfortable. The hotel is accessible only by the beach but staff is prompt to help with suitcases. My daughter loved to cool down in the tiny pool. We liked the outdoor design, modern and exotic. Our room was a good size and the a/c was easy to fine tune (we don't like it too cold or noisy). We had difficulty accessing the Internet through wifi but were able to check email on a PC available in a sitting room. There were experimenting at the time, hopefully it works now and is not too onerous. Staff was friendly although it seemed like there was some competition among restaurant staff over who had main access to customers (for tips or referrals?). A lot in Playa del Carmen has to do with referring tourists to attractions and one can sometimes feel the pressure. On the other hand it's nice when you get to have a friendly chat about places to visit. I regret this type of hotel doesn't offer a formula that would include breakfast and a meal. Cost of meals are for us a big deterrent in traveling and food was not particularly cheap in Playa del Carmen. The only alternative would have been an "all inclusive" in Cancun which I wanted to avoid. We were looking for something more authentic with more ties with the local community. Some rooms offer a kitchenette which may help. My big issue was that one person who cleaned our room had a really bad cold (seemed like flu) and could barely speak. I was sick a few days after I returned. Given that flu and Mexico made big headlines as early as May I would have expected the staff to have been trained adequately. Now I don't know if that has to do with poor local health coverage which would explain the necessity to work no matter what.

Reviews.Title: “Serene beach spot close to the heart of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: kpbleyle
Reviews.Content: The bilingual (English/Spanish) staff was great with recommendations for restaurants, shopping and sightseeing (as well as reliable transportation choices). We wound up eating many meals at the hotel restaurant on the beach. Loved the breakfasts served on the beach! Though we had originally envisioned spending much of the trip out and about, we wound up spending two days of our four-day-stay enjoying the amenitites of the hotel, be they as simple as the hamock chairs on the deck overlooking the beach. Cozy indeed!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: poppyDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just returned from a 4 night stay at playa maya for our 10th anniversary. it is a lovely, peaceful hotel. friendly staff, great location, clean & comfortable rooms. the food was wonderful - breakfast on the beach and the yummiest fish tacos for lunch. we would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: chirish147
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews my husband and I decided to stay at Playa Maya on a recent trip to Mexico. Let me just start by thanking everyone for their recommendation. Playa Maya is not the type of hotel we would normally consider for a vacation. We are usually at larger chain hotels. Not anymore! Everything about our stay was great. Every question we asked prior to arriving was quickly responded to by management and when we arrived, there were no surprises. The location on the beach was great. Waking up each morning and having breakfast with our toes in the sand was really special. And after breakfast we would walk steps closer to the water to the beach chairs set up for guests. We loved being able to walk up to 5th to enjoy all the restaurants and night spots and than returning to the quiet sanctuary of the hotel. We can't recommend the hotel enough and we are already planning when we can make it back.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: 3hermanas
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fabulous. breakfast was amazing everyday. if ur used to the fast-paced hectic life in the states there is nothing better than having breakfast prepared fresh daily. the hotel staff was wonderful and very pleasant. i will definately be staying there again on my next trip to mexico

Reviews.Title: “Best choice I could have made”
Reviews.Author: stephaniep97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Playa for a week in August. I spent a lot of time reading these boards to try and decide where to stay and what to do. Everyone seemed to really like Playa Maya. It also seemed that there was a lot of repeat business and I love that. You can't beat the price of Playa Maya...considering $160 was for the best Ocean View rooms that is fantastic. I emailed Steve and he gave us an amazing room on the 3rd floor. (302). It was exactly like the pictures online. The room was spacious and clean with complimentary welcome drinks in the fridge. When we arrived it was early and the room wasn't quite ready yet so we went outside to eat. Now I had read a lot about the food everywhere and I knew that while I was there I would be trying the coconut shrimp and the fish tacos. On day 1 I chose the Coconut Shrimp with a Dos Equiis and my husband had the chicken tacos. The food was amazing! The service was also top notch. Very attentive and friendly. Throughout the week we sporadically spent time in the beach chairs at Playa Maya and ate lunch or a snack there 4 times. I never had a bad meal. The fish tacos were everything I hoped they were and I really love their Pico De Gallo--so fresh.
