The staff was so helpful to us and we got to meet Steve who was really nice and had a lot of great information. I would absolutely stay here again. I just want to address a couple things people complain about... The bed.....we loved it. I do not think it is hard at all...makes me wonder if those people are used to super crazy soft beds? We both thought it was great. The beach in front...yes there are some rocks right in the front..actually great for when you are staring at the ocean...noone is right in front of you! All you had to do was walk about 50-60 feet in either direction and there is completely clear water. My husband did a lot of snorkeling out front and he saw all kinds of stuff including a baby octopus! I love this place! My ONLY complaint....that the restaurant is not open late enough ! (I will add photos later)

Reviews.Title: “worst management I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: natbrum
Reviews.Content: This was the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in. I was completely misguided by management,. There are so many better options in this gorgeous part of the world.Make sure you do the research, look at Mosquito Beach or Mosquito Blue better priced and far superior product.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay - unless you like being disturbed by noise”
Reviews.Author: possOz
Reviews.Content: whilst the location is terrific, the most disappointing hotel stay I have ever had - the noise from reception phone ringing prevented sleep on night 1, then after a full day of correspondence via email with management (on site staff can't help guests with complaints) the room we were moved to had a mechanical noise kicking in every 10 minutes - seriously do not succumb to the pictures on line of an ideal peaceful haven, its the opposite - the only other positive is the lovely staff, they are just not empowered by hotel owner/manager

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: BLH613
Reviews.Content: We completely and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this lovely property and hope to come back on our next trip to PDC. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend Playa Maya to anyone. The room was perfect and we couldn't believe how beautiful the view was from our unexpectedly upgraded room, absolutely amazing! Our vacation was everything we had hoped for and more. Playa Maya’s staff were friendly and accommodating, always handy when we needed something but never hovering or intrusive. The property itself is very charming, and one of the most well kept and cleanest hotels we've seen in a long time. The included breakfast was more than continental; I’d say it was a full breakfast with juice, coffee and choice of entrée. Food at the restaurant on the beach is terrific…coconut shrimp are a must try! After breakfast most mornings we simply walked the 10 short steps to the beach chairs and umbrella set up by the staff for us. The beach in front of the hotel is beautiful. I cannot honestly think of anything negative to comment on at except we thought it would be nice if the bar area were open in the late evening, as he would have enjoyed a quiet drink there once in a while rather than venturing up to Fifth Avenue. As for activities, we did absolutely nothing on this trip...it was perfect! We've been to the area several times in the past and have done plenty of tours and such...this trip was for relaxation and I have to say it was a very successful trip thanks to Playa Maya! Our biggest excursion was a walk to El Fagon for tacos one day, very good by the way. We also tried Babe's Noodle Bar and, while the frozen drinks were very good, we did not enjoy the food at all. We had dinner one night at 100% Natural where the food was good but service a bit slow. I have a feeling our food was ready but not served promptly as it was not hot when it arrived. Mosquitos were plentiful in the garden area at 100% Natural especially since we went after dark and after there had been some rain. Certainly can't fault the restaurant for that, just mentioning because and we were sorry we hadn't brought insect repellent. Our favorite restaurant, as usual, is Carboncitos. We have always enjoyed the food there and the dining room has A/C..a definite plus in August! This was definitely one of the most pleasant relaxing vacations we've enjoyed in a long time. I'm sure we'll be thinking of those days quite often when the cold winds are blowing and the snow starts falling!

Reviews.Title: “stay here”
Reviews.Author: shellseeker1319
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Playa Maya to anyone visiting Riviera Maya. I learned several years ago how much more interesting it is to stay in a small hotel in Playa del Carmen rather than a generic all inclusive resort but my kids (21, 19, 13) were not convinced. That is until we crossed the short distance of beach and entered Playa Maya. They loved it from that moment on. The hotel itself is clean and very nice. The staff are great and the beach is the place to be. The included breakfast selections are ample and all of the food is very good.The location relative to 5th avenue, the ferry area, 12th (where the bars are), etc can't be beat. The other amazing thing is that it is quiet! That is hard to accomplish that close to 5th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: SandyNewman
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed at Playa Maya, our third time this year, and found the hotel and staff to be every bit what we are looking for when we come to Playa del Carmen. We love the fact that you have to walk in the sand to get to the hotel (they will help you with your bags), and once there, the staff is so accomodating and helpful and so much fun, too. Every room is different, and each has its pluses, depending on what you're looking for. Once we stayed on the third floor and enjoyed a great view of the ocean. The last time we stayed in a bungalow by the pool that has a kitchen. We never used the kitchen however, because the food at Playa Maya is so good for breakfast and lunch. Can't beat it for the price in terms of a small hotel on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a smaller, more personal experience and we found it.”
Reviews.Author: ThreeStripesPDX
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the economy suite the week of July 11-18. We have always done big resort style hotels and wanted something smaller. Hotel is very clean with hard working employees always giving great service. Food was good and reasonably priced. Breakfast is included which was a bonus - especially while being served with your feet in the sand. Main drag is one block away - albeit with aggressive vendors. Restaurants plentiful - but if you search a little further out - price is lower and drinks stronger. Only negative is the beds are ROCK HARD! Xel-ha was great - ADO bus service a breeze to use and collectivos on Calle 2 and Avenue 20 a great alternative to taxis. Our favorite was Akumal beach for the snorkeling and turtles. Would stay here again. Thanks Playa Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: GatorKris
Reviews.Content: I have to start off by agreeing with everyone else that the customer service was excellent. Steve went above and beyond in helping us book our last minute trip. The location is great - right on the beach and steps from 5th Avenue. However, it is definitely a no frills hotel and my biggest complaint was the bed was REALLY hard. New beds would do them wonders.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya: Clean, comfortable, convenient---at home on the beach”
Reviews.Author: gar-fisher
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Playa Maya (for our 20th anniversary) was our first in Playa Del Carmen and, before we left, we were already planning a return. The hotel was classy but definitely unpretentious. I appreciated that our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Playa Maya is located right on the beach and it's in easy walking distance of restaurants, shops, spas, and outfitters. All of the staff were friendly and personable. Many spoke English, but we all enjoyed conversing in our less-than-perfect Spanish. All at Playa Maya truly made efforts to make our stay pleasant and memorable. We both highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: beachbums2Houston_TX
Reviews.Content: We chose Playa Maya for the beachfront location, and because of the positive reviews here on trip advisor. The hotel was really nice and we would stay here again, and recommend others to stay as well. We had room 201 - deluxe oceanview, which was very nice. Small balcony, but plenty big enough for 2 to sit out and enjoy the ocean. You do have to look over the roof of the hotel next door (Pelicano, I think) and the roof of the Playa Maya, but you still have a nice ocean view, and a great view of Cozumel lights at night. Kingsize bed was comfortable, no noise issues. We had a nice TV, safe, cold refrigerator and cold air conditioner. Ther service in the hotel was very good. Rooms were clean, front desk was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was awesome, eggs your way, bacon was very good, sausage or chorizzo, fresh squeezed orange juice. We had the coconut shrimp twice, and I wish I had some right now. Best ever. Nachos are also very good. The only thing I did not like at the resturant were the fish tacos. Someone on an earlier post said they were good, but I must have gotten them on a bad day. I would not order those again. The beach was pretty nice... smallish, with a 1-2 foot drop off, lots of rocks in front of the hotel, but you can walk either direction just a few feet and have a very swimable beach. The pool was nice and cool. Great for cooling off after being at the beach, but not really a place to hang out. Can't think of anything else. Let me know if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Sand & Surf Paradise”
Reviews.Author: texwegian
Reviews.Content: Playa Maya is an excellent choice for anyone who wants to wake up every morning and BE on the beach. The rooms are clean and functional--nothing fancy. We had a small balcony that overlooked the entrance with a view directly out to the beautiful blue sea. The tasty continental breakfast actually included more than we thought--you could get either bacon , eggs , ham, or fruit as part of the complimentary meal under a shady palapa with your feet in the sand! The staff was attentive and friendly. The pool is shallow & smallish, but is really only needed to wash off any stray sand from the beach. That part of the beach seems to be less congested (at least when we were there) and is close to Fusion (a great beach restaurant /bar) and a quick walk to the Cozumel ferry landing (about 5 minutes away). And, Quinta is just a couple blocks away. We'd book back at Playa Maya in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation - Don't let fear ruin yours!”
Reviews.Author: Paulzebub
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days at Playa Maya, our second stay at this location. Friends tried to dissuade us from vacationing in Mexico at this time, but at present there is H1N1 (swine) flu in our home state, and as of last check it still appears absent in the yucatan. On the Mexican side, they are very thorough, checking temperatures coming and going at the airport, and onthe cozumel Ferry. But I digress. Playa Maya is the perfect hotel, located right on the beach. The staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. While I do not tend to have meals at hotels, Playa Maya can compete quite well with the local restaurants. Their fish tacos are a must , the ceviche and coconut shrimp are also fantastic. We opted (again) for a room with a private Jacuzzi garden, which was a wonderful way to unwind at the end of the day. The location is quiet, but within walking distance of more restaurants, bars and shops than one could possibly check out in a typical vacation. While it was relaxing for us to have the area very uncrowded, it is terrible for the local economy. Most nights we were the only diners in the restaurants. As I previously mentioned, the area is clear of the flu, and the much hyped drug violence is not a problem in the Yucatan. I feel safer walking the streets in Playa del Carmen than I would in a lot of US cities. If you are in the market for a vacation, there surely are good deals to be had right now and Hotel Playa Maya would be a great place to spend i

Reviews.Title: “I want to live at Playa Maya!”
Reviews.Author: LaLaNorthwest
Reviews.Content: I prowled TripAdvisor for months before deciding on Playa Maya. I've planned quite a few trips using this site and it has always guided me to the kind of places I like to stay: small, charming, clean, quiet, convenient, friendly. Playa Maya was all that! My husband and I stayed here in April for our 10th wedding anniversary. The location was the best, no long walk to the beach. We were greeted with a "Happy Anniversary!" at the front desk, a big, clean, sunlit room with rose petals strewn on the bed, and a beautiful view of the turquoise ocean. The bed was firm (not "hard") and comfortable. Every morning around 9am, we came down to the beach and enjoyed breakfast while someone set up two lounge chairs for us right next to the water with a table and umbrella. The included breakfast was terrific. And the fresh juice! I drank so much grapefruit juice, I'm sure I'm at the vitamin C limit. We were greeted by the waiter on the second day at breakfast and he remembered our room number and preferences. The service is laid back, no rush, no guarding your beach chairs, the waiter comes around often suggesting a drink. The swimming is great in the ocean here. Just walk a few steps north and the sand is soft. Small waves. At dinner time, just stroll a few blocks around for great restaurants, bars, and stores. We stayed away from the tourist spots, or tried to. Everything is in walking distance. I would go back to Playa Maya again, definitely! By the way, my husband checked his business email everyday on the available computer off the lobby, no problem. We never did use the pool; why, when the ocean is like a bath tub!

Reviews.Title: “Muy Excellente Playa Maya!”
Reviews.Author: ihopeyoudancer
Reviews.Content: We just celebrated our wedding anniversary with a two week vacation in the Yucatan and Playa Maya was our second hotel (after Isla Mujeres). Overall we were very, very happy with Playa Maya....it is an excellent choice if like us you wish to stay close to the water, listen to the sound of the waves at night and wake up to a 'toes in the sand' breakfast every morning. We were so glad we chose not to stay on Avenida Quinta after experiencing sensory overload walking up and down the street a few times! The staff at Playa Maya was very courteous, pleasant and responded well to all our requests and questions. Our room (superior balcony) was basic but large and very clean, perfectly serving our needs. We greatly appreciated the staff acknowledging our wedding anniversary with an extra large towel art complete with fresh flowers (very thoughtful touch...gracias Playa Maya!). Overall we were very satisfied and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family. Someday if we return to PDC we would most certainly return to this simple yet charming boutique hotel on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Playa Maya!”
Reviews.Author: GettingCozy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Playa Maya in March. This was my third trip to Playa del Carmen and his first. I had wanted to stay at Playa Maya for awhile, b/c it's right on the beach and just seemed really nice. We were not dissapointed! The hotel has the perfect location. You are guaranteed beach chairs and umbrellas every day. A basic breakfast is included, and was quite good. The rooms are immaculate and the staff is very nice. The major pros: Great location Extremely Clean Friendly Staff Great Food Good customer service The few cons: 1) We stayed in a basic room on the same level as reception. Honestly, we could hear voices and the phone ringing in the reception area if we were in the room during the day, but as we weren't in the room too much except to sleep, it wasn't too disturbing. 2) Our bed was not that comfortable, which was unfortunate. 3)Reception doesn't like to give out more than one towel per guest per day for the beach. I can understand this, but still, it was a minor inconvenience 4) More of a suggestion, I think the hotel should put some mats down between the enterance to the hotel (off the beach) and the street. I hate getting my feet sandy before dinner and then having to wash them off before bed. Despite the few cons, I would definately stay at Playa Maya again (maybe just in a different room). A few Playa del Camen reccomendations: -Go snorkeling with the guys at The Snorkel Shop. An all-day trip, totally worth the money. And, they give you a CD of pictures to go home with! David Eddy is the best guide! -Eat at Negrosal. It's one of the best meals I've had! -Buy talavera pottery at Seite Detalles. It's authentic and the best priced and owned by a good family!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: AussieLu
Reviews.Content: I've read many wonderful reviews about Playa Maya on Trip Advisor and now even before staying there I have to say Steve's commitment to customer service is remarkable. I was due to travel to Mexico from Australia in a week's time. I was forced to cancel due to the swine flu epidemic and my travel insurance refused to come to the party. Steve has handled this matter in a very fair and compassionate way. I will always be grateful to him. I think it was the true measure of the kind of wonderful customer service, integrity and kindness people can expect when they stay there. I know I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Even Better Service!”
Reviews.Author: JamieLynneW
Reviews.Content: I, my husband, and our two teen-aged children stayed at the Playa Maya from April 3 2009 to April 8 2009. You can't ask for a better location; you're a one-minute walk up Calle 8 to 5th Avenue. 30 seconds down the beach and you're at Hotel Fusion (be sure to catch their nightly fire show!) another 5 minutes further and you've reached the Cozumel ferry. The hotel is very clean and well-maintained. When we returned from our trip my 16 year-old daughter asked me, "Is there anywhere online you can let people know how nice the staff at Playa Maya is?" So here I am, telling you exactly that :-) You couldn't ask for a better bunch. The fact that my husband and I have already booked a return trip for June should say something. We both enjoy traveling to new places so much we've never made the same trip twice. But for Playa Maya we're making an exception, and only 2 months later to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Small simple hotel. Service and location make it a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: MustangAnn
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is the first year my husband and I decided not to take the all-inclusive route for our winter vacation. We were a little nervous but believe neither of us eat or drink enough to justify the cost. We stayed at Playa Maya from March 16th to the 26th. We selected this hotel soley on the reviews here at TripAdvisor. In a few short words it was great. When we first arrived we had a little bit of an adjustment. The rooms are a little dated. But that being said, they are comfortable, incredibly clean and have everything you need . If you are used to luxurious hotels this is not. Funny enough, it really didn't matter once you get settled in. The hotel is in a fantastic location on the beach and close to all the activities. It is extremely quiet. The included breakfast was wonderful. What makes this hotel a 5 star in the eyes of people who have stayed there is the service. Everyone from the cleaning staff to the front desk to the restaurant were all beyond what we could have asked for. An example; when I booked the room I mentioned it would be my husband's birthday while we were going to be there. Well, after a full day at the beach we returned to find our room decorated with balloons, flowers, the bed was decorated with flowers and there was champagne on ice waiting for us. It was such a thoughtful touch. We loved it here and hope to be back next year. Special mention goes out to Nora at the front desk and Jorge at the restaurant. Their smiles made even a sunny day brighter! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: dupde
Reviews.Content: First I want to thank the reviewers who have posted on this site. The descriptions, especially of the staff, were what led us to book one week at Playa Maya in March. Our transportation from Cancun airport pulled up to 10th Ave. and Calle 8, which is two blocks from the hotel. I remember thinking... it's quite a trek with all this luggage. As soon as I opened the van door all I can hear is "Playa Maya"? "Playa Maya"?. I don't know how they knew we'ld be at that spot at that particular time, but there they were to carry our bags. What a great start! From that moment on you could tell this was a well trained staff. There was allways someone to help you. Just ask! Having a full bar and restaurant available, on the beach, was awesome. We strolled up and down the beach to check out other locations, and came back convinced we made the right choice. It's beautiful here at Playa Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: bellavie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific, great location just off of 5th Ave near all the nightlife but very quiet. The front desk staff Aide and Nora were always very pleasant and helpful and Juan kept the room top notch clean. The only entrance to the hotel is from the beach which I thought was pretty cool and unique. We always felt safe, there was a guard at night at the entrance and even though we stayed there a week and he probably recognized us by then, he always asked to see our key. The rooms are pretty basic but really what else do you need when your view if fantastic. If you stay there a week your breakfast is included and it was great. The fresh squeezed orange juice was to die for and I don't normally drink juice. I also had the cerviche, shrimp & fish, it was amazing and for the price the amount was more than I could eat. They rent chairs out to non-guest but reserve the first two rows near the water for guests. They definately treat their guests right. We loved it so much that the week we got home I contacted them to reserve for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with a big heart”
Reviews.Author: MnRetiree
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Playa-Maya 2/28/09-3/7/09. My travel group of four couples all loved it. Great location and beach. Super friendly and helpful staff including the desk people, the waiters, the cleaning ladies and the night security people. (Thats right security-they keep track of who comes and goes from the evening and throughout the night. We all felt good about that.) Very good food at their beach restaurant. Everyone in my group would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: CassieJ95
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Good location, very clean and excellent staff. The staff is very kind and accomodating. Having internet access at the computer in the adjacent lobby was nice. Breakfast is very good and it was awesome having breakfast on the beach every morning. No problems with getting a lounger for the beach every day. The only downside was the fact that after about 11:00 PM, you could hear the music from the bands at the beach bars. Not a big deal as long as you carry ear plugs :) It was quiet again after about 1:00 AM. So, I guess if you don't go to bed before then, it won't be an issue. I would return here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return.....”
Reviews.Author: hlfrogs
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed in the family suite of connecting rooms March 4th thru March 10th. This was our 2nd stay & loved it. Luciano served us breakfast & lunch every day & was excellent. We missed him when his work week ended after Sunday breakfast. The 2 ladies (I cannot remember there names, I'm terrible) at the front desk were wonderful especially with our 2 children ages 3 & 1, very sweet. We had some teeny tiny ants in our room around the sink & mirrored dresser area but nothing too bad. We mentioned it & I think the staff sprayed but it didn't work. They are soo tiny it seems almost impossible to prevent there entry, Regardless we will be back. Playa-Maya feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “the Playa Maya was the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: popcorngirlAlberta
Reviews.Content: I booked the Playa Maya based exclusively on the Trip advisor reviews and the reviews were 100 percent spot on. I don't even know where to start. The location is superb and I love the fact that you can only access the hotel from the beach- makes it really intimate and safe feeling. The hotel is totally spotless, spotless, spotless. I always am on high bug alert and I didn't see one bug, anywhere, not even outside, of this wonderful gem. The complimentary breakfast is a great jumpstart to the day and the fresh squeezed orange juice was amazing. I loved the fact that you could open a tab for the entire week and settle up before checkout- no carrying around of cash- kind of like the all inclusive but way better. It's the little things here that matter that you just can't get at the big resorts. The little book exchange in the lobby, the free internet room that never seemed to be busy, the hot coffee and snacks in the lobby, the general feeling of intimacy- unforgettable. I almost couldn't wait to get home so I could tell everyone I knew how awesome it was! But, overall, the best part of this place is the staff! Never, have I come across staff that were so dedicated, friendly, hard working and gracious. You guys are truly awesome- they carried my bags with a smile, cleaned my room to utter perfection, knew exactly who I was from the first day on and brought me my coffee and juice on the beach without being asked, offered friendly advice and a smile each and every time. I am not sure what they are doing, but whatever it is they have an incredible group of employees and they are a huge part of what makes this place so special. There was one day after the bar and restaurant had closed; in fact, we were heading out for dinner, and the restaurant staff, that had been there from about 7 am, were pressure washing all of the table cloths and doing a real scrub down- I was truly amazed- you just don't see that! Anyway, best vacation ever and I hope that we are lucky enough to enjoy the hospitality again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, couldn't ask for better :0)”
Reviews.Author: loriluvstotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from jan3-17. The staff are very hardworking and extremely friendly, rooms clean and accommodating, food was yummy as well. Overall we loved it, the location can't be beat. We have been to the Mayan area for a winter holiday for the past 10 years and we have always stayed at 4-5 star large resorts. After bringing my family last year with us and we were seriously disappointed with the overpriced resort, we decided to stay at a small hotel. We loved it so much that we are planning on staying there for our wedding next January. I will keep you posted on how our wedding goes.....

Reviews.Title: “Truly paradise”
Reviews.Author: kazoocrew
Reviews.Content: The staff at the playa maya is what makes it so excellent.The cleanliness and the friendly faces everyday made us feel so welcome.The location is hands down best on the beach just a block off 5th but away from the nightly noise, only the waves are heard at night. (Truly Paradise).

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumAbq
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Playa Maya in late January and early February. It was a great experience. Everyone from the front desk personnel to the waiters and beach chair people were very friendly and helpful. Always a smile and a helpful hand. We had 3 generations staying at the hotel and it was equally enjoyed by all. It was my parents first visit to Playa del Carmen, but we were assured by them it would not be thier last. Our rooms were always clean as was the beach and the pool area. The last we saw on leaving were the employees waving goodbye and telling us to come back--which we will do..

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation in my life :-)”
Reviews.Author: Rixen
Reviews.Content: We: my friend and i spend 20 days in the Hotel Playa Maya - and we had the most amazing time there. The staff was frindly and wery kind. The reason whay we first write now is that it is to painfull :-) We are both wery sad when we think about how much we miss the Hotel and the people there was working there. we vent to Isla Mujeres for 3 days, and we had a wonderfull time there. But when we came back to Playa Maya - it was like coming home. We both wish that we can come back soon - Playa del Carmen, Playa Maya and the people are wery helpfull and like to talk with people from other parts of the world. Special thanks to Nora in the reception and the waiters Silverio and Dario :-) We can recomend this hotel to all there are locking for a happy and peacefull time in Playa del carmen.. Pernille and Rikke, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet on the beach”
Reviews.Author: RoadKing0550
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at Playa Maya and had an excellent time! Most of the other reviews here are fairly accurate and we had similar experiences. Just keep in mind that this is a small stand alone hotel , not an all -inclusive resort. First of all, they really do come running to take your bags once you arrive! The front desk reception was very organized and helpful. The property is exceptionally clean and well maintained. The bedding and towels are in very good condition; nothing is threadbare or worn out. We had a Superior room with balcony and very comfortable (firm) king bed. The room itself was good sized with a closet, desk and dresser. The bathroom is a bit tight but functional. The refrig was stocked with beer and water. There is free purified water available 24/7. TV is nice but most programming is en espanol. Get out on the beach ! Speaking of that, the restaurant is also very clean and the service very fast and friendly. The breakfast choices that are included with the room are limited but good. The lunch menu is excellent ... we had the fish tacos, nachos and the seafood cocktail all of which were delicious ! Get out on the beach early to reserve a chair and umbrella. The hotel also furnishes oversized beach towels. The beach is clean. There are a few vendors who can be annoying but in general the beach is safe and enjoyable. One of the good things about the location is that Playa Maya is close to 5th Ave but far enough away to avoid the obnoxious noise. You won't hear the crowds or loud bands but the building is not soundproof and you will hear normal hotel noise; your fellow guests moving about, doors slamming, loud conversations etc. We could ramble on about details but wont'.. just be assured that it's comfortable, clean, not a lot of frills but in a fantastic location with good service !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, friendly and helpful staff. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: P-and-J-Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playa Maya in the days around and including Christmas. It is such a good location, just off 5th ave and Right On the beach. Having to walk on sand to reach the hotel was a first for us! Thankfully a porter welcomed us at the base of Calle 8 and picked up some bags. Our first room, 204 was quite comfortable with small patio and a lovely view of the water. It was a very quiet room which was excellent. We ended up needing to stay another night and luckily due to a cancellation we were able to. The second room was 3 something and it was slightly louder, the sounds from 5th ave came in through the west facing windows and bathroom shutter window. The sounds died down around 1am. The other members of my family slept right through it though so it's not a major issue. It's certainly WAY quieter than a street facing hotel would be. There was a bit of an ant issue in the third floor room as well. After reading reviews before we arrived we were careful not to eat in the room or leave crumbs around. The hotel is trying to stay on top of the ant situation and the front desk attendant was apologetic when we checked out. The hotel provides a selection of drinks upon your arrival. Having a fridge is a bit plus! There are purified water jugs for water bottle refills available on the stair landings. The pool is small and chilly and the hot-tub is "not a hot-tub" to the dismay of my little girl who really wanted to try it out. We didn't go in the pool but saw others enjoying it. The lounge chair sundeck area seemed popular, too. We mostly enjoyed the immediate beach access with comfortable lounges and available umbrellas. The water was great for dipping in and a bit of swimming, though it's a bit too rough for littler kids. We loved being right on the beach. Some days were quite windy, but we were able to enjoy breakfast at the beach restaurant anyway. Tasty coffee. We ate in town most days as we like to try out various restaurants. Still, the included breakfast options are a pretty good deal. Minuses for me would be the room lighting - the bed lighting is too bright and direct for one person to be able to read while another rests or sleeps, and the light quality is a bit cold. A lamp could warm up the room a bit, and perhaps another type of CFL bulb with warmer tones. It was practically impossible to enter the room without having sand on our feet. We used the foot wash upon entering the grounds, too. Maybe another foot station would be helpful, further in, maybe with a mat to walk on? Not a huge deal, but it does feel a bit gritty underfoot (though they sweep and mop when they clean) and you definitely need to wipe/shake off your feet before getting in bed. The (free) computer room was handy and usually available with a short wait. Wireless was $5/day, but the signal was quite powerful in the rooms if you choose to pay for it. The hotel provides beach towels and there is a free in-room safe. We walked everywhere from the hotel. Playa del Carmen is a very walking oriented town, at least in the tourist areas, including the ferry dock, bus station, colectivo pickup area (although watch the "sidewalks") and of course Avenida 5 and its cross-streets. We might stay in the northern area next time, just for the very different feel. A lovely hotel. The super-friendly staff makes it all the more enjoyable. When I compare this staff to the staff at a place we stayed when we left PDC, these guys are a step above. They must be treated well by management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: infinitude
Reviews.Content: Our stay at playa maya was nice. We loved the location. Here are the pluses: - Location location. We liked the beach in front of the hotel and it was close to the happening 5th ave. - The entrance to the hotel is from beach, the breakfast is served on beach, its a small hotel so you are never very far from the sea. - The staff was very friendly and helpful Minuses: - You have to be on the beach by 9 AM to get good beach chairs. the beach does get crowded by mid day. - The pool is really small, so dont count on that. - We did not like the breakfast much but the breakfast setting on the beach totally makes up for it. Overall: Its a nice little place with great location on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorado80
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend Playa Maya hotel. The hotel is clean, charming and the location can not be beat. The staff at Playa Maya goes out of their way to make it an enjoyable stay. The little things really add up at here, free bottled water each day, beach towels, chairs on the beach, free breakfast, complementary drinks upon arrival, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: ChicaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location, as it's really right on the beach. It was convenient to walk around town and be steps from the beach. Staff were really friendly and the food was good. I booked this hotel mostly based on prior reviews and the value. In the future, I'd probably prefer to stay in a more updated room or hotel. I do recall some bugs or ants in the bathroom and near the bed, but that may have been because you're so close to the beach and the windows are open. If you go further away from the main tourist strip, the prices of the local restaurants are so much more reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: drweehawken
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Playa Maya for a week and we loved it! The location right on the beach can't be beat, and certainly not for the price. The hotel is lovely, the rooms charming, spacious and immaculately maintained. And the hotel staff could not be friendlier or more willing to go out of their way to be helpful. Enjoying a good breakfast on the beach is a delightful way to start the day. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ajmom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya with our two kids in May and had a wonderful experience. I chose this hotel because of the rating here and also because it had some rooms that adjoined. This was great because my boys (ages 11 & 13) each had a double bed to themself and my hubby and I could have privacy. We loved the fact that they had a pool which doesn't seem too common for a smaller beachfront hotel. The restaurant was very good and every day other people would start up conversation with us and were so friendly. The staff here bend over backwards for you and for the price Playa Maya can't be beat! We plan on returning in the spring of 2009. Yay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: BeachandPalmTrees
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family deluxe rooms. They are large rooms with a refrigerator and safe. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. Excellent location for either the beach, the ferry to Cozumel and all the activities on 5th street. For those renting a car, a self park 24 hour lot is on 10th street near fourth at a cost of 10 US dollars per 24 hours. Very reasonable and there were no problems leaving it. Another one is close by at 15 US dollars but you do not park it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Plus................”
Reviews.Author: dogchk
Reviews.Content: My husband and some friends stayed at Playa-Maya over the Fourth of July holiday. Great hotel! It was very HOT but the rooms were very cool and clean. The staff was very accomodating and always there to make sure our stay was enjoyable. Once you leave the resort is a different story. You see how much poverty there is in Mexico and how the people "without" have to struggle. Linda, Kintnersville, PA

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya is fantastic!! :-)”
Reviews.Author: jessiev_72788
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Playa Del Carmen and I had an excellent experience with Playa Maya. There were some bads but they are not at all important compared to all of the wonderful things about the hotel. I stayed at the hotel from July 11th-19th. First, all of the goods!! The minute you arrive, people are jumping to help carry your bags up to your room, and they're always smiling and more then welcome to help you out. The staff was fantastic!! I stayed in the Deluxe Family Suite with my family and we loved it! The air conditioning worked very well and you can adjust it to the exact temperature you want for your room. The room was great for what you paid for. The shower is roomy (which was a plus for my fiance who's 6'7") and had good water pressure. My family had three rooms on two different floors and never had an ant problem so it's safe to say that it's not a huge problem with the hotel. The property is fantastic and is right in the center of everything! The ferry dock to Cozumel is a five minute walk and you're minutes away from fifth avenue. Our cleaning guy (Juan) was fantastic! He always tried to communicate with me (even with the little spanish i knew!) and he was very friendly! He always accomadated me and my family and made our trip even better. Every day there was a new towel sculpture on our bed which was a nice touch! Also, we ate at the hotel every day for breakfast and lunch. Not only was the food very reasonable (250$ bill for four people for a week!!) but it was very very good!!! I would definately agree with everyone else and say try the coconut shrimp! Also try the chilaquiles for breakfast! Very good! The staff also are very eager to set up beach chairs and umbrellas for you which was great! Some of the downfalls. I also booked my transportation through Get Dita and didn't have any problem with it. The people before had problems finding it when they landed but all you had to do is ask and your pointed right in the direction and your transportation is there very quickly (no waiting!! very nice). We arranged to have them bring us back to the airport after and they were late, but i think that is usual for Playa Del Carmen because when we arranged to have a different company bring us to our activities, they were late as well. Yes, the pool is very small and it's shaped in a way that makes actually swimming in it interesting, but I never used it once when the ocean was at my front door!! The beach is a tad rocky but it never bothered me the least bit and I still thought that it was great. They do run out of beach towels for people to use so I would recommend that you bring your own if you aren't an early riser. Overall, I have no complaints about the hotel or it's staff. My family and I have already started talking about returning to Playa Maya in March!! I would recommend this to anyone and I can honestly say this is one of the best hotels I've stayed at for the money I paid!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but had some hiccups . . .”
Reviews.Author: jazzy94401
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Playa Maya for 8 nights ( July 7th - 15th ) earlier this month. After reading all of the Trip Advisor reviews we were excited about our stay and figured that this hotel would be perfect since Playa from what I remembered was a very quaint simple town. I'll start with the good. The hotel is centrally located right off of 8th street and only steps away from all of the excitement of 5th St. We only paid $100.00 per night and got the last night free with breakfast included everyday. The room was clean and had a king size bed, flat screen, small table and chair, mini fridge and the bathroom had excellent water pressure. The hotel is right on the beach so you can go from your room, to breakfast and then to lay out all in about 30 seconds. The staff was all very nice and accommodating and all the food we ate at the hotel was good and priced on the lower side. With the exception of the Margaritas which were in all honesty non alcoholic. Oh, and the pool is itty bitty and configured in a really bizarre way which we already new due to the pictures but it was funny to see up close and personal. The bad . . . The hotel recommends Dita Transportation on their website and for $60.00 per person round trip you get taken to and from Cancun International. Well, I made the reservation with this company and made a mistake when booking and it took about 6 emails and a 20 minute conversation ( which I'll be paying for on my phone bill ) to fix. In my opinion, it was a simple fix and I was just going to give the company some additional money upon my arrival but they were unable to find my reservation at first and then it was a while before they confirmed that I could just in fact pay the additional amount upon my arrival. Plus, once we arrived they were no were to be found which meant we got hassled by a number of other taxi drivers until we decided to just go to the bar and wait for them to come. A few minutes later I heard a young man asking other couples if they were me and then I flagged him down and he walked us over to the van. I mean for $60.00 I would think they would just put a sign but apparently, that wasn't the case. Then to add insult to injury when we arrived in Playa we got dropped off 3 three blocks away because they close down streets in this area at night. Well, I think I already knew that and if they had been a easier to work with I don't think that would have annoyed me as much as it did. Checking into the hotel was easy. They were waiting for us and had everything ready to go. We had a Deluxe Ocean View Room which was nice and the AC was excellent. Unfortunately, we had ants in our bathroom and I had to go down the next morning and ask them to please spray them or do something. They did but from time to time I still saw some ants wandering around the bathroom counter and that's just something you don't want to deal with on vacation. We had issues with them running out of towels for " the day" and that was different? But then I noticed as we walked in and out that others were having the same trouble with beach towels and even regular bath towels being available for guest. Day in and day out things were fine but what really bothered me was the fact that it took about 30 minutes to check out. We had finished packing and I headed down to the lobby at 11am to close everything out. The front desk lady was very nice and did nothing but apologize but apparently, the restaurant had misplaced or had done something incorrectly with our bills from our entire stay and they had to redo everything manually. They brought up every single receipt we had signed for and I had to go through them and tell them whether they were ours or not. Then she had to add everything manually and finally she was able to check us out. The whole thing was incredibly frustrating but finally it was over and we were on our way back to the airport. All in all - It was a nice experience at Playa Maya and there was definitely more good than bad. It was a good value for our money but I'm definitely going to consider a different boutique hotel the next time we end up spending some time in Playa Del Carmen. Not to say they will be better or worse but there are many hotels to choose from so we would be open to giving another property a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Little Place !”
Reviews.Author: venturarose
Reviews.Content: Great Location on beach and walking distances to downtown playa del carmen. Easy online reservation process -even after we made changes and added another member to our party. Stayed in the eco. suite - two conntecting large rooms with a table & chairs in one room and a futon /couch in another. Air -conditioning & hot water. No view. Small refer but no microwave or coffee pot. Lobby free coffee 24/7. Pool was refreshing , kinda more like a wading pool but we used it every day. Food was very good, fresh juices etc right on the sand. Beach Loungers & towels provided. Security at night - staff was great - room & bathrooms clean, no problems ! sweet place would recommened it !

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachfront Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pointmmmb
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day stay at Playa Maya, and it was great! Clean well appointed rooms, with amazing views from the room balcony. We had one of the small baclony rooms, $125 per night. AC was great, but you also have the benefit of a constant sea breeze. Included breakfast was terrific and we loved the way that you could continue to sign for everything while staying at the hotel rather then having to worry about carrying cash to the beach. Gave it an AI feel but still had the benefit of the small hotel size. Regarding the food... the lunch was as good as everyone has described, possibly the best meal we had during our stay. Every room is practically beach front! Not the place to go if you don't like the beach though. Pool is very small and outside the room there really isn't any place to hangout other then a small common patio area. But with the beach only steps from your room where else would you rather be. After seeing the layout of the city and the location of Play Maya I can't imagine why someone would choose one of other places that were not on the beach. Loved coming back each night and having the security guard let us in. He even checked the number on the room key to make sure that it was valid. Only complaint would be the funky door locks, had to use the key to get in and out of the room, rather then the door knob, and the bedding was a little weak. I'm guessing they keep it very lite so that people don't have to run the AC on high.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, practical, superb location!”
Reviews.Author: cgparis
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at Hotel Playa Maya in early June (6/4 -6/10). We picked this hotel based on all the positive reviews posted at TripAdvisor and also based on its size and convenient location, right at the beach. The hotel certainly met our needs and more! It is a quiet, small, cozy, well maintained 3-story hotel with a lot of charm and great service provided by its staff. We booked one of the Deluxe Terrace rooms ($150/night) which we found very comfortable and inviting, specially the roomy terrace with the hammock. Upon arrival we were welcomed with couple of Corona beers and sodas stocked in our small refrigerator, nice touch indeed. The room was simple,unpretentious, very clean, decently furnished, with a plasma TV and DVD player, and a partial, nice view to the ocean. There is no radio/alarm clock in the rooms, so bring your own or ask for a wake-up call if you need it. The hotel provides free internet connection in an air-conditioned room, very nice. The only issue we found was that the keyboard was a Spanish keyboard but the PC was configured for English keyboard, so it was a little confusing to use... As many reviewers have mentioned, access to the hotel is from the beach, but the entrance is just about 15 ft. from 8th Street, only separated by Hotel La Alhambra which shares a wall with Playa Maya. Also, there is no elevator in the hotel. Please keep this in mind if you are considering this hotel and have a disability. When you book the room directly with the hotel, they send you detailed information with directions to the hotel and what to tell the taxi driver to get you close to the entrance. If you decide to take the ADO bus from the airport to the hotel ($8 one way) you will arrive at the bus terminal on 5th Avenue and Calle Juarez, which is about 4 blocks from the hotel. Great alternative specially if you are traveling light. The hotel restaurant faces the beach and has a nice Palapa just few feet from the water. We had our breakfast every morning with our feet in the sand, what a nice way to start the day! Breakfast was pretty decent, we had the option of continental or american breakfast. We also had lunch at the restaurant regularly, the food was really good and varied. The coconut shrimp, ceviche and the tacos are recommended!!! We also want to praise the waiting staff, everyone was super nice and friendly. No wonder we didin't want to go anywhere else for our meals! Being so close to the beach made it extremely convenient to walk from the beach to the room and back, it felt like being in our private house and having all the beach to ourselves! Speaking of the beach, the section right in front of the hotel is rocky, but about 40-50 ft to the left the beach is clean and beautiful. The hotel also offers massage right at the beach, in case you want to pamper yourself... Location-wise, this hotel is hard to beat!! We truly enjoyed the peace and quiet of the hotel at night, despite its proximity to 5th Avenue (5 Avenida) . It is about a 7 minute walk to the ferry terminal to go to Cozumel. If you walk along the beach heading north, you will find excellent beaches and very nice resorts, so go out and explore! For excursions, we took the one offered by Edventure Tours, HIGHLY recommended!. You can actually book the tour once you are in Playa del Carmen. Their telephone number is posted in TripAdvisor (do a search for the company name, look for Edventure Tour reviews), so no real need to book via e-mail in advance. We booked the trip the afternoon before, very easy. For dinner we tried to explore restaurants outside the main touristy area looking for the authentic food and ambiance, based on recommendations from the restaurant staff. There is, for example, a very nice cafe/restaurant (from Veracruz) on 8th Street in front of the City Hall (forgot the name, but very easy to spot). great coffee and food, super affordable and air conditioned! We also recommend the only Mayan restaurant in the area, on 8th Street close to 5th Avenue - don't miss out! Also check out Restaurant La Bahia on 4th Street and 10th Avenue, very authentic and great seafood!! For telephone calls, you have the option of using your own cell phone (Verizon in out case, $0.99/min), purchase a Ladatel calling card from one of the several money exchange booths, or go to one of the many call centers along 5ta. Avenida. Never attempted to place a call from the hotel lobby, so we have no idea about the fares. All in all, it was a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation, and felt very welcome by the locals and also the hotel staff. We made friends with some of the other guests who also stayed at the hotel, looks like everyone enjoyed their time at Playa very much!! Thanks to everyone at Hotel Playa Maya for makin our stay so pleasant and unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya lived up to reviews”
Reviews.Author: viachicago
Reviews.Content: I have nothing negative to say about Playa Maya. It was very affordable, very cute, clean and the staff really made us feel welcome and more than anything, at home. I think right off the bat that is the number one plus in my book. The staff was very accommodating, as we saw many of the same faces each day. Other pluses in my book were location (you can't beat beachfront), and a complementary breakfast each morning on that beach. For those who thought this was confusing, you just have to look closely at the menu to figure out what is included in the complementary breakfast. Other observations: - the hotel isn't really "open" in the evenings. they seemed to serve through to about 6pm and it was quiet in the evenings. so if you're looking for Dance Party Mexico, this isn't it. but really, with 5th Ave right behind the hotel you have a zillion bars and restaurants, you leave the hotel for the evening and when you come back exhausted, it's quiet ready for a good night's rest. -the standard rooms are nice and clean but the terrace is a wee small. it was just fine for two people but i would probably upgrade next time for a bigger terrace -if you are going to watch your favorite American TV shows, you should probably make sure your DVR at home works, this is not the place for couch potatoes - unless you speak Spanish -if you are looking for a huge swimming pool, this is also not the place - instead, take note of the wonderful beach and water about 20 steps away! -if you arrive after hours, make sure you notify the hotel staff ahead of time. because the "entrance" is on the beach, you feel like you are going around back of the hotel. it's a little odd for the first time visitor, and there is a very nice security guard waiting for you, just have a confirmation on hand and don't be alarmed that there are not a million lights flashing upon arrival. -little things we didn't notice until midway - like the showers to rinse off out by the outdoor restrooms or the little pool off water to wash your feet off after leaving the beach. nice touches -i agree with other reviewers, most of the beachfront hotels seemed small, charming and pleasant so i assume they are all comparable. however i thought Playa Maya did an excellent job, the food and drink were so good that even now that i'm back in Chicago, i find myself missing Playa Maya many a meal!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Simple, and At the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: TJinSTL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at Playa Maya, May 16-20. This is a very small, very simple hotel that cost $150/night. If you like simple and affordable, then this is ABSOLUTELY the place to go. The only way to access the hotel is from the beach, and the entrance is no more than 35 feet from the waves. Between the hotel and the water is the outdoor restaurant and a single line of beach chairs. It doesn't get more convenient than that. The hotel has few rooms. All, I believe, have a direct view of the ocean with their own balconies. Our room was clean, of decent size, and had a flat-panel TV and a small fridge. But it was not fancy. Our balcony included a hammock (a great place to relax when not in the direct sunlight). You could order drinks and food from anywhere on the beach. The food was tasty and affordable. The fish taco's were some of the best I've ever had! Note: the Playa Maya shares a wall with the Alhambra hotel. Our friends stayed at Alhambra while we were there, and I would suggest that either hotel would be great .

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 808trekker
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right on the beach, so much so access to the hotel is via the beach. the hotel location was perfect, situated a block away along the beach at the midpoint of 5th Ave, which is the pedestrian walk lined with the various restraunts and little shops.. the staff were all courteous and pleasant, all were very helpful. the rooms were very clean as well as all the public areas. the pool was a little sad, but we weren't there for the pool, the beach is right there so why would you be in a pool?? at night the hotel is watched by security who let you in via the front gate, this made the hotel feel a lot more safer than others in the area. there are no elevators as this is a small 3 story hotel..bottled water is provided 1 bottle/day with jugs to refill containers in the hall.. in all this hotel is perfect and highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “This place is so great!!!”
Reviews.Author: longshax
Reviews.Content: The last time we were in Playa del Carmen we stayed at the Playa Maya. It is a 4 star small 20 room hotel right on the beach!!! It was very cheap and loved the hotel staff. The room (terrace beach view) was nice and the food was great during the day. At night we ate out which we love really like to do. The location is one of the best because you are right on the beach and nigth life is only a few steps away. I got engaged at this place and would recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat Playa Maya!”
Reviews.Author: moeanddee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Playa Maya three times over the past three winters. We LOVE Playa Maya--we never want to stay anywhere else! In fact, we love it so much we got married on the beach in front of the hotel in 2008. The owner Steve is very nice and extremely accommodating. The hotel staff is fantastic. We have a lot of fun with the beach waiters! The location is prime. It's very quiet at the hotel at night, but if you want some fun there are countless bars and restaurants 1 block away on 5th Avenue. The food at the hotel is great as well. Coconut shrimp rule! Great fish tacos too! If you feel like journeying out for lunch or dinner, check out La Kalaka (www.lakalakarestaurant.com). One last thing--the beach is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: NRC50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Playa Maya from April 11th through April 16th. The rooms and property were very clean and well maintained. We enjoyed the breakfast and great service at the restaurant, which is right on the beach in a beautiful setting. The hotel is very conveniently located close to many shops and restaurants and also to the bus station, which was a great souce of transportation to other spots on the Mayan Riviera. I would recommend the Playa Maya to anyone traveling to Play Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya is magical”
Reviews.Author: sunlovers72
Reviews.Content: We loved our Playa Maya vacation! The location is great, on the beach, close to 5th Avenue, ferry and bus, and yet quiet at night. The service was exceptional; we felt welcome from the moment we arrived. Our room was spotlessly clean, had lots of closet and cupboard space, and a balcony with a view (not panoramic, but very nice) of the beach and ocean. The restaurant serves excellent meals, snacks, and drinks right on the beach all day. In addition to the included breakfasts, nice added touches were bottled water in our room, early morning coffee in reception, and internet access to check on flights. All in all, a charming hotel; we'll return next year for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: pjlegal
Reviews.Content: Friends and I just came back from several days here. First, the staff is first class. From the front desk to the kitchen, to the waiters and everyone else, they are all so helpful, a pleasure to be around and deal with, and do everything possible to make your stay great. The hotel is always clean, the food for breakfast and lunch great, and it's only steps from the beach. Plus, the location, one block from 5th avenue, is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: cbarnes922
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from five days on the Yucatan peninsula and spent two of our nights at the Playa Maya. As everyone says, it is clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and it is away from the noise of 5th Avenue, yet close enough to walk everywhere. The ferry service to Cozumel is a short walk on the beach. The breakfast was great and we enjoyed the fact that we were eating right on the beach, overlooking that beautiful tourquoise ocean. I was able to get up early,take a beach walk and see the sunrise before breakfast while my husband slept in. We had a car rental, which made it more difficult. 8th Street, where the hotel is located, is blocked off to cars down by the hotel. We were frantically looking for a place to park, so we could check in. We ended up parking in a yellow zone and once we walked and found the entrance, Pablo told us we could not park in the yellow zone and that there was a public parking garage nearby (which was much easier than trying to find a parking place)The policia did let my husband through to drop off our bags before he parked the car, and the garage was only a couple of blocks from the hotel. We lost one of our keys within the first couple of hours we were there and the hotel does have a $40.00 charge for lost keys..so be careful. There is a guard on duty in front of the hotel at night so we felt secure. I would also recommend having dinner at the Fusion restaurant just down the beach. We had a delicious seafood dinner which was inexpensive, and you can be in the sand. There was live music that night also. Look for the lighted tiki torches.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya - a great hotel on the beach!!”
Reviews.Author: Rikbo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two other couples stayed at the Playa Maya from Jan 18th through the 26th. Suffice to stay our whole experience with this hotel was wonderful. Starting with our reservations made with Stephen Ryberg all through our stay and eventual (but sad) departure everything was just great. Mr. Ryberg worked with us to help us get into different rooms since we had booked at a time when our preferrred rooms were not available. He was able to switch us around so we stayed in a variety of rooms which was nice so that we know next time what we would prefer. He even advised us of a cancellation that got us into an ocean view room when we had none before. The staff was friendly and attentive. The rooms were clean and spacious. The only entrance is right off the beach which we like given the added security it offered. The breakfasts were great and you had a nice variety you could choose from. Every morning I got up early to insure our lounges were right on the water and Alberto took good care of all three couples. We stayed 8 days and had a wonderful time. I can highly recommend Xel-Ha as a wonderful water park to visit. Already looking forward to next year. DITA transportation is the way to for transport to and from Cancun. Not the cheapest but excellent service and vehicles and recommended by Playa Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Northernlitesgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playa Maya for two weeks from Dec. 19th - Jan. 2/08. We had a superior oceanview room on the 3rd floor -the room was very clean and spacious. Housekeeping was excellent throughout our stay. The staff of the hotel are what make it a wonderful place. The hotel is small and personable - take some time and get to know the staff and you will not be sorry - the service we received was exceptional. The food and drinks were excellent and the "free" breakfast was great - it was so nice to sit with our feet in sand and enjoy our morning coffee. I read a few other reviews stating that there were rocks on the beach - I was in the water everyday and did not see any rocks - nice sandy beach. It was really nice to be so close to the beach - we could easily run up to our room if needed throughout the day. The hotel is close to 5th Ave and we found the location to be very central to everything in Playa. We will definately be back. PS - The stockings left on Christmas morning were a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ddnd03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED everything about the Playa Maya. This is one of those reviews where I am worried to rave too much because I don't want everyone to know about this spot, nor do I want the hotel to raise their prices! But, I'll be honest anyway.... The front desk staff was fantastic. Loved Pablo! We walked up and down the beach everyday and I think our beach and the location of our hotel was the best around. We had no problems getting chairs, the beach was sandy (not rocky) and active and the staff on the beach was terrific! We would stay on the beach all day and Raul and the rest of the guys would bring us ice cold buckets of beer, or amazing fish kabobs and guacamole, and the prices were awesome and everything was so fresh! Everything about this place was steps away. The sea was steps from your room. If a big cloud approached, you could step away from the beach to check your email at the free computer and make it back to your chair as the cloud was passing. The free breakfast was on the beach - which was awesome, and the breakfast food fantastic. The action (5th ave) was also steps from your room. I don't think I've had a more convenient vacation! No taxis, no long walks to get to the resort pool or restaurant, & no long elevator ride to get to your room.... Everything was cozy and easy. I am so excited to come back and I am delighted to share this place with others. Thank you for a perfect stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: funteacherWashington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya the week of Christmas. It is a cozy little hotel with lots of personalized service. Aide at the front desk is wonderful and willing to help out in any way. The beach was a little crowded when the weather was good but not too bad. We stayed in room #301 which had an awesome view overlooking the pool, restraunt and beach. We ate free breakfast each morning at the hotel restraunt and that was good for a FREE breakfast. After a week stay here we went to Cancun and Playa is so much better than Cancun. We loved being able to walk to shopping and restraunts in Playa del Carmen. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Playa Maya!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanJimmy
Reviews.Content: Playa Maya trip report - Nov. 7-15, 2007 Arrival: Our driver from the Cancun airport had never been to Playa Maya before and did not know where it was. Fortunately, our confirmation email included directions in Spanish, which we gave to our driver and he went straight to it. Our driver was helping us with our bags when the Playa Maya staff spotted us, ran over, grabbed our bags and took them the rest of the way for us. The short walk across the beach to access the hotel is not an inconvenience at all - in fact it adds to the secluded feeling. Check-in: Check-in was a breeze. We presented our confirmation email and passports and were on our way to the room in a matter of minutes. Accomodations: We were on the third floor, facing the ocean. The room was spacious, had a mini-fridge that got a fresh bottle of water put in daily. The king bed was as comfortable as any other bed we've had in Mexico. They tend to be on the firm side, but that's my preference. The air conditioner was plenty powerful for the size of the room - we were never too warm. The room had a flat panel TV, plenty of channels, though nothing we normally watch. The patio was small, but it did accommodate two chairs and a small table. We enjoyed sitting out on our patio, looking out at Cozumel, all the activity on the water and on the beach. There is a computer connected to the internet available for use in a common area by the pool. It was nice to be able to check email at no charge. There are also plenty of internet cafes around PdC. Later in the evenings, there was a security guard at the entrance which was nice. We took advantage of the free breakfast nearly every day. It was a good amount of food and enough variety that you didn't have to eat the same thing every day. The service in the Playa Maya restaurant was always friendly. Fast service is not the norm in Mexico, you just need to relax and adjust to local time. We also had lunch at Playa Maya a couple of days, both at our lounge chairs and at the seating area. The food was good and reasonable priced. The beach was great. The hotel has lounge chairs right in front, and the hotel provides beach towels.Umbrellas are also provided free of charge if you are staying at Playa Maya. Some days there see a fair amount of day trippers from cruise ships. We enjoyed conversing with people from the different cruise ships. The water was not super warm in November, but once we got in, we could stay in for long periods of time. The bottom was sandy and there were small fish swimming all around. Playa del Carmen has so many restaurants that you could stay there for weeks before having to eat at the same place twice. In eight days, we ate at many different restaurants - Mexican, Italian, and Argentinian. We enjoyed the majority of our meals. Fifth Avenue has not only a lot of restaurants, but all the shopping you could ever ask for. Probably too much. It is closed to vehicle traffic with the exception of a few of the cross streets. There is a WalMart, just a short walk up Calle 8, on the right as you are walking away from the beach. We did one side trip. We caught the collectivo in Play del Carmen and rode to the Tulum archealogical zone, toured the Tulum ruins, then found beach access and walked the beach heading south. We caught a taxi at a hotel into the town of Tulum where we had lunch at a street side restaurant. We had also planned on taking the ferry to Cozumel, but sand gravity got the better of us. We ran out of our own books to read, but there are many paperbacks available in the lobby and we borrowed a couple. We will be more than happy to field questions regarding Playa Maya or Play del Carmen in general.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on beach, comfy”
Reviews.Author: torontowithkid
Reviews.Content: The location was great, although I concur seats at the beach were quickly taken up. The beds and bedding were clean and comfy. Internet was included in a quiet lounge. The pool was microscopic by pool stantards but a fun configuration for my 5 yr old son. The rooms were tastefully decorated with storage options, a desk, a chair, a good TV. I asked for help with laundry (my son had thrown up on me) but apparently laundry is done off site. Reservations were easy, they were flexible about check in time. The shower worked well, a good supply of hot water, plus they supplied drinking water as well as a little fridge. My one surprise was breakfast, they were kind of finickety what precisely fell within the included guidelines, scrambled eggs with ham OK, mexican scrambled no meat, extra cost. The breakfast if you had to pay was a very fair price but I found it to be just alright taste-wise, presentation-wise, not absolutely fantastic, perhaps it would have been really great value if I ate meat. Over all a good experience, we felt safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shedevil
Reviews.Content: I went to the playa maya this past August for my Honeymoon. My husband and I stayed here for a week. The hotel itself was very nice. The standards of cleanliness were remarkable. The maid did a wonderful job. The only problem with the cleaning service is we felt obliged to leave our room by 9:00 AM since that is when the cleaning woman arrived. So much for relaxing on the balcony. This wasn't too big a deal though since the ocean is so close and very relaxing. One thing we loved about the hotel is as soon as you went to the beach you had someone from the staff asking if you wanted a beach chair or umbrella. And the beach is literally 15 steps fromt he hotel. The only inconvenient thing about the bach was that the water in front of our hotel had huge rocks you had to walk over to get into water. It was hard to get in the water without looking like a complete idiot. I have seen alot of people complaining about having to walk through the beach to get th the hotel enterance. When we got there we couldn't figure out why everyone complained about this so much. You come off the main street and walk a total of maybe a minute through the beach. It really wouldn't be inconvenient to anyone except for a person who is handicapped. The breakfast every morning was pretty good. We never had any other meal there. Though the breakfast was good, we found the wait staff to be rather rude. This is probably because we only speak very poor spanish, and this didn't sit well with most of the Mexican people. Other than that all the other staff was very friendly. The air conditioning worked wonderfully in the room, which was a relief from the afternoon heat. The shower was also always hot with reat water pressure. All in all I would say this is a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: rdhmeh
Reviews.Content: A very nice and clean hotel. The free breakfast was very good. Only one block from main tourist and restaurant area of Playa del Carmen (5th street). Was isolated from noise occurring on 5th street. Playa del Carmen is a very nice and relaxing place to visit. When we return to Playa del Carmen we will stay at the Playa Maya again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: winnident
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Playa del Carmen before but this time wanted to try Playa Del Karma since I noticed some good comments about them. I also saw some negative ones and decided to take the risk. I stayed in one of their “Palapa rooms”. You would never expect how cozy and comfortable are these rooms. This is the real Mexican style. An oasis of tranquility where the tropical garden and the little pool dominate the scene. It is also very convenient at just two blocks away from the Quinta Avenida, you could not ask for more. I would say one of the best value for money hotels in the area. They also prepare a very nice theme dinner on Fridays. Atmosphere was definitely at its best, candlelight and a good bottle of wine to complement unique dishes. We really made an effort to leave but we really wanted to encourage these guys to continue to do what they’re already doing with the same passion we witnessed. We’ll see you guys next summer ! Vincent (Rome)

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle44
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how wonderful Playa Maya and Steve are!!! We just got married in Playa del Carmen on November 10th and a lot of our guests stayed here. Everyone always met for breakfast here. The prices, the service and the ambiance were perfect! I have stayed here before and will again! Can't beat Playa Maya for cleanliness, comfort, location, generosity.... anything!! Thanks Steve and everyone at Playa Maya - you're the best!!

Reviews.Title: “The Right Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stylebook
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! Took the ADO public bus from the Cancun airport ($8 a person, air-conditioned, bathroom, 50 min. trip to Playa) and got off at the bus station, which is a few short blocks from the Playa Maya. The hotel has beach access only, which we enjoyed. The staff comes rushing to help you with your suitcases when they see you on the beach. The hotel is within a very short walking distance of the Cozumel ferry dock, 5th Avenue, and just about anything you'd need to find. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the shower large (with water pressure!), the air conditioning worked great, the toilet flushed (this is a problem in some hotels in Mexico), the rates were reasonable, the landscaping pretty and the view was fantastic. There were nice touches, such as big, thick towels, a small refrigerator in the room, and umbrellas to borrow if it was raining. We received an extra towel to use as a beach towel daily. The morning coffee was ready early and the breakfast (served at 8) was very good. This hotel had a real homey feel to it, which I'm not sure we would have gotten at a larger hotel. We got to know the friendly desk staff pretty well by the end of our week's stay. The hotel was a tranquil getaway, yet only a block from the busy 5th Avenue bars, shops, and restaurants. Internet access was reasonable and reliable. You can see the Cozumel skyline and hear music on the beach at night. The pool is small but pretty. This wasn't a concern for us, since we truly felt we were staying on beachfront property at the Playa Maya. We felt more free to explore some of the area restaurants and cuisine than we would have if we had stayed at an all-inclusive resort, although the restaurant at the hotel is very good, too. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home!”
Reviews.Author: sunrlb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya 9/13th - 17th. This was our third stay. I get all warm and fuzzy feeling as our transfer van stops at the end of 8th street. It feels like we are coming home. I can't wait to jump out of the van, take my shoes off, hit the sand and round the corner to Playa Maya. Ahhhhh..........I'm on vacation. Upon checking in, we received a big welcome back from Adriane who works in the restaurant. Jorge came to shake hands and Alberto had a nice to see you again smile for us. We had an early arrival, so our room wasn't ready yet. No problem - grabbed lunch and drinks on the beach and chatted with Jorge (he was our waiter most of the time) and Delmy. Aide came to tell us our room was ready a tad bit early.....great off to the room. As always the room was clean, spacious and all we needed. Frig stocked with water and a couple of beers and sodas. The air worked too well. :) The water pressure was much better this stay. Management has added an extra lock on the door which I'm not sure is needed but makes you feel more secure. The beds as comfortable as always. At 5:45am the coffee is on and the security guard always had a morning greeting for me. The sunrise is worth the trip by itself. :) The hotel starts to come alive around 7am.
