Roberto arrives to set up the restaurant (sometimes by 6:30am) and rake the beach, the pool is being cleaned and things are power washed. The wonderful smell of breakfast cooking starts to fill the air. A note about the pool: I have seen complaints on it not being clean. It was cleaned every morning that we were there. The pool is like 20 steps from the beach. You can expect sand in it!! I doubt there is any way it is avoidable unless one person it going to be vacuuming no stop. The flavor is back in the food!! Playa Maya has the BEST beef tacos by far! Yum...love them. The coconut shrimp are good and the chicken tacos are a must try. We had excellent service at the restaurant and beach. A note about service: take a moment to really acknowledge your waiter, try a little chatting. It will make your stay much nicer for you and them. I saw one person not even looking at the waiter while ordering and a few treated them like only the hired help. Those people are missing out on an added bonus of traveling that makes your vacation more memorable. We have some great vacation memories that came from chatting with the locals. Try it! We paid for the wireless internet for the convenience. However there is free internet access in the lounge. The wireless works well and is $5 a day........not bad. Aide and Pablo are wonderful at the front desk. Aide is new and a great addition. Love her smile. Pablo has been there for awhile. If you take the time to chat with him, you will walk away feeling like you ran into an old friend. He is very helpful for advice about the town. Looking forward to our April stay with our kids and parents. P.S. – Steve please let the staff know they did an excellent job and made our stay even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Love Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTravellers
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying at Playa Maya. My boyfriend and I were so happy with every aspect of the hotel. The staff was extremely attentive, the food was excellent and we had a beautiful view of the ocean. We stayed in a deluxe balcony room (#302) - we could hear the waves from our room. The room and bathroom were also good-sized. I researched hotels in Playa del Carmen for a couple of months before making a decision. Based on reviews on Trip Advisor and Frommer's, I narrowed it down to Shangri-La Caribe and Playa Maya before making a final decision. During our stay in Playa del Carmen, we saw Shangri-La Caribe. The hotel looked really nice, but it's too out of the way...it would take about 20 minutes to walk to the main shopping area. Playa Maya is in a perfect location - the shopping and restaurants are just a block away. I wanted to make sure I mentioned that in this review because I can imagine that there are other people reading Frommer's that might also be trying to decide between the two hotels. Again, I highly recommend booking Playa Maya. We wouldn't even consider staying at another hotel if we go back to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “I would give it 6 stars if I could!”
Reviews.Author: TandG
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the other positive reviews about the Playa Maya. Although I have been in PDC many times it was my first experience at this property. I was in Room 203, 8/26 to 8/30. When you stay here you don't feel like a tourist, you feel like family. Thank you Pablo and thank you Ida for the use of an umbrella when we had showers. The rooms were impeccibaly clean, and plenty of hot water. The pool was cleaned every day and also they were raking the beach in the morning. The complimentary breakfast was delicious, the waitstaff, alert, I cannot think of one negative and Steve was off the property when I was there. Steve, you've done a great job of selecting and training your staff. I plan on bringing my family here in January or February.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kdon
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I booked this vacation for her 20th birthday. Overall the trip was very enjoyable. The food at the hotel was fantastic. Service was slow but sitting under the thatched roof watching the ocean made it enjoyable. We thought the complimentary breakfasts were great. Rooms were clean and the front desk staff was very nice. It was the kitchen and beach staff that needed improvment. The beach was very overcrowded because the staff spent all their time trying to rent umbrellas to beachwalkers. The hotel guests were just overlooked. There would have been plenty of space with out this problem. We were stacked on top of one another. I noticed the other hotels around us had plenty of beach space. We had to walk to the bar for drinks, etc., while the staff was busy haggling with the beach walkers. There was one worker doing everything, and the rest just doing nothing. This was my main complaint, and the fact that the restaurant closed sooo early. It was a very short walk across the sand to the entrance of the hotel. This was not a problem at all. Hotel staff carried all of our bags. The water was beautiful and the location great. Pool was dirty, never saw anyone cleaning it our whole visit, but who needs a pool when you have the beautiful ocean right in front of you. Would consider this hotel again if not for the overcrowding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, average service”
Reviews.Author: Laurelena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the PLaya Maya for 4 nights. At first we reserved 2 nights, and since we didnt know how long we would be able to stay in PDC we would pay for each night separately every morning (due to work). We were planning on staying for 7 nights, but the reason we didnt was because they had promised a $100 dollar discount upon staying for 7 nights, but we were then told that since we payed each night separately they couldnt honor this "policy". I don't understand what the difference is.... so we switched to another hotel. I asked if they could ask the "manager" because we did want to stay there, but they said there was no manager on duty.... By the way the internet is not free.. there is a $5 per day charge. The service at the restaurant not good, and the food very mediocre. Pablo at the front desk, and another man which I can't remember his name were helpful, also the guard. The rooms are nice, good A/C... clean bathrooms... I didnt find the accesibilty to the hotel to be a hassle, since I called from my cel phone and they did come to help at the end of the street. I would recommend that if you stay at the PLaya Maya you clear things out beforehand. Thank You,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beachfront hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: melliedee
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Playa Maya for a week in July and had a terrific and relaxing vacation. I'll hit on four major points: 1) Location, location! You just can't beat staying right on the beach with only a quick one block walk to all the action on Fifth Avenue. As others have stated, the Playa Maya has beach only access. Within minutes a hotel worker appeared to heft our luggage over the sand and right to the check in desk. 2) Rooms. We stayed in a "Superior Balcony" room with a gorgeous view. The rooms were exceptionally clean with the kind of super-charged AC one needs during July in Mexico. Cable TV and a small fridge stocked with a few welcoming beers and resupplied with a fresh bottle of water daily. Everyday we returned from our adventures in town to freshly made beds, a clean shower, and new towel art. We joked a lot with Juan for having a few "sleeping in" days, and he was always in good humor about our night owl ways. 3) Service. As others have stated, the hotel staff is extremely accommodating and friendly. Many thanks to Ayde, Pablo, Juan, Raciel and others who made our stay so great. With a tip from Ayde, we discovered Cenote Azul, a gorgeous place to snorkel. The hotel has security at night, which is reassuring when you keep late hours. Steve, the owner, was not there the first few days of our stay, but you would not know it from the professionalism of his staff during his absence. We eventually got to meet him in person to tell him how much we were enjoying our stay. 4) Food. I expected "continental breakfast" to be toast and coffee, but was pleasantly surprised at the hearty free breakfast. Choices of scrambled eggs with bacon (and a side of yummy beans!), pancakes, and terrific fresh fruit. We ordered two different ones nearly every morning with enough to share. The hotel also has lunch and dinner under their beachfront palapa. I've posted a pic of their famous coconut shrimp, which lived up to other traveler's raves. After breakfast, a worker would set up our loungers and umbrellas and we spent most early afternoons soaking up the sun with brief trips to the restaurant for frozen drinks and snacks (get the guacamole!). All in all, a terrific stay. This was our first trip to Playa del Carmen and we are hooked! The Playa Maya is your best bet if you want an affordable, quiet, clean and friendly beachfront hotel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointing Service”
Reviews.Author: tiaretahiti666
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a trip to Playa del Carmen and we stayed at the Playa Maya for 2 nights. Here is the deal: the rooms were big, clean, AC was great. There was a hamac on the patio but we couldn't use it since there were 2 chairs there as well that we couldn't remove. The location was good but a negative aspect: good because it's right on 5th street so very close to restaurants and stores. The negative aspect was that the street was blocked to cars so it was a pain to get close to the hotel and unload the luggage. The beach is very nice but lots of people and the water is rocky and not very clean. We tried to eat breakfast at the restaurant but we had to wait 15min until somebody came to give us the menu which didn't look appetizing so we left. If it had only been for the above items, i would still have thought that the hotel was good. But what really made it an unpleasant experience was the service. So i guess since the owner was out of town, the staff really slacked off. It started as soon as we arrived. I had to ask the receptionist twice to send somebody over to help us upload the luggage from the car. Then, at the beach, we asked if we could get a couple more sunbeds and umbrella. They just laughed at us and never came and not because they were busy doing something else. During the 3 days we stayed, we always saw 3-4 guys from the staff in the hamacs next to the restaurant (at one point we thought those hamacs were not for hotel guests) and 2-3 seated at the restaurant reading newspaper or chatting. It was just a hassle to ask them anything. Now, 1 more thing: i am surprise to read from other reviews that internet was free, since they charged us $5/day for internet. So it is free or not? Overall, the hotel itself was good but the service very dispapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Beware in room, nice front desk staff, won't be back”
Reviews.Author: TrvlrInfo
Reviews.Content: I thought I would be writing a decent review for Playa Maya Hotel, however, we are now having to rid ourselves of bedbugs which most certainly came from the Jacuzzi/Garden Room in which I stayed eight nights in mid-June 2007. Although I'm sure Stephen Ryberg (owner) will provide a long response which may seem professional, I can assure you from my direct correspondence trying to address the matter - it's like speaking with a lawyer. It seems like he's listening, but it is only a cover to try and make it seem like he cares and absolve his responsibility. First let me say that I stayed only at Playa Maya Hotel and had no other travels offering the introduction of bedbugs to my belongings. I did experience bites while there, but had never encountered/knew anything of bedbugs prior so I did not recognize what was happening at the time and didn't know to check under the sheets/mattress. I believe it was a building problem as I had only a few bites as opposed to being covered as I have now read from other travelers' horror stories. Although, I almost wish I had been so I would have known immediately to leave and take great care with my luggage upon returning home as it would have prevented the nightmare of trying to get rid of them now. If you decide to stay - check your matresses or futons! I was hesitant to write this review at all but felt like I should at least warn people, hopefully they have all ready taken care of the problem - but if there are other people out there that have had the same experience, I encourage you to write because that was one of their claims of no problem - there haven't been internet postings. I relied a lot on the various reviews on this site and others, so I thought I ought to at least put the information out there. Playa Maya/Stephen Ryberg has denied all responsibility as if I imagined the problem and since I did not complain while there that there must not be a problem. Well, I guess if the room had been totally infested or I had known what bedbug bites looked like vs mosquitoes then I would have complained; maybe the current guests will find otherwise ( unless they have since sprayed/treated the room[s]). I agree with the other guest reviews as well that the restaurant staff is not friendly (but tipping well will help) and it did get old watching them try to lure walkers-by onto their part of the beach. The breakfast was good, but I don't recommend going early; I went down for early breakfast and they were still combing the beach and didn't offer any service even though it was all ready into the supposed serving time. Also had no coffee one morning - now that puts the brakes on breakfast you if you like your coffee in the a.m. like I do. I will say the non-restaurant staff were very friendly, my thanks to Ayde (sp?), Pablo and Angelina. Other things that were problematic: My room floor was flooded from the hot water heater when I arrived; they did give me access to another room to shower for the couple days it took to repair the problem in mine but offered no discount until my recent correspondence - I should have complained more while I was there evidently. The computer with internet access broke and was not repaired, for at least several days as I did not have access for 1/2 my stay. Some of the lights - by the jacuzzi and in my room did not work. There were tiny ants - and trust me, I kept everything that could have been attractive to them in the fridgerator (that froze everything). And the staff was aware of the flood, broken computer and broken/malfunctioning lights. Getting to the hotel is a pain due to the sand-only entrance, especially of you're traveling a lone. You have to lug your luggage across another hotel's (Alhambra) beach/dining area and then someone from PM will probably see you and help. It's not as if you can leave your luggage on the street and walk over and notify them for help. The location overall is pretty good. It's nice to be right on the beach, although it does get crowded and there are a lot of boats that dock/load-up during the day right near by and you do get the fumes. The water was merky - really no snorkeling or such right on the PM beach as it's overworked/busy with little ocean life. It's nice and quiet at night, never had a problem with noise as there are no loud clubs near by. Nice walking distance to the main drag and tons of restaurants - although I was surprised by how "americanized" the places and prices seem to be compared to many other places in Mexico. It's sad to me to provide such a poor review and to have to deal with such a gross problem as a result of trying to take a vacation. It was terrible since I've had the bedbug experience - it would have been all right if I hadn't. I had several friends staying in other locations around Playa del Carmen at the same time - I recommend looking elsewhere given the bedbugs and the owner's attitude when customers have had problems. Probably be a good stay thanks to the staff if you don't have any trouble - but if you do have a problem - as others have written, don't expect the owner to sincerely help. There's plenty of other value in Playa del Carmen and none of my other friends brought back bedbugs either!

Reviews.Title: “A gem on the beach”
Reviews.Author: reztib
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had our honeymoon at Playa Maya. We had a wonderful time with our room and enjoyed every minute of our stay. We visited after Wilma had visited about 4 months prior and the beach was fantastic. The staff is extremely attentive and helpful with getting everything together. They allowed us to relax but at the same time willing to assist with anything we needed or requested. The Playa Maya is located a block off Quinta Avenida. Steve (the owner) was very open and had great communication with us before we arrived about the condition of the hotel post-Wilma. He posted several pictures on the web site and gave constant updates when he could on his hotel. He alleviated any concerns about the beach, room condition (my wife was very allergic to mold and the rooms were in great shape) and the overall landscape. The breakfast options are terrific. For a peso or two you can get eggs and juice with your continental breakfast. After we left, our bar and breakfast bill was only $130 US,.. for a week! We didn't drink like fish but with having breakfast every morning and a couple drinks a day it was suprising how reasonable it was. The pool is not great. But who needs a pool when you have the greatest beach in the world. I imagine if you have children this might not be the best option for a hotel. If you are running around doing your own activities anyway this is still a good option for families. I couldn't have imagined how our honeymoon would have been spent anywhere else. We thought about going to an all-inclusive hotel at first but if we ever go back to Playa Del Carmen we will never need to.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: sedonico
Reviews.Content: Overall, my sister and I enjoyed our stay at the Playa Maya. We were there from July 28th to the 31st. Our room was very clean and bright. We loved having an ocean view! The staff were all nice and helpful, especially Pablo at the front desk. The food at the restaurant was good, and we enjoyed being able to eat breakfast and lunch on the beach. The beach itself was very nice, of course, and beach umbrellas are provided for everyone. We also enjoyed our time by the pool. This hotel was very nice and we would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others. I did have one issue that could have become a serious issue for me. When we checked in, we were only given one key to the room. However, we did not think this was a problem. On our first night we met up with friends, but my sister decided to leave early. Obviously, she had the key. When I arrived at the hotel, the gate was locked and the guard asked to see my key. I explained that we only had one key and that my sister had it. He said that he was sorry, but that without a key, he could not let me in. I was able to explain my situation, and understand his explanation in Spanish, so this was not an issue of language confusion. I started to get upset as this situation continued. He eventually let me in, but seemed very reluctant to do so. I am not sure what I would have done, had he refused to let me in. The next day we requested and received a second key. However, the man at the front desk said that second keys are not always available. I can certainly appreciate the security that is provided by a locked gate and a guard. However, I feel that Playa Maya should provide guests with a way to prove that they are legitimate guests, especially if they can't provide all the guests with a key. At the very least, guests should be warned that they will need to show their key to get in if they return to the hotel past a certain time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable beachfront vacation!”
Reviews.Author: PredForte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights at Playa Maya in one of the delux terrace rooms at the begging of the month. Overall we had a very nice time. The hotel is very cute looking on the outside. The pool is small, but still nice. The beach is truly beautiful. It was wondeful to have chairs and an umbrella set up for us when we wanted to relax on the beach. The food was generally good, though the breakfast menu was small. After the first breakfast or two we got a little bored with the offerings and ended up going to a roadside cafe. However, the waitstaff was extremely responsive and fast. All you had to do was turn your head to look at them from the beach and they were there to take your drink order. The drink prices seemed fair, considering the location and service. The hotel is extremely convenient to both the downtown of Playa del Carmen and the ocean. We didn't mind carrying our bags over the sand. It's quite a short distance (especially if you enter from 8th Street.) Sitting the beach was wondeful. There is a lot of activity and it's excellent for people watching. Swimming was great too. The waves were not too small, but not scary. We enjoyed the ocean view and balcony of our room. The staff kept it very clean. The furnishings were spartan, but that wasn't a problem, except that we would have liked having an alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rizan22
Reviews.Content: My stay was in December but just getting to this now. Overall a nice, friendly little hotel! Pros Great location Very clean rooms Very helpful and nice staff (mostly). Food- I only had breakfast at the hotel and thought it was good And did I mention great location Cons Location……..for me the hotel sits in a truly great location but I hated actually having to walk through the sand to get to and from the hotel, was just a little irritation of mine. No desk clerk after hours. One night when I came in rather late, I found someone sleeping in the sand, before I knew it I was being chased into the hotel by this man whom I seemed to have roused when I shut the hotel gate. The next morning I was told he was security……..some security, fast asleep in the sand! One not so nice desk clerk who refused to transfer a call into my room twice, saying he didn’t speak english and the caller must speak spanish. Funny I had a couple of very lengthy conversations with this person and he seemed to speak great english at the time. I’ve listed some rather insignificant cons, although I will say as I was being chased by a man at 3am, it didn’t seem so insignificant at the time…….it was an “oh God I don’t want to be the front page story tomorrow” moment LOL. Overall I think for the money this is a great value, it really is a nice little hotel and in a great part of Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for beach front hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: tmsvan2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very friendly workers. It is in a great location, the food and amenities are great. I will stay there again next time I am in Play del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: beachbumaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya May 11 – 15. This is our 3rd stay in PDC in as many years. This was our first stay at Playa Maya. We booked just about 2 months out, so we were only able to get the Deluxe Jacuzzi Garden Room. Our room had one king bed, a futon sofa, a flat-screen TV, a DVD-Player, a mini-refrigerator and a private patio with a Jacuzzi. The room was a very nice size, everything in perfect working order. A large walk-in shower (no tub) with good water pressure. As all beds tend to be in Mexico, ours was quite hard. Our housekeeper cleaned our room every day and did a very fine job! Our room was just fine, but I would much prefer an Ocean View on future trips. The location of Playa Maya is awesome. Right on the beach, right in the middle of town, just a short walk to anywhere. The beach-only access is just that…you must walk on the beach to get to the entrance. It is one of several things that make this hotel unique. The staff is what really makes this hotel shine. They WILL assist you with your luggage across the sand when you arrive (if you notify them that you’ve arrived, as they wouldn’t know otherwise). I asked Pablo (the afternoon Front Desk) for two extra pillows on my second day. He didn’t have them, but promised to try to get me them the following day…and he did! Joaquin always provided excellent service during breakfast and also drink service on the beach during the day. And finally, our housekeeper did a great job every day. Although I never saw him/her, or know their name, they did a wonderful job of cleaning our room everyday. He got every piece of sand swept up off the floor every day! The hotel has a computer with Internet available for guest use, free of charge. I used it the morning of my departure to check on my flight status. Wireless Internet is also available, for $5.00 per day charge. The beach at Playa Maya is very nice. They will get your beach chairs set up for you each morning, along with an umbrella and a little side table. The beach itself is very nice. The water this time of year was a little chilly for me, but it was still very comfortable to swim in, once I got used to the temperature. The only thing I would mention about Playa Maya is that it is certainly a quiet hotel in the evening. By 8PM or 9PM, the bar and restaurant are closed and there is no one around. You have to walk up into town to get something to eat or drink later in the evening. Overall, I really enjoyed our stay at Playa Maya and would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but like a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: TangoTravelers
Reviews.Content: The staff was slow to warm up to us when we arrived, but by the second day was really, really nice and helpful. It's a great location and very quiet, especially for a place in the middle of Playa del Carmen. The room was standard, like a chain hotel, with no charm or distinguishing factors. So much could be done with decoration or local art, but wasn't. There's huge potential here if the owners decide to dress it up a bit! Quite pretty on the outside and an unbeatable location right on the beach. Those with heavy bags will struggle to get to reception, as you have to walk on the sand past another hotel to get in on the beach side of the building, which is the only entrance. Don't expect to roll your suitcase to the door here. The shower was pretty good, they were generous with towels for the beach and got us beach chairs when it looked like there might be none left. Breakfast was inferior.

Reviews.Title: “Invariably impeccable”
Reviews.Author: liapa
Reviews.Content: It is hard to call something impeccable, but Playa Maya hotel fits this description. We stayed for one week in April and it was a second visit after a few years. The experience was just as invariably great; the management and the staff is friendly and accomodating (they almost give you the feeling of home), the rooms are spacious and very clean. If you want a no-stress hotel experience, this is the choice - I even decided to put away the vacation for a few weeks, when the hotel was booked, rather than take a chance with other places. (I list a few restaurant choices below; I think it was a great idea by another guest) Playa Maya was the best combination for us- -reception is exceptionally hospitable, little things we may have found inconvenient (not even worth mentioning!) would be arranged promptly. -we enjoyed great views from the balcony and slept to the sound of the Caribbean sea. it is fairly off the buzz of the town. the room and shower were spacious and comfortable. -location is truly great; the hotel is still one of the few that are directly on the beach, you are one block from the 5th avenue, minutes from the dive shop (we tried Geofish and had a great experience), a beach walk to the Cozumel ferry. -we had the great service and convenience of an "all inclusive" access to everything we wanted without the nuisance of the all-inclusive package (if you don't want to move at all during your stay, the excellent restaurant and bar of Playa Maya will provide you with everything- there were a few guests that did just that for one week; but if you want to have a freedom of a larger choice - again you are one block from the main avenue where all the happening goes and for us it was a great option) -the rate includes breakfast, which you enjoy at the beach restaurant and it is a very nice experience (the coffee from the coffee pot in the hotel is better than the one in the restaurant - as we and few guests concurred). the service is somewhat slow in the restaurant so it is a bit hard to get it over with if you have an early morning trip arranged. we discovered that one had to go an extra step (or an extra tip) to get the restaurant staff to be slightly more welcoming and efficient. Of course anyone will find easily things to do/places to eat around Playa del Carmen, but we were looking for a comforting food and a general rule was to avoid places with flyers and posters advertising the beer or other special offers. This is a sure bet to get the quality meal. However, a few recommendations on 5th avenue - La Caprichoza - offers excellent typical Mexican food (from Guadalajara) - Ula Gula and Tierra Maya (?the last word escapes my memory) - these two offer a high end Mexican food -Deseo lounge- take a few steps up to the lounge where you can enjoy a refreshing breeze, watch a Mexican movie from the 20s and have a drink lying on the "bed" off 5th Avenue -Blue parrot beach club- if you want to see more of the fellow tourists and dance on the platform on the beach (but on that street you can find some of the fanciest restaurants as well - an Asian -fusion place I can not remember the name of just opposite the Blue parrot is very good) off-off 5th Avenue -El Fogon (it is a just an experience because this is what the locals eat you will probably be the only tourist there to enjoy an excellent food)- ask around or at the reception. It is perhaps a better idea to speak some Spanish, since they didn't speak any English.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - and service!”
Reviews.Author: Bedub247
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 6-night stay at the Playa Maya, and we had a great experience. The hotel is very clean, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the location is amazing. We also found the Playa Maya (and Playa del Carmen) to be fairly priced. Perhaps it's due to the exchange rate, but we felt the prices for food and drinks were less than what we had expected ($2 Dos Equis delivered to you on the beach). This was a pleasant surprise! No $5 bottles of water here. . . (Perhaps because they don't get many business travelers, as I only delve into the hotel mini-bars when I'm on the company dime. . . . ) ANYWAY, we really enjoyed our experience in Playa del Carmen and Playa Maya. As previously mentioned, the location of Playa Maya is fantastic - short walking distance to numerous restaurants, bars, shopping, and the hotel is literally on the beach. Sometimes hotels overstate their beach location in pictures, but not here. Playa Maya does a great job with the basics in hotel accomodations - it's clean, the service is prompt and friendly, and the food was good. I would highly, highly recommend the Playa Maya to anyone looking for a nice, clean, relaxing hotel in a great location with excellent service. What else do you need, really? I rated this review 'excellent' because the Playa Maya exceeded our expectations, and I couldn't think of anything negative. This is not to say that 5 dots means 5 stars - this is not the Ritz-Carlton-by-the-sea, but neither is the price. 5 dots means that for the prices we paid we were very impressed. I fully expect that we will return to the Playa Maya in the future. Tangent unrelated to the hotel: I couldn't find good reviews on restaurants around PDC, but we had good food pretty much every night. Here's a run down (we ate every meal outside for an entire week, 3 meals a day. Think about that for a moment): - Yaxche (Mayan/Mexican): Eat here at least once. Excellent, thought about going back again, and really close to the hotel. - Media Luna (Mayan/Mexican): Again, excellent. Highly recommended - La Palapa Hemingway (Mexican): Very good, but a notch below the above - Rolandi's: Italian chain in the mall at the ferry pier - Olive Garden in Mexico. That is not a compliment. I'm sure there is much, much better in the area especially north of Constitueyentes (I butchered that word, I know), so try one of those and let me know what I missed. - La Quinta Pasion (Mexican): Again, fantastic and a little cheaper than the top two. Also in a different area of town that we wouldn't have seen. - Breakfast and Lunch every day on the beach at Playa Maya. Other than the coffee, everything was quite good and priced right.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: rfigari
Reviews.Content: What can I say, except it was WONDERFUL. The beach was so inviting, the service exceptional and the food delicious. Our room was immaculate. We have been before, in fact, this was our third wonderful stay. We hope to go back again next year. It has become our special place, a place where we can completely relax and rejuvenate. We would like to thank Steve and Delmy (the managers/owners) who have been wonderful to deal with any time there was any question or concern (even planning our trip). Anna, Pablo and Mayte at the front desk are so welcoming....Alberto set our chairs out each day with a big smile, and thanks to our wonderful waiters, Raciele, Joaquin and everyone else (sorry I don't have everyone's names) who made our stay so special. The margaritas were the best ever, the coconut shrimp, the chicken and shrimp tacos, the aztec soup...yum. Thank you everyone for making our vacation at Playa Maya so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: Betsy74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playa Maya from the 15th-22nd of March. This was our first vacation to Mexico and I did the research and booked for my husband and I and his brother and girlfriend--so I was nervous that everything was going to turn out o.k. in terms of our hotel. We all were VERY happy with the entire experience at the Playa Maya. I have to say, the rooms were kept very clean (even when my husband would leave his clothes unfolded--they'd be folded and laying on top of the suitcase when we returned). The showers/bathroom were clean and nice (good water pressure), the A/C worked great and the cleaning service was terrific. There was a safe in the room but we probably wouldn't have even had to use it--if there was change laying around, we'd find it neatly placed in our drawer beside the bed. The best staff EVER! Mayte (sp?) was very nice and so interesting to talk to. Pablo made us feel right at home. And our good friend Nico was awesome--it seemed like he knew exactly when we needed "uno mas cerveca":-) Another gal working at the front desk (who's name has slipped my mind now!) helped us set up a taxi for our day trip and they were ALL very polite and made us feel so relaxed. My brother-in-law had always stayed at an All-Inclusive resort and we are all so glad we chose the Playa Maya instead. We were able to experience so many different restaurants--spent a lot of time walking 5th Ave and just stopping in somewhere for a drink and a bite to eat. Although, the food at the Playa was great too. I WILL be booking for next year at the Playa Maya! Until then--hasta la vista and muchas gracias:-) Betsy & Tory Herding

Reviews.Title: “The general manager is not guest friendly”
Reviews.Author: cricket10
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend staying at Playa Maya while in Playa del Carmen. If you run into difficulty and have to deal with the general manager, you will meet an arrogant bully of a man. I feel so sorry for the staff at Playa Maya; I can't imagine working for someone like that. He has a long explanation for everything and he will not listen to guest problems.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Front Property With Great Food”
Reviews.Author: beachygirl62
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Playa Maya and if what you are looking for in lodging is a clean place to sleep and take a shower it is great. The restaurant/bar serves great food and drinks and they have great hammock type swings on the beach-front porch where you can laze your time away. I have read several complaints concerning the pool. The pool is small by resort standards but we enjoyed it all the same. Portions of it are shaded in the late afternoon and are a nice break from the sun and sand. The rooms we stayed in were very sparse and certainly not what I would call comfortable for anything other than sleeping. Again, if you are looking for luxury accommodations with cozy chairs/sofas/bedding/etc. this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a clean place to lay your head, take a shower and have some beach time - it works well. One thing to keep in mind is that the rate you are paying includes beach front accommodations. In my opinion, if this were not a beach front property the rooms would be overpriced but as the old saying goes, "location, location, location". All in all, I like the Playa Maya and would recommend it to those who are looking for a no-frills trip to the beach. Be sure and try the shrimp dishes - they are to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, friendly place.”
Reviews.Author: Nittfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Playa Maya for 6 nights in early January. This is an wonderful little hotel, but please do not mistake a rating of "5" (which means excellent on this site) as the same thing as a 5 star USA hotel such as the Hyatt or The Four Seasons. I gave the Playa Maya a rating of a "5" because of location/price/friendliness/cleanliness and local ambience. The location of Playa Maya is superb. My husband and I are light sleepers and due to the way this hotel is cradled on 3 sides by other establishments (the hotel is basically a big "U" with the opening of the "U" facing the ocean) there is virtually no night time noise, except the ocean! The only night out of 6 that we had trouble with noise was one evening when an obviously VERY drunk young couple arrived back @ the hotel at almost 4:00 in the morning and proceeded to yack on their veranda! But that was not the hotel's fault. This little gem of a hotel is clean, the bathrooms are spotless, the bedding is clean and fresh, and the beds themselves are fairly comfortable as these are firm but not rock hard, (I have heard that the standard hotel bedding in Mexico is VERY firm). All 4 of the hotel's front desk staff are very friendly and more than happy to help you with directions and recommendations. We were always greeted with a smile and warm greeting as we passed the front desk. Playa Maya is only 1 block back from "Avenue 5" - the main shopping/dining street in Playa. You can easily get around without need for a car here, and, if you are interested, just ask the front desk personnel and they will give you information on where and how to catch a "collectivo" to Tulum or other places of interest. You can catch a ride anywhere the collectivo (it is a local, little white van - public transportation) runs for the equivalent of $3.00 US for a one way trip. As I stated earlier, this is a nice, warm, friendly, clean little establishment right on a nice stretch of beach in Playa. It "feels" tropical and Mexican, and the decor is quite pretty and cheerful. But do not expect the services and amenities of a 4 or 5 star mainland USA hotel. The pool is smallish and not heated in winter (as far as I could tell). The hot-tub was never above approx. 96-97F by a toe-touch test that I performed 3 times just to check (I have my own hot-tub so I am pretty good at guestimating the temp.) And, if you have any physical handicaps access to the hotel involves walking across sand approx. 25-30 ft., then up a small staircase (7 or 8 steps?) across a small arched bridge that goes over the pool (incline up and then sloped down), then up about 8-10 steps again to the lobby. Very pretty and picturesque, but possibly a hazard to the elderly or anyone with an unsteady gait; definitely NOT for anyone using a walker or possibly even a cane. If you take the transportation company recommended by the manager Steve ([---]), the taxi driver will take your bags all the way up to the front desk, so that is no problem, and upon checkout there is help to take your bags back to the taxi/van. We had a very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “'Your beachfront home'? I wish my home were this nice”
Reviews.Author: Utahrd
Reviews.Content: This is a great place! Not, it's not the Four Seasons. That's in Hawaii or I think they have one in Cancun. But if you want a great place in Paradise, the Playa Maya is it. The staff from Steve to the guy who carried my overweight bag across the sand and up the stairs with a smile on his face is excellent. The breakfasts are great, too. I'm a firm believer in "When in Playa, do like the Playenses" but they have a great American style breakfast. It's within walking distance to 5th Avenue, the ferry terminal, the bus station, the colectivo stand, the Walmart (hey, that's important). Maybe you'd want to take a taxi at night but you can also walk to the soccer stadium. (That's important, too.) The only people who might not like it are those who are physically challenged, older or have little kids. You have to walk across the sand to get the entrance from 8th Street. The beds are big & comfy, the TV is great (who goes to Playa del Carmen to watch TV?. Well, if there's a good soccer game on, then maybe..........) and the room that we had have refrigerators. They have safes in the rooms and an Internet room. Who needs anything else?

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tlopez99
Reviews.Content: The Playa Maya Hotel was a great place to stay for my group of four. I did a lot of research here and on another Playa message board about the AI's and hotels in Playa del Carmen since none of us had ever been to Mexico before. Not really interested in going the AI route or booking a more expensive luxury hotel, I looked for a smaller beachfront hotel that was reasonably priced and found it perfectly in the Playa Maya Hotel. Actually it exceeded my expectations. The location is great, just a block away from 5th avenue and all the happenings there. When arriving, you have to walk from the street a short distance through sand to get to the hotel. It was not a big deal since a couple of guys from the hotel came and took our bags for us. I thought the hotel was very well-kept and clean. The rooms were plain but quite roomy and very clean. They were even mopped every day we were there. The shower was nice and big and none of us ever had a problem with hot water. There was a small refrigerator in the room that got ice-cold which was nice. I thought it was a nice touch that the refrigerator also came with a big bottle of water and a few other refreshements complimentary. You can't drink the water at the hotel but we pretty much expected that in Mexico. Ice is provided at the bar, just make sure you get down there before closing. The restaurant serves breakfast and lunch daily with a continental breakfast included in the room rate. For breakfast you can actually get more than a simple continental, hotcakes and eggs are available as well. I think there are four continental breakfast choices that are listed on the right side of the menu, just verify with the server as we did. Lunch at Playa Maya is awesome, I think our group ate lunch there every day of our stay. That would probably be overkill for some, but we really enjoyed the lunch menu there. As has probably been said before, the coconut shrimp are indeed awesome, and I also really loved the guanjillo shrimp. Other things we really liked... their guacamole, shrimp tacos, and nachos. There's also a beer bucket (5) w/ nachos for around $12.00 that was available as a special. You can eat under the restaurant palapa or eat at your lounge chair on the beach, great either way. I thought the beach was great in front of the hotel and it was where we spent most of our time. Chairs and towels are provided and servers are always available to bring you whatever you wish for. The service was great and after a couple of days we developed a rapport with two servers who took great care of us. The hotel staff overall was friendly, although there was a language barrier with some people since we don't speak Spanish at all. Regardless, we were almost always greeted with an "hola" by everyone. I think the beach was the best part of our vacation. Which was obviously why it was important to us to find a beachfront hotel. The beach in front of the hotel was actually bigger than I expected and the water was lovely. And as I said chairs, towels and service is provided by the hotel. It was great! There is a pool at the hotel, but none of us care about pools so we spent no time there. I did see it being cleaned every morning I was there. Overall, we all really loved the Playa Maya for what it offers. If you're seeking a luxurious room and pampered service/ amenities then you might not like it, but if you're seeking a small, clean, beachfront hotel with good food and service at a great price well then you should seriously consider this hotel. We would all return in a heartbeat !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakd
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Playa Maya. A terrific property, surpassed only by the freindly staff. A nice location on a fairly wide strip of beach. Very weel maintained property. We had breakfast here most days(included) and lunch several times. The food and service was always very good. As mentioned many times, the coconut shrimp is excellent. We had some things to be straightened out regarding excursions, airport transfers etc, and the front desk staff was very helpful. Not their problem, but they went out of their way to help us. I certainly hope to return here in the future and have no problem reccomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Beach Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ScottLisa
Reviews.Content: We like the smaller hotels that have a more personal feel. We also prefer a beachside setting. We got both with Playa-Maya. We found via the net, used TripAdvisor to get the scoop, and booked direct. All worked out great. Small hotel directly on beach with beach-only access. Right next to the Alhambra Hotel and 6th Street, a block from the main 5th Avenue shopping. Hotel maticulously maintained, owners very attentive, and staff very friendly and helpful. Stayed a full two weeks and enjoyed every minute. Pay a little extra for the ocean view rooms: look out directly at ocean and Cozumel. Garden Jacuzzi Rooms nice, and garden very picturesque, but note that rooms are a bit dark due to garden palapa. Nothing but the highest regards for this hotel and would recommend highly. If you're into the smaller hotel setting without the mega-resort services and amenities this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Birthday Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Spiritlee
Reviews.Content: My daughters planned this vacation for my 60th birthday and it was wonderful. The internet pictures of the hotel were exactly the way it was in person, our room was clean, comfortable and with a wonderful view of the ocean. We had a terrace with a hammock and even though the air conditioner was on all the time, I was able to sleep really well because it was so quite. The wait staff was attentive not only during our meals, also when spending time on the beach, helping with lounge chairs, umbrellas, drinks and food. We had the best beach by far with very little damage from last year's hurricanes. When we walked to the north of our hotel, there were mega hotels with less beach area than we had and they were loaded with sun bathers. I loved our hotel, the beach and especially the great people we met there. I almost forgot, my daughter, Joslyn, treated me to a massage on the beach and it was the best I've ever had. A wonderful gentlemen gently worked my tired muscles, while I listened to the peaceful sounds of the ocean accompanied by beautiful Mexican music. Thank you, thank you, thank you! Adios, Lee

Reviews.Title: “yes, who IS writing those reviews!?”
Reviews.Author: MetFanSimms
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2nd stay at Playa Maya earlier this month, booked directly through Steve at the hotel with ease after having our travel agent recommend the hotel to us for a stay this past March. Good thing she did, too, because we were so pleased to have found such a nice, welcoming, more upscale property on the beach in Playa (though our stay off the beach at La Tortuga 2-3 years ago was also quite good). In fact we have already begun emailing Steve about a possible return next spring. Really surprising before writing this to read back through some of the more recent reviews here. You do really have to wonder who is writing some of them, particularly the one a few down that asks the same question in the title. I'd start with that one, though, as guess what: there was no gym at the hotel for either of our first two stays. Guess Steve & co must have put one in for that family and then took it back out again, huh?!? We stood in what they told us USED to be a gym before the hurricanes, a nice little room with AC, sofa and chairs, and (most importantly for us) a PC with free Internet access. That was great for staying in touch with things back home on both stays. For us the staff at reception (Pedro, Anna and Maitay) were all very helpful, especially with restaurant recommendations and special requests (wife always wants extra pillows). We were served mostly by Joaquin at the beach, also excellent. They set out the beach chairs for us every morning. Breakfast was clear: an announcement right on the menu tells you that you get any of their breakfast combinations free. I stuck with those and they were plenty but my wife was happy to order eggs benedict and pay extra. Reception staff also reminded us about the included breakfast when they showed us to the room (maybe people aren't listening to everything then?). We had a jacuzzi room with a garden and liked the additional space. Figure you're on the beach every day so don't need the ocean view. Lots of channels in English, too. We did have a problem with hot water being out one day, but just reported it to the desk and waited until after breakfast to shower, and it was fine. My advice is to remember that there are a lot of crazies out there, and it looks like some of them have found Trip advisor, judging by some of those comments. We loved Playa Maya and will return for a 3rd stay when we can!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: TexasYank
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Playa Maya in early May of 2006 for three nights. It was our first stay in Playa del Carmen, but we have stayed on the Mayan Riviera in AIs many times. We were anxiously anticipating our stay here, since it sounded so very nice and friendly from the reviews and the website. Overall, we had a good time, and enjoyed our stay, primarily because of the location. Just a block off 5th Avenue, and on the beach...the location couldn't have been better for us. Our oceanview room was clean and adequate. Upon arrival, two bottles of water were in the fridge and could be refilled at the bar as often as you liked. There was also beer and pop in the fridge. A suggestion for improvement would be to put an inexpensive clock in the room, and a small coffee maker. Maybe this isn't the norm for PDC, I don't know. On our last night, we moved to a garden room, which was a delight for me. The room was fine - adequate size and very clean. It had a beautiful little courtyard, sheltered by plants and a palapa-type cover over the outdoor jacuzzi tub. Completely private. There was also a small table and chairs out there. If we were to stay at Playa Maya again, this would be the room I would want. No oceanview - or any view for that matter - but it was very charming and intimate. The food at the restaurant was good. The breakfast was very good, and sitting out on the beach under the palapa with the ocean breeze coming in, made it very enjoyable. We had hamburgers one afternoon, and they were delicious! Some people have complained about the restaurant closing so early. 5th Ave. is only a block away, and there is such a huge variety of restaurants, etc. there, it isn't inconvenient at all not to have the hotel restaurant open later. My only negative comment would be about the friendliness of the help. We'd read so much about how accommodating and friendly everyone there was, and we really didn't find that at all. Other than Pedro, at the front desk when we checked in, and the girl who was at the desk when we checked out, everyone else was very cold. We were pretty much ignored most of the time, until we left the beach the first day, and were chased down by one of the waiters in the restaurant. He said we owed them money from breakfast. (I had no idea he would have ever recognized us, let alone watch us to make sure we didn't walk out on the ticket!) Guests get a free continental breakfast. The waiter gave us menus and didn’t say anything about what we could or couldn’t have, but did ask us for our room number (so knew we were guests). Turned out, they charged me for my breakfast because it wasn’t continental, but didn’t charge my husband (his wasn’t either). When he handed me a menu and didn't say anything else, I wrongly assumed I could choose anything from it. The next day, after being chased down to pay the ticket the first day, I read the menu more closely, and realized that there are only certain items on the menu that are included in the continental breakfast. My mistake, but I don't think it was handled very well. We heard on the beach from other guests that the owner, Steven, was out of the country, and so, we assumed that maybe because he wasn't there, the help was kicking back. We probably wouldn't have even thought anything about it, except for all the raving reviews about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Anyway, all that said, we had a pleasant stay, except for the lack of friendliness. And, despite those negative comments, we would stay there again, primarily because of it's location...close to 5th Ave. and right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Questions who is writing all the good reviews!?!”
Reviews.Author: tonyrusa9
Reviews.Content: We have used TripAdvisor without much question for the last few years. However, having found the many positive - and in fact - overwhelmingly good reviews- posted on this site, we have now come to question the validity based on our recent visit to Playa Maya. My guess is that either the hundreds that are posting here have experienced subpar visits at hotels in Mexico, thus making the Playa Maya appear as great, or that all the posts are not hotel guests. It would also appear, based on the frequency of reports back on this hotel, that the guests of this hotel are very 'internet affluent' as there are soooo many posts. We stayed for a short trip where a number of things went wrong. We had a party of 5 staying in one of the "ocean view' rooms with the expectatiion, based on the price, of a room that contained an actual ocean view. Our room consisted of a slice of the ocean, that where you could definately see water, was by no means on ocean view. I guess we should have done more research, as the photos on the website lead you to believe that there is much more to see than once you arrive. We also found the hotel staff to be near inexistent. In one event, while trying to request a taxi from the front desk (which is little more than a table in an entryway), we waited over 10 minutes for someone to arrive. When asking why it took so long, we were informed that they were short staffed due to it being 'off season'. Leaving feeling a disappointed we went outside and found a cab on our own, probably paying 2x as much as our friends from down the street to get to our destination. While this may seem small, these items began to add up over the week. We were told there would be a water cooler in the gym - this was empty when we arrived. The rooms were ok, and the air conditioning worked fine, but our family spends very little time here. The food was ok, but definately not somewhere you would eat other than to get a snack. Drinks, very bad. Had a margarita that looked to have been sitting on the bar all day and a beer the same. Needless to say, we left and only returned to sleep. With all this, we spoke with a person who claimed to be the manager named 'Steve or Shaun or something like that' and while apoligizing also managed to tell us that we should not expect a 'cold' drink in Mexico due to the humidity and that while the water cooler was a convenience, was really just sometihng that was provided when available. All in all, I felt like we were getting the same treatment as you would getting called into a hotel by one of the street vendors. We were already there, had already paid, and that was the way it went -- it was Mexico. Very disappointing and would recommend looking beyond the reviews a little further. Not to mention, in hindsight, looking back at any bad review, the manager always comes back with some sort of reason why the customer WAS WRONG. Perhaps I'm spoiled in the US, but from my experiece, the customer IS RIGHT regardless of the shortcomings of the hotel or staff. Playa is a fantastic place to visit just do your research before you go and make the most of your trip. I've placed other great reviews for some of the fabulous restarounts we went to, as well as some fun things to do while there. Enjoy - Monica.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and a little problem (steps)”
Reviews.Author: rudidot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable except for the night that there was a city wide power outage. My only problem was the number of steps you must walk to get to the lobby, I estimate about 20. I have back trouble so this became somewhat of a challenge. The tv was better than most Mexico hotels with a few english speaking stations but if I had a say-so I would recommend one of the cable news networks, not CNN Headline news as they repeat themselves every 30 minutes. One of the 3 major networks would be good also and I have been in a number of Mexican hotels that at least had these minimal amount of american stations. I know I sound like an ugly american but it is frustrating not to be able to keep up with the world. The staff was really nice and went out of their way to be accommodating. The food was good and the margueritas were ok. The hotel next door had better. I felt safe in the neighborhood and would recommend it to anyone provided they didn't mind the steps. I, unfortunately, will probably not stay there again because of this (I am 62)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Klaxton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playa Maya for 4 nights in September '06. This is a relatively new hotel. The place is pretty small (I think that's a good thing), I estimate that it is about 75' wide and sandwiched in between the Alhambra and another place who's name I didn't catch. We stayed in a "Jr. Suite" which is a room with a sort of kitchenette on the ground floor right next to the pool. They have a palapa "shed" roof that extends out from the front of the hotel with tables and chairs, its a very pleasant spot to hang out especially in the latter half of the day when the sun is shaded by the building. They have nice beach chairs with umbrellas which they set out front for you to enjoy the paradise. There is an airconditioned room off to one side which contains a PC with internet access for guests to use, this was handy for checking email etc. We met some nice people while lounging out at the beach and everyone was friendly and having a good time. The margueritas were good and cost 25 pesos each. They made decent food (expect to pay US prices though) and we did not get sick during our stay. The hotel manager is American, this is important because the Mexicans seem to have little attention to detail and without supervision they will let things slide. We thought the room was okay but with a few flaws. The plumbing worked well (unusual for PDC). The A/C was plenty cool and not noisy. The TV was a good one and got a lot of cable channels. It was nice to be able to walk only a few feet to the pool or the beach. Everything was clean. However the bed was small for two (full-size I think, not queen). The "kitchen" had a sink and two hotplates, you won't really be cooking any meals there. It was hard to keep from tracking sand into the room as there wasn't a door mat and no convenient place to rinse your feet. Our room had almost zero view out the windows but the upstairs rooms had a view of the beach. The bar/restaurant closes down at 6PM, that's pretty early for people on vacation. They pull in all the chairs, you don't even have a place to sit out in front. There's no ice machine, you can get some ice from the bar but you better do it before it closes in the evening. As other people have mentioned, there is no access to this hotel from the street (in fact you can't even see it). You have to haul your luggage across the sand as you come and go. Its no big deal but not a plus. In general we liked the Playa Maya a lot and would definitely return. Some small complaints but relative to the other places around it was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: hareyakara
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Playa Maya. As a woman traveling alone, I was looking for a place where I would feel comfortable and safe and I found it. Everyone was so kind and helpful. The room was spacious and so clean. The numerous hangers in the closet was very welcome as well as the chest of drawers. So many places to store clothes away. The one thing I would have liked is a drying rack for my bathing suits. The shower was great, the water pressure was perfect and hot water galore. I read a previous review which a woman said she would not feel comfortable walking down Calle Ocho to the hotel at night but I never felt any trepidation at all. There is a little room where there is computer access so I was able to check my e-mail. I sat on the beach under an umbrella most of my time there and couldn't have been happier. The food was delicious. From the shrimp tacos to the guacamole. I cannot wait to go back. I've been telling all my friends about it and I think we're getting a trip organized already!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place”
Reviews.Author: diane_price_2004
Reviews.Content: We loved the Playa Maya, stayed there July 11-16. We had done the AI thing and it was nice but we wanted something somaller and more personal with evertything close by and near to town. I did extensive research before choosing Playa Maya and I was sold on the great reviews, you can believe them. It was less like a hotel and more like having your own place right on the beach but with the amenities of a hotel, housekeeping, restaurant, service, etc. Never had shoes on at hotel, no need to, it was the most relaxing and easiet vavaction we have ever had and we have travelled extensively. The hotel was comfortable and convenient, walked right out your romm, through small reception area, over bridge and you were on beach where you could take your breakfast and lunch under a large palapa while digging your toes in sand, heaven. Great food, the shrimp tacos have become my new most favorite food, also the bucket of beers and nacho plate was very much enjoyed. Rico was most polite and attentive to us, also Mayti and other girl at reception, sorry did not get name, gave great customer service. We had a problem with our airconditioning and Steve, the owner/manager had us in another room in 10 minutes, which we very much appreciated because it was HOT in Mexico in July. When I told Mayti we were checking out at 7:30 before the restaurant opend at 8:00 she arranged for us to have a box lunch to take with us. You get a whole lot of value for your money at this hotel, it was quite inexpensive but the service and amenities were excellent, worth far more than we paid. Had dinner one night at El Fogon, place where the locals go, great food and very cheap, at corner of norte 6 and 30th, two story open air restaurant, only a few blocks from hotel. And the pool was perfect, just right to cool off and take a break from the salt water. Also, always had coffe and breakfast snacks in lobby, and fresh water available on bar at all times, just perfect little details to make your stay that much more enjoyable, never had a bad minute. Keep up the good work, will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sandyflops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya the first week of May and loved it! You have to walk around the front of another hotel at the end of calle 8 on the public beach for about 20 meters to get there, as the entrance is only beachfront. This got us in the mood right away to chill out with a drink even before we checked in. The room was basic but clean and had cute towel art on the bed. A lockbox was included at no extra charge which gave me a place to put my cameras and some valuables. There were some ants in the bathroom, but seeing as how we didn't bring much along and spent little time in there it wasn't a big deal. We kept the louvered window in the shower closed and that seemed to discourage them. Those hanging out on adjacent patios can hear what's going on in the shower so make sure you close the louvers if you're gonna make some noise ;) :P !! We found the coffeepot in the lobby handy for a first cup to sip back up on the room patio in the am since we're the type that like to catch the ocean view sunrise. The hotel's location is a short distance from places on or near avenida 5ta for some great breakfast at places like "java joe's", "xlapak" or "hot!". We only used the free hotel breakfast once since it took awhile to get the food. It was just handy to grab a quick free glass or 2 of fresh squeezed juice on the way out for the day. The maids cleaned the room up quite well around noon and it never had a musty nor a moldy smell. They would move suitcases around to make sure they cleaned up the floor really well so make sure you close those up to make it easier on them. They moved our shoes around too so we learned not to panic if they all ended up in the closet. They never took anything setting around the room, only the tips we left on the bed. We felt they wouldn't have bothered anything anyhow even if we'd forgotten to lock the safe. There's a small fridge with a couple of free complimentary beers, sodas & chocolates in it on arrival which is a nice touch for a small hotel such as this. It kept the food we brought from the store or restaurant leftovers cool enough to snack on. We discovered a metal fixture screwed into the bathroom wall near the tp which was handy for opening beer bottles. The a/c was cool enough for us and just dripped a little, but on the floor, not on the bed. It wasn't very noisy so we could still hear the waves on the beach as we fell asleep, which we found really relaxing. The beds aren't too hard, just firm enough to be good on the back. One day we hung out at the beach in front of this hotel all day & had some tasty blue house drink, some delicious coconut shrimp, margaritas, ceviche and kabobs. The food was great, not too spicy and reasonably priced. Don't feed the seagulls leftover chips upwind of those hangin around the shore though - they won't appreciate that! Hotel guests get free beach towels and first dibs on the hotel's beach loungers and use of the cover pads. When some folks walking down the beach tried to take someone's loungers while the guests went for a walk the guy taking care of the chairs ran them off. Make sure you tip these guys since they work hard making sure you've got food, drinks & an umbrella if you need it. The ocean in front of playa maya isn't real deep till you get out 100 meters or so and was fun to swim in or wave jump when the ferry down the shore came in & stirred up some 1 meter waves. The shore wasn't rocky but I watched out for the dive boats that dock right next to playa maya's beach. If these get to stinkin up things while coming or going I could walk about 50 meters to the left of their docking area & get in the ocean on a really nice spot. One boat actually unloaded someone right in front of playa maya then got whistled & gestured to by the life saver guys, which go up & down the beach all day. There isn't much good snorkeling right in front of the hotel but there's some guys who'll take you out on a small catamaran right near the lighthouse. This hotel's location is handy for getting to the bars & restaurants on avenida 5ta and beyond. The lack of direct street access at the hotel means we could leave behind all the nightly party racket when returning, since the entrance faces the ocean. The place has a handy, bright beachront sign that's visible from the ferry pier all the way to the ugly pier at constituyentes so if a night of partying at the beach bars leaves you staggering near the shore, just look for the sign to find home away from home. We'll certainly look into this hotel again when vacationing in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: Chilimayes
Reviews.Content: We tried Playa Maya for our third excursion to PDC since our previous hotel is closed for renovations. We could not have been more pleased. My wife was a bit skeptical at first, but all fears were vanquished on our first day at the beach. After a great Mexican breakfast, we were waited on hand and foot on the beach by the wonderful staff. Another drink? No problem. Reposition your chairs or umbrella? No problem. Stay on the beach later than your waiter? No problem, I'll catch you tomorrow. Everything was great. Then, every day when we returned to our room we were greeted with some sort of art -- hearts, swans, flowers -- that the cleaning staff made out of the towels. Also, July 2 was national election day in Mexico, so there was a ban on alcohol sale throughout the country. No problem there, either -- our waiter provided us a cooler and iced down the beer we bought the day before and brought it to us on the beach. Great location in the heart of the main area, short walks to all restaurants and beach bars. We will definitely go to Playa Maya again. Thanks to all of the staff, especially Raciel and Alberto, for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect time at the Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: NeMcD
Reviews.Content: Just love the beach only access! I had a little sand on my feet for the entire trip and loved it!! This hotel is spic and span clean everywhere we went! Clean, clean and more clean! We stayed in room 303 - we loved it. The balcony was just right, the room was large and the bathroom just right. The air conditioning worked very well - we were even fortunate enough to turn off the AC and open the slider and let the wonderful breeze in. The entire staff is wonderful. They treated us so well, were friendly, chatty and really made our stay fantastic. The reception group were very helpful. We had a little glitch with making a tour reservation and Anna fixed us right up. The wait staff - so much fun! They are amazing at their jobs - they know just when to strike up a conversation, offer water or cocktails {and when to offer water again} and are so warm and affectionate. There is something incredibly relaxing to be in a place where the staff seems relaxed and is dressed a little casually. The wait staff "uniform" of hotel t-shirts and shorts and the remaining staff wearing regular clothes and the genuine smiles on their faces just made us so comfortable and relaxed. It really is a very quiet hotel - when we were on the balcony in the evening we could hear a little bit of music on the wind but that was mostly drowned out by the sound of the waves. While we were there, there were families {the one with the cute boys and the pool for one}, young couples, middle aged like my new husband :), large family groups and other honeymooners like us. This hotel and their staff were great toand for everyone. There was a great outdoor shower which I loved. I was so thrilled to use it and it was another great touch by the hotel. The hotel also had a borrowing library. Their library was diverse and had choices from Harlequin romance to Dean Koontz to Harry Potter. A clothes line is in the very large shower for bathing suits, etc. These are just some of the little touches provided by the hotel that just made the stay really seem like you are staying with friends! Thank you to the staff of the Playa Maya and we hope to be with you again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya was a nice find”
Reviews.Author: tecnoladave
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you want a small, personable hotel at a decent price. I think the best feature was the small resturant on the beach. I could lay on the beach all day without having to leave for any reason. Only one small complaint. The beach is great but near the waters edge there are some very large rocks that were unearthed after last years hurricanes. It was only a small issue though because they didnt continue out into the water so several feet out was awesome. They were a slipping hazard. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our choice & ready to return.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was key to the full enjoyment of our first (and hopefully not last) trip to Playa del Carmen. We stayed 5 nights. Immediate help was available with our luggage from Calle 8 from the employees (Juan & Pedro) and concierge Pablo explained all that was necessary (in English) about the key parts of our room and the hotel ammneties. Great location on the beach right in the middle of things in PDC. A tasty, hearty breakfast was included in the package we purchased with the convenience of service until 11am for my new bride and myself after late nights on the town. A polite nightwatchman was always there at the entrance to greet us when we came back. Fine lunch was also taken advantage of a few days right on the beach where we had decided to sun in the padded loungers reserved for hotel guests during high demand periods. The few days that we had rain in the evening, many new umbrellas were available to borrow from the front desk. Rooms were just as advertised with cool, quiet AC units with remote controls for easy use while hanging out there watching some TV with a few English-speaking cable channels. They were kept very clean with a daily resupply of sealed, bottled purified water. More was available for free from the bar upon request. We will bring our daughter with us next time and some other friends with kids. A few families were there and their kids obvioulsy liked the pool and hot tub. A few other couples without kids were there too and Playa Maya can cater to both crowds. I could write much more details, but I think I've made my point. Playa Maya was a great experience for this honeymooning couple !!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and Great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playa Maya for four solid nights. The rooms were super big and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was not exactly what we expected, but we do not have any real complaints. The rooms were very clean, with the exception of an ant problem in our bathroom. The service was great, especially breakfast on the beach! We enjoyed staying right in town and we were a stone's throw away from all the action. It was a bit on the pricey side for what you got. If you expect a pool (which we did not) there isn't really a pool. A walkway arcs over the pool and it is no more than twenty feet long. But that's not we went down there to do, teh beach was really nice and I imagine that more beach will be reclaimed in the months to come. All in all we were very satisfied with the accomodations

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in PDC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at the Playa Maya. The best feature of this hotel is its on the beach location, and the prices are reasonable for the location and amenities. A block up the hill and you are in the center of PDC. The staff are friendly and helpful (I left a pair of shoes behind in the room, and they kept them for a number of days until I could return and pick them up). The only negative for us was some difficulty in getting our luggage into the hotel, because the nearby street is sometimes closed to vehicles. We plan to return on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly luxury as web site indicates.”
Reviews.Author: biddersuite
Reviews.Content: Wish I had of done a little more research. It was a busy time of year, being spring break but I personally did not like the Playa Maya hotel all that much. Not because it was sold out crowded or anything like that. The pool is very small and in an odd location under a walking bridge that takes you into the hotel. Felt awkward sun bathing there as its small size pretty much made me feel like a storefront manequin on display. Too many google eyes. Other hotels I have visited there were many more using the pool and you never felt odd. But this pool is simply tiny in comparrison. The rooms vary a lot in location and view. I found the rooms fairly typical of this level of hotel. Clean. Nothing special, not bad. It is also difficult to get into the hotel itself as you have to walk across sand and it has a very unusual point of entry in comparrison to other hotels. Not a problem when you're just carrying a book and a towel but inconvinient unless you summon help. Just different. Would I stay here again? Probably not. It wasn't that bad, just not that good. The manager is an American which was neither here nor there. I never complained about anything and had minimal contact with him or any other rep of the hotel. Nothing I had issues with were of the type that could be remedied and I I wasn't there to visit with them. I'm just posting what I think about the place in general as far as overall convinience, the pool location and size and overall impressions. I would have rather stayed where the pool is more user friendly and the hotel design more conventional considering the infrequency I get to go to the area. If pools are not important as an option for you, you may be just fine with the place. I just like a good pool to escape to as an option to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya - the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The good news - excellent location both for beach and 5th, great local staff. The bad news - toilets constantly clogged, front desk often out of beach towels, 8am daily race for guests to secure best beach chairs, hotel access is via the outside bar next door, lots of ants in room, need a PhD to hook up wireless internet using a keyed CD, pool is a pee pool for kids (did I mention lots of kids there when we were there?)

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tradescantia
