Reviews.Content: We (16 yo son, husband, and I) were disappointed with our accomodations at Playa Maya. We selected this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and I have to wonder who posts them! The family suite (two adjoining rooms) was not available at time of booking last fall so, at the manager's recommendation, we booked a 'junior suite'. The 'sofa bed' was two child sized mattresses joined together in an alcove - it was no more than 5'6" long, too short for comfortable sleeping for anyone in the family. The windows opened directly onto the supporting beams of the hotel's elevated sundeck. Overall, it was uncomfortable and dark. If I had known about this, I would have booked elsewhere and gladly paid more $$ for better accomodations. We asked for another room but none were available. I mentioned my concerns to the desk clerks on days 1 and 2 because I wanted to be sure that the manager heard about it. On day 3, the desk clerk called us and said that the manager was aware of our concerns and wanted us to tell him what he could do to make it up to us. I did not ask for a refund but asked him to update the website to better describe this 'junior suite' so that future guests would know what to expect. Other comments - there are exposed boulders/rock shelves on the beach in front of Playa Maya, especially at low tide. This is the case, though, at beaches up and down the strip and it doesn't prevent a pleasant swim. The room was clean. There was a good selection at breakfast (included in room rate). Food at the hotel cafe was also good for lunch and snacks. We will not recommend this hotel to others. In selecting future hotels, we'll check to see if other sources agree with TripAdvisor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: WittyL8dy
Reviews.Content: Playa Maya offers basic accommodations on the beach. Location is great, very close to restaurants, ferry landing, and nightlife. Restaurant service left something to be desired with slow, mildly polite service each morning (To the point that I would have complained...had there been a manager present to listen). Beach chairs with cushions are a nice bonus. Room was clean and comfortable. We appreciated the in-room safe and the high-speed internet access available to guests. "Do not disturb" signs and dead-bolt locks for the guest rooms would be a nice addition. I also would have appreciated an extra little bottle of shampoo at some point during our 6-night stay. The hotel is located at the end of a rather quiet street, and I don't know that I would feel comfortable going "home" there late at night if I was traveling with my girlfriends. With my able-bodied husband, I never felt unsafe. Overall, this quiet location worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: CherryBeerGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya November 14-21st 2005. We came to the Playa after 14 nights in Florida on our honeymoon and after reading the reviews on tripadvisor, we had high expectations. The room was OK, not great, but clean and spacious. There was enough wardrobe space, a safe, a fridge with a couple of free drinks, and cable TV. Great location, really handy for the main strip but quiet too. The maid made the most fantastic sculptures with the towels, a new one every day – the first day we had a bride and groom swan kissing. The beach-only access is nice, but a bit awkward sometimes. The girls on reception were very helpful, they enjoyed chatting in English, and helped us speak to our Spanish-only insurance company telephone helplines when we were worried we may have to return home early. The beach was lovely, soft white sands, a bit rocky in places. The current felt quite strong at times so swimming was tricky, but fun! It seems trendy bars are popping up all along 5th Avenue. Try the Blue Parrot for some chilled drinking space, or Fly at Deseo for some Miami-style décor (and prices). Margarita’s are plentiful – try them in every bar to make sure you get the best! If you like your bars a bit more rough’n’ready check out Sharkey’s next to Babe’s, a great Thai restaurant. Buenos Aires is good for steaks. We really appreciated the hotel’s excellent communication – Playa del Carmen had been hit hard by Hurricane Wilma in the weeks preceding our stay and the Playa Maya did a great job of communicating news about the hotel and the area in general on their website – information we found it hard to locate even on official websites. They also did a good job of getting everything up and running again so quickly. The food at the Playa was OK – we only ate breakfast there once, it was a bit bland and lukewarm, but that may have been a knock on effect from the hurricane. Burgers and lunchtime food was better, and the bucket of beer and nachos for MX$110. Overall we had a great time at the Playa and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a Great Stay and Got It”
Reviews.Author: Stomin
Reviews.Content: I booked in the Fall '05 for our Feb 13-23 stay. Due to our 10 nite stay management informed us that we would have to stay 4 nites in a standard room and 6 nites in an ocean view terrace room. Our friends would stay 5 nites in a jacuzzi room and 5 nites in an ocean view balcony room. We agreed that this would be acceptable. The rooms and corresponding views were exactly as depicted on their website. So I knew exactly what I was getting and wasn't disappointed. Our flight from Minneapolis on Sun Country was perfect as were our transfers through Cancun Valet. We arrived around 11 a.m. to the Playa Maya and I immediately went to the front desk and told them of our arrival. An enthusiastic group of men from the hotel came over to Calle 8 and carried our bags to the hotel for us. The 25 steps from Calle 8 to the Playa Maya entrance were not an issue. Due to our early arrival, I didn't expect our room to be ready. It wasn't. However the people occupying our first floor standard room had checked out and Steve (and Delmy) allowed us to change in the room, leave our bags there and put our valuables in the safety deposit box which was greatly appreciated. The beach was perfect and wider than I had anticipated. Absolutely NO ROCKS and NO SEAWEED. Absolutely the best beach from the ferry pier to the Porto Real. Standard room was of adequate size with 2 double beds. Okay but not as comfortable as the king we had in our terrace room. Bathrooms in both were average size with a good sized shower. An improvement that could be made in the standard room would be to add a chest of drawers as there was not an abundance of storage in that room. Balcony in standard was extremely small but I knew that. Terrace was nice sized and gave an obstructed view of ocean of which I had been told of and was exactly as shown on hotel website. All in all I thought the rooms were pretty nice with good AC, nice TV, mini-fridge, deposit box. Very satisfactory and exceptionally cleaned everyday by our maid who we tipped $3 per day and usually made us towel art. Continental Breakfast everyday but usually upgraded to a breakfast of eggs, bacon, and potatoes in addition to the included Coffee, juice, and toast for 20 pesos more. Bucket of 5 Sol bottles on ice with a large nacho plate covered with beans and cheese for 110 pesos was a great deal. Large Pina Colada for 50 pesos was also great. Shrimp Tacos for 65 pesos were also excellent as were the Coconut Shrimp for 145 pesos (wish they had a coconut sauce on them though). Our usual waiter Jorge gave us great service and enjoyed joking with us. Feliciano was always ready and willing to set up the padded chairs and umbrellas for us each day. The Front Desk was where we would get our Beach towels which were very large, thick and of good quality. Internet was available next to the desk where I could check on the markets (I sold out at a profit Pablo!!). Front desk help of Anna, Myeti (sp), and Pablo were always friendly and fun to talk with. Especially enjoyed visiting with Pablo. We checked out early on the 23rd and there wasn't a lot of help around to carry our bags. Pablo eagerly and willingly grabbed two very large bags while Feliciano carried the other two large bags of our party. And then Pablo wouldn't even take an additional tip. That is the kind of help this hotel has. You actually feel like you are a welcome part of a family which I suppose is why they use the slogan "Your Beachfront HOME". We certainly enjoyed ourselves. The price paid for our rooms was in line for what we received. We got a nice room, great staff, in a great location, on a fantastic beach. An absolutely wonderful vacation. I expected a Great Stay and Got It. Thanks Playa Maya. I will definitely return someday, maybe not next year as my son is going to college. But I will return. The only downside to the Playa Maya is that you will need to make your reservations early. In many cases, people reserve for the next year as they finish their stay. It is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect vacation!”
Reviews.Author: YWGDon
Reviews.Content: We returned one week ago from our second two-week stay at Hotel Playa Maya. As is our usual routine, we chose the best room class and could not have been happier! We arrived at Hotel Playa Maya just before noon and certainly didn't expect our room to be ready before 3:00 p.m. so we oversaw the transport of our luggage from the beach end of Calle 8 around the corner into the hotel and hit the restaurant. Yes, Hotel Playa Maya is beach-access only, and we consider this a terrific feature. The staff are quick to respond when you arrive and our luggage has always appeared in the lobby while we made our arrival know to Reception. I can't describe how excited we were peeling off the sandals on Calle 8 for the walk to the entrance. You're on vacation! Take your shoes off, relax and enjoy that warm sand between your toes! Everything was ready for our arrival and the front desk staff went to great efforts to have our room prepared and get us into it as quickly as possible. Where else would the reception person walk down to the beach with your keys and find you under the Palapa sipping a cold beverage and tell you your bags were already in your room? And that was before 1:30 p.m. You begin to feel the 'personal service' at Hotel Playa Maya almost immediately! The room was spacious and sported a mini-fridge so powerful it could freeze my cans of beer overnight! Be careful with that! Housekeeping was prompt and efficient every day. This is the cleanest hotel you will ever stay in. There were no odors other than cleaning supplies in our room. The bathroom is basic, but top-quality by Caribbean standards. This is our 10th Caribbean vacation so we have sampled a few bathrooms in our time. The plumbing works and the shower is excellent! What more do you need? Learn how to manage your per-room hot water supply and you will love it. The pool is definitely 'wading' more than 'swimming', but that should be obvious to anyone who reviews the pictures on the web site. The pictures show the pool from several perspectives, including various other features which help to gauge size, so we weren't surprised at all. The sundeck above the pool proved to be a popular hangout for the 'morning coffee' crowd during our stay as the rising sun quickly warms the area. And it was also popular towards later afternoon as it became a shady spot to cool down. The beach was positively huge during our stay. Hurricane Wilma clearly moved a lot of sand around and a very generous amount of it is now in front of Hotel Playa Maya. This year we had space for 4 rows of chairs, where last year it was 2 or 3 rows most days. And not a single rock in sight. We sampled the restaurant on several occasions and found the food to be excellent! Try the Burgers, Shrimp Tacos, Coconut Shrimp and Chicken Brochette! Last, but not least, everything that makes Hotel Playa Maya great in terms of location, facilities and amenities, would be nothing without the staff! The staff seems to 'know you' from the moment you arrive and goes to any lengths to make your stay personal and special. They are the best!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, and heart”
Reviews.Author: deepbluesea
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Playa Maya, and just loved it. Everyone was kind, smiling, and helpful. The hotel is in a perfect spot--right on the beach in the middle of town, but quiet (not so easy to find in PDC!) I chose Playa Maya after reading the reviews on this forum and am so glad I did. I can't think that the most expensive AI could do any better-- a clean, simple room, comfortable bed, nice hot shower, a friendly face at the desk, someone to set out a beach chair for you and bring you margaritas all day if you like, and all of Playa del Carmen right up the street! My daughter (age 11) loved it too, even without the margaritas. Everything at Playa Maya is well thought out and planned for comfort. It was the best vacation we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playa-Maya May 2005. The location and the service were top notch! Great food, cute little pool to cool off in! The rooms are simple but the air-conditioning worked wonderful and the shower always has hot water! The beds were comfortable compared to other beds in Playa. The beach-only access it SUCH a positive, you feel super safe when entering at night! Perfect everything! Cant wait to go back this May!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, What a Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Playa Maya for 10 days and absolutely loved it. We own time shares and have been to Cancun and Playa a few times before this. I have to say I was looking for something a little more personal and found it there. The rooms are not elaborate, but functional and clean. The food in the onsite restaurant is very economical and good. The beds are far softer than any other hotel we have stayed at in Mexico. We had to leave and move into Cancun after our stay in P.D.C. for the last seven days. Cancun is still pretty torn up, although many are working to get it up and running again. I will definately return to Playa Maya ASAP. Thanks Steve and all of your hard working staff.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Wedding at the Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: imaginary
Reviews.Content: I've been putting off writing this review because I knew it would take many words to accurately portray the service I experienced at the Hotel Playa Maya. Here goes. My new wife and I celebrated our engagement in 2004 with a trip to Playa del Carmen. After some conversations with managers Steve and Delmy, we decided to return in 2005 and have our wedding there as well. With our limited budget and short guest list (my wife is Japanese and many of her friends and family could not jump the pond), we really could not afford a wedding planner or a whole lot of bells and whistles. Steve and Delmy offered to help us as much as they could (within reason, of course). Through the year Steve kept in contact with me and even put up with quite a few changes in schedule (two guests dropped out due to pregnancy. who said that planning a year and a half in advance was good?). He and his wife spoke to mariachis and fire dancers (who I've heard have since set fire to a nearby hotel and are now banned from performing on Mexican beaches. We were lucky on several levels!) to perform, both for very reasonable rates. When hurricane Wilma hit, I was able to monitor the hotel's cleanup on their website and Steve dropped me a line or two telling me the hotel would certainly be up and running by our wedding date, as well as reports as to how the rest of Playa del Carmen were faring. Unfortunately, despite the quick recovery the airlines were cancelling flights to Cancun left and right. I'll leave that nightmare out of this review, since it has little to do with Playa Maya's service and more to do with Continental (@&%!#&!) and other airlines, but I will mention that Steve put me in touch with a very nice travel agent here in the States who helped us considerably with bringing my wife's (non-English-speaking)mother, sisters, brother-in-law and aunt and uncle to Cancun. The weather was perfect. Playa del Carmen was great (aside from the pushy hawkers who always litter the streets). The great reception staff helped my family with their misc day trips and area questions. Delmy helped us order flowers and a cake from local merchants, who we never would have found on our own. Our wedding under the restaurant palapas was flawless. The mariachis lent a Mexican atmosphere without being too hokey. Steve plugged my iPod in and piped our wedding march and the soundtrack to our reception into a very good, and purportedly new, soundsystem nestled in the palapas rafters. A surprisingly FANTASTIC meal was served, the highlight being the much-raved-about-in-this-forum Coconut Shrimp. After the dinner came the fire dancers, who were at once surreal and entertaining. It was a 20 minute event and afterward each member of my family came to me and confided that this was different than any wedding they had ever experienced. I took it as the compliment it was clearly meant to be. The only negative thing anyone had to say about the hotel was that the pool was kind of dirty. I mentioned this to Steve after everyone had gone and he told me that he was aware of this. Their usual pool-cleaner had taken the holidays off and their handyman was taking care of it along with his other chores, and just hadn't kept on top of it well enough. I had used the pool many times during our previous trip and it had been very clean. I've read lots of negative reviews that centered around the size of the pool. It is a fine pool for puddling around in. If you want to practice your breaststroke, walk the 50 feet to the sea and swim in that, for crying out loud. So, as you can see, I have nothing but praise for the Hotel Playa. The staff was exceptional for such a small "boutique" hotel. The management is clearly attentive and love their hotel. The surroundings are fantastic. If you want a small, friendly, loving wedding, have it at the Playa Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - We'll Be Back - Comments on Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first stay at Playa Maya hotel. We have previously stayed in Playa del Carmen at a top-rated all-inclusive (we hated the stuffiness and unhealthy food), the El Faro next door (which is now closed to be redeveloped as condos). We looked at the rooms at Playa Maya last year and booked there this year. The rooms were half the price of El Faro, and much cleaner than El Faro, although a little smaller. We would have moved to Playa Maya hotel even if El Faro hadn't shut down. We were very happy with the hotel and staff. The rooms are a little sparse, but the price is incredible, the rooms and everywhere else in the hotel are spotlessly clean, and it is quiet even though it's in the middle of town. The fact that there is only one way in and out of the hotel is a positive --- security is really tight and you feel super-safe there. Nobody can "wander through" because there is no street access. You get the benefits of seclusion but you're just a block from everything happening on 5th. A couple of staff members aren't quite as friendly, initially, as they might be. But we found if we were nice to them they warmed up after a day or two, and most of the wait staff and front desk people were very nice and certainly accomodating. For some reason, the beds in every hotel we've ever stayed at in Mexico, including the big Cancun hotels, are hard as a rock --- I don't think you can even buy a bed as hard as they have there, in the United States. Thankfully, Playa Maya has really good "American style" matresses and for the first time, I didn't wake up with the terrible back ache every morning (and I'm not an old codger --- those beds at the other places were really terrible). Foam vs. feather pillows was also a huge plus, and the staff immediately brought us additional pillows when we requested them. A big plus to this hotel is it's beach. The beach north and south is cluttered with moored fishing boats, and the beach down by the Royale and Blue Parrott stinks of sewer gas all the time. The beach directly in front of the hotel is great! Another plus is the beach services. The guy who sets out all the chaise lounges AND CUSHIONS (the other hotels in the area don't have cushions on the chaises) is fabulous. You're sitting at the restaurant having breakfast and he sets up your chaises for the day, with or without an unbrella as you desire. He also serves food and drinks on the beach, as do the other waiters, which all but one of the nearby hotels do not have. The food is great (the ceviche is fantastic), and the food and drink prices are very reasonable --- our total bill for breakfast (only charges in excess of the gratis continental breakfast cost), lunch 7 days, and tons of drinks (we won't say how many but we were on the beach for 7 of the 8 days), was about $245, including tip. It doesn't get any better than that. My wife and I have read some of the negative reviews of Playa Maya hotel on this forum and I think they all stem from people having unrealistic expectations of what this place is. Playa del Carmen is strange (by traditional American standarads) in that it really doesn't have any American style big resort hotels. It either has big all-inclusives mostly in Playacar, or it has small boutique hotels (non-chains) that are of the European small-hotel ilk. As with small European hotels, you're not going to get room service and a few of the other amenities that might be standard at a big American-style resort at any of the boutique hotels in Playa del Carmen. Anyone who's stayed in small hotels in Europe knows that you're also going to get relatively sparse rooms. One-time visitors to Playa Maya hotel who are expecting the American-style resort are going to be disappointed because that's just not what it is and, most importantly, you're not going to get that anywhere in the area unless you want to go all-inclusive. I don't think that unrealistic expectations that no hotel in the area can satisfy, should be held against Playa Maya hotel. The owner is around and asks you how your visit is going. I've never seen that anywhere else in Playa. And by the way, the bar has the best margarita on the rocks I've ever had --- and we live in Texas so we know a good Margarita when we get one. We booked our rooms late so we had to change rooms for the last two nights of our 8 night stay. We did minor cleaning up but didn't really re-pack and the hotel staff moved everything for us while we were laying on the beach and then brought our new room key right out the beach to us. That's the kind of service I appreciate. We've already booked our rooms for next year, and will be repeat guests for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya; sweet spot”
Reviews.Author: joemac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 10 days at Playa Maya and didn't want to leave. We chose this hotel based solely on TA reviews and price. We were familiar with Playa having stayed twice at AI's in Playacar just outside of town. Staying AI had grown old and last year we ate a few meals and hung out in town and were really taken with the atmosphere of Fifth Ave. The rooms are great, very spacious and very clean with ocean side balconies for the most part. We also stayed four nights in a studio towards the front of the property only a few steps above beach level. I liked the studio a lot. There are two of them A and B and they're set up like studio apartments with everything needed to cook, make coffee, extra pull out sleeper, table with 4 chairs. My wife liked the first floor deluxe room the best which had a big terrace, full hammock and cafe table to sit and watch the ocean and other guest coming and going. The bathrooms are newish, tiled and clean. Plenty of hot water and water pressure went from adequate on the third floor to torrential in the studio. The matresses in all the rooms we stayed in were firm with some give and I was fine but my wife needed a little softer so I bought an egg crate foam at Wal-Mart. The beds are beds not slabs and the mattresses are of good quality which is a problem in even the 4 and 5 star places in Mexico. The beach is really sweet. Plenty of sand, easy to walk in and a few steps from the bar. Stiff winds for a couple of days took some of the sand out but brought it back. The palapa is the place for breakfast with toes in the sand, drinks, lunch and the food was so good we ate an early dinner there twice. The coconut shrimp, sopa azteca, ceviche and fagitas were excellent. Ramon the chef even prepared red snapper which I caught and presented it beautifully. The waiters are attentive and engaging and Mauricio, the bartender is so nice. He made my wife a really cute grasshopper fashioned from a palm leaf. Juan Enrique and Enrique oversee the bar and food bills and do a great job of keeping track of everything around the bar. The hardest working person there has got to be Feliciano. He is in charge of the beach chairs and starts setting them out at 7 am. Get your fresh plush towel at the front desk and Feliciano will take them and set you up with loungers, cushions, table and umbrella. Then he's bussing tables, lugging suitcases, carrying buckets of beer; constant motion. Pablo, Maite and Anna work at the front desk and do a great job. We just loved little Anna who has been at Playa Maya for almost a year and was very helpful. Steve and Delmy were a refreshing change from previous experiences with owner/managers. They are friendly and approachable and really made us feel welcomed and at home. They are really hands on and obviously take a lot of pride in the hotel. We are planning to return to Playa Maya next year and hope we can stay even longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here for the 3rd time!!”
Reviews.Author: sandyflops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya 10 days in middle of January '06. On arrival, we took a walk through the sand to the hotel entrance ( only way to reach it ) which got us in the mood right away for sitting seaside & having a couple of margaritas! The staff carried the luggage from Calle 8 past Alhambra Hotel after we announced our arrival by one of us walking up to the restaurant. Switched rooms in middle of our stay due to late booking and found both the rooms clean with an especially nice ocean view in the second room of our stay, 204. Left bathroom window or door open a bit sometimes for the ocean sound which was relaxing, especially at night where this time of year the temperatures were cool. Enjoyed the coffepot (and some yummy mexican granola-breakfast bars) near front desk @ 7am & sat on patio to enjoy the great sunrise view in Cozumel's silhouette. Hotel has a nice covered beachside palapa to sit under when I felt like having some fresh squeezed oj & chicken chilaquiles or huevos rancheros for breakfast. The buffet was removed and items are now ordered off a menu, with hotel guests getting free coffee, oj & toast. We missed the buffet in that it was easy to grab mexican pastries, rolls, & fruit and eat in a short time with our coffee. Moving out to the beach, we got first dibs on the loungers with the newer cushions, quickly hauled into place by the 'chairman of the chairs' . The beach was maybe 8M from palapa to water's edge the first day we were there, but it changed a bit thru our stay, coming and going a little every day. The rockiness on the beach we encountered last year was all covered up. There were a couple of sandbars off the beach in front of the hotel one could stand on & dive shoreward to catch a wave or two. We relaxed much of the day & enjoyed some drinks & light eats. The waiters were always very nice and even brought us a bucket of ice for some champagne we bought (at the new Wal Mart) for birthday celebration on the beach :) We sampled the restaurant's fare, like margaritas, mango ritas, & the blue 'playamaya' drink. Had a good fill of the scrumptious coconut shrimp, ceviche & guacamole. For more solid fare we had the very delicious kabobs, especially the mixed variety. These would tide us over to later, where Ave. Quinta is a 4 minute stroll away for evening activities. Found the staff friendly and courteous and willing to help us with special needs & took some photos of us as well. Rooms we kept clean by the staff every day around 11am-1pm. There's a small safe inside for valuables. Not a lot of closet space but there was enough room around for our bags & other things. Tv with cable worked some of the time, but only had it on a few minutes as we were here to relax & get away from it all & didn't even care if there was one in the room. Who needs TV when you can watch the shorebirds and pelicans fly by and just enjoy the beautiful sound of the sea right from the patio! There's a pc available near the check-in desk during business hours in the event one needs to keep up with the internet or what's going on around Playa del Carmen. There's no longer an oceanview gym, but there's a couple of gyms available in town for a fee if one feels a need to workout. It looks like the former gym is becoming an oceanview office for the owners with a guest area for pc / internet use. This was our third stay at Playa Maya and we will be back again - what a great place to stay! Like the sign says - "Playa Maya - Your Beachfront Home!" Thanks Steve, Delmy & all the staff for making us feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful location--go for the small hotels!”
Reviews.Author: VoyagingAlways
Reviews.Content: We despise big hotels, especially all inclusives. We adore the attractiveness of being in town so that we can enjoy the numerous restaurants, shopping and access to dive tour operators. We stayed at Playa Maya for 10 nights starting New Years Day, 1/1/06-1/11/06. We loved the location and our room was wonderful (101--room with Terrace), small fridge, lots of hot water. The staff (Wendy, Anna) were wonderful to us--they told us that their jobs were to make sure everything was perfect and it was. Thanks to them and Felicano who made sure I had our "spot" on the beach with a "parasol." Thanks to Jorge who took care of all needs (and more) to quench our thirst and fill our stomachs. The food, especially for lunch, was excellent (chicken tacos, ceviche, hamburgers, guacamole). The included breakfast was "OK," but the staff accommodated special requirements upon request. Alberto helped move us from another hotel several blocks away because Playa Maya was full for New Years Eve. We very much appreciated Steve's postings of Playa's status after Hurricane Wilma. Of course, we had "booked" just a few days before & worried that all would be lost. We have stayed in Playa at least 9 times and this was the best: location, location, location and service as you need it. Go there! But make sure it's not when we want to go back! Bill & Sue, Denver, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DaddioBoston
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed at Playa Maya in late January to attend a wedding elsewhere in PDC. We had the upper-level "family suite" of adjoining rooms (305 - 306; If you look at pictures of the hotel, you see an upper-level balcony dead-center. That is the divided balcony shared by the family suite.) I'll do the pro - con thing too: PRO 1. The rooms seemed spacious - there was plenty of walking-around room. Good-sized bathrooms and showers. 2. Housekeeping staff did a great job keeping the rooms clean, and the towel sculptures they made were kinda cool. 3. Having a fridge in each room was great, and the stocking of bottled water was appreciated. 4. Beautiful, though somewhat narrow, view of the ocean. 5. We had the option to open the slider to the balcony at night and listen to the surf, while the kids next door could crank the (very efficient) AC to where they wanted it. An earlier reviewer remarked on a snapping noise from the fridge and rooftop tank noises; they barely registered with us. Noise was not a problem - with one exception I'll note below. 6. Location right on the beach, and only a block away from 5th Ave is great. CON 1. TV reception was sometimes clear, sometimes weak. I didn't care much, but kids notice that kind of thing. 2. Noise: On one night (Saturday), a disco several blocks down the beach, decided to move the party - and their very effective loudspeakers - outside. From 11PM to 7AM, the pounding of the surf was replaced by the pounding of a bass, even through closed windows. Apparently enough of the neighboring hotels complained, because it did not happen again for the rest of our stay. The hotel staff expressed their apologies, but it wasn't the hotel's fault. Overall, our "Saturday Night Fever" experience was the only thing that kept us from rating the PM as Excellent. We had a great stay, and would certainly keep Playa Maya high on our list if we should return to PDC.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya a good compromise”
Reviews.Author: Torero
Reviews.Content: This review is to add to an excellent previous review titled “Just Right for the Money” which I believe to be accurate. I will only make comments to complete according to my experience. PROS : 1.Beach – You are getting access to the beach at the same price as some similar priced hotels that do not have a beach. In such hotels you will have to walk the beach and find a spot that is not related to a beach side hotel where guards will ask you to leave or put your towels between their restricted area and the water. This is a definite plus with Playa Maya where you have a beach chair guaranteed. This is valuable. 2.Rooms we had ( 305 and 306) can be considered spacious not just regarding the price but comparing with other Hotels. 3.Although the Hotel is close to 5th avenue we were not disturbed by the noise from the street. 4.The review I mentioned above warned about hot water shortage. I did not experience such a problem in our rooms. We were three to take showers in one room and two in the other and we did fine. I don’t know if there are different conditions depending on the room. 5.Rooms had a fridge. One bottle of water in each and some candies. They are large enough to allow you to bring drinks and food back to the hotel. CONS : 1.Entrance to Playa Maya is only by the Beach. No street entrance. I had not realized this when I made my reservation. This was a problem for us because we had a car rental. If you are arriving with your car and/or with a lot of luggage this will be a concern. I had called for directions a couple days in advance and did not get helpful info from the Hotel staff at that time. I had to “wing it” upon arrival and ended up paying 50 pesos to the officer guarding the street to be able to leave my car on 8th Street instead of having to exit the street and find a parking place else where. You need to know that this street is closed to traffic and supervised by a cop. They don't allow you to park on this street. Once you are able to enter the street, you will have to be able to get to the end of the street at beach side. This can be difficult at this time because there is a construction site on the left side going toward the beach. Then you might or might not get help from the Hotel Staff to carry your luggage. We only got help once we reached the hotel on the beach. ( I had called from my cell phone to say we had arrived and to ask how to get to the Hotel and was not offered help ) 2.Noise – In our rooms we had two noise problems. One was from the fridge that made a loud snapping noise on start up and when it turned off. Another came from what I think to be the water tank refill system on the roof that was extremely loud when in function. This is lasted for less than a minute every hour or so. Finally, it should be mentioned that the sound proofing from room to room and from room to hallway is not good. 3.Last comment will be about the Staff attitude at Playa Maya. I have always been impressed by Mexican’s kindness and willingness to please at hotels and restaurants. In the case of PM my impression was below expectations in this regard. Conclusion : Considering location, access to the beach and price, PM should be among your choices for a stay in Playa del Carmen. If some of the cons concern you and you don’t want to deal with them then you are going to have to put up more money to get what you want. Some reviews have said PM is a dump. This is not the case at all. It is just not a four or five Star Hotel. The pictures on their website are accurate and give the best image possible of the Hotel. It won’t be better than that when you get there. Reality was slightly below my expectations. Overall if PM is in the budget range you are looking for and you want direct access to the beach as well as proximity to all PDC activities this is one of the places to be.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya "Just Right" for the Money”
Reviews.Author: OKC Traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some glowing reviews that helped us determine that we should stay there. My review is "realistic" and I hope that it encourgages you to make the right choice for your situation. For the money, this hotel is "just right". It is not a five star hotel, nor does it really claim to be. You will get exactly what you pay for, and for that reason, we were very content with our selection. PM is a prime "3 star" hotel with it's pros and cons. PROS 1) Location - Right on the beach, one block away from 5th Ave. The beach access is literally just about 50 feet from the street. 2) Price 3) Restaurant - We ate in town every evening and had lunch at the hotel restaurant every day. No comparison, PM has the best food compared to any of our evening choices. Everything we ordered off the menu was excellent. 4) Rooms - Well furnished, spacious (for the price), clean, well maintained. 5) Staff - Most spoke English well enough to understand. Most performed their jobs in a perfunctory manner. A few went the extra mile, specifically Wendy and Jorge. 6) Beach - Good beach for the area. CONS 1) Hot Water - Be advised there is a five gallon hot water tank in your room, so be prepared for a five minute shower! 2) Breakfast Buffet - This could be expanded. The food was good, but each day, there was one main choice (eggs, fruit, or pancakes) and breads. 3)No security bolts or "Do not Disturb" signs for the room doors. 4) Beach Chair Guy - Not sure what the hype is all about. We had to go ask for an umbrella each day, although we did witness him asking others on occassion if they needed an umbrella. Good hotel, go there and expect to get what your paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: bootsy1957
Reviews.Content: The room was beyond expectaions. We have stayed at other spots in Playa and found this to be both quiet at night ( if you wish it to be ) and very entertaining during the day on the beach. I could quietly read my book or drink fabulous margaritas and have a great time with fellow travellers there. The staff was very helpful on tours and information. The air conditioning was great. The fellow on the beach was very accomodating. Rooms were very clean. The 'continental breakfast' was beyond belief. ps this saves you many pesos, as breakfast can be very expensive on 5th Ave. All in all, we will be back in Feb/06. Can hardly wait to relax and catch some rays on the most fantastic beach in Playa. Good job Steven and staff!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: albanysheep
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 5 month infant and myself just returned from a 4 night stay at the Playa Maya hotel in Playa del Carmen and I just wanted to let others know about the wonderful experience we had there! It was our first time in Mexico, and we were a bit nervous bringing our baby but we should not have worried. The room we had (Studio B) was perfect for families as it had a kichenette and was right by the pool area. Even though all the hotel guests had to walk by our door to get to the hotel's main desk and entrance we had the AC on and did not hear a thing - ever! The room is right by a shallow (4 feet or so) pool, a jacuzzi type pool and a sundeck with chaises and a table that was shady during the afternoon - perfect for babies! I should add that we had it pretty much to ourselves as most people hung out on the beautiful beach. The restaurant/bar is VERY tasty, convenient and fairly priced. We ate breakfast and lunch there every day and enjoyed everything. The shrimp tacos and the ceviche were particularly delicious. The staff could not have been nicer. From the time we arrived (on a van they arranged) to check out, they were fabulous. They provided a pack-and-play for the baby to sleep in and were just so warm and helpful. One thing that is important to know is that the only entrance to the hotel is from the beach, that is, over the sand. Just a tip: bring flip-flops to change into before getting out of your car/car service/taxi. Don't try to walk on sand in high-heels like I did upon arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: mgirls03
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my third stay at Playa Maya. The hotel is in great condition and only seems to get better. Everything interior and exterior had been freshly painted. Our room was spotless from top to bottom and the beds were as welcoming and comfortable as always. Everyone on the Playa Maya staff was smiling and willing to help with any request or need that we had. The ever changing beach conditions were perfect for our stay with a wide sandy beach begging guests to lounge on it from morning till night. The food at the restaurant is great. The free continental breakfast had different choices each day we were there and for a very small fee you could add eggs, bacon, pancakes or other choices to the continental breakfast. It was great to see so many staff members still working at Playa Maya that we had met on our previous trips. We know our vacation begins the minute we step foot on the beach and walk those few steps to the entrance to Playa Maya. I have never been disappointed with any aspect of our stays at Playa Maya and can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “We love Playa Maya!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were also staying at the Playa Maya before and after Wilma. This was our first trip to Mexico and wow what an experience! A lot of people that experienced hurricane Wilma would say their vacation was terrible. For us it was an experience that could have been terrible if it weren't for Steve, Delmy, and all of the Playa Maya Staff. They took such good care of us. And after the hurricane we couldn't wait to get back to the Playa Maya. The last half of our vacation was nicley spent at Playa Maya. For any of you that have read any negative coments about Playa Maya please consider the many excellent reviews! If you choose to stay at Playa Maya you will not be disappointed! They are the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Some thoughts on PDC and the Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: ronarita
Reviews.Content: Surfing the net to find out information on the problems created in PDC by "Wilma", I came across the TripAdvisor site. Didn't know it existed before. Wow, reading some of the postings I began to wonder if the Playa Maya I stayed at was the same one that received some of the negative articles I read. I have been a visitor to PDC in January for several years. First staying at the Continental Plaza for a couple of years and then opting for a more "local" feel moving on to the Pelicano Inn for seven years. Apparent managment problems there prompted a change so I moved next door to the newly built Playa Maya along with some other longtime Pelicano Inn guests, and I have stayed there for the past three years as I will again this January for my annual getaway from the "gloom and doom" of the winter weather in the Great Northwest (Oregon). Now my rantings. First off is the complaints about the sometimes rocky beach in front of the hotel. Come on people, nature determines how much sand is on the beach, not the hotel management or staff. Next is the pool. If you go to Mexico to use the pool, you might as well stay home and spend the weekend at a Ramada Inn. There's a big, beautiful ocean out there. Oh my, the bed isn't to my liking. Of course not. It's not the bed you have at home which you are used to. The restaurant isn't to my liking. Be adventurous! Take the short walk up to 5th and check out some of the many marvelous restaurants there. Better yet, venture a a block or two off of 5th and you will find even more excellent places to eat. The staff was rude and inattentive. Maybe you were too demanding as to what you perceived was their shortcoming. After all its a vacation. Relax! Enjoy yourself. As for me, I'll be there in January having the time of my life. Staying in a comfortable, clean room. Lying on a beach chair in the sun visiting with old friends and meeting new ones. To those of you who wrote and posted reports concerning all that is good with the Playa Maya, I'm with you. It's a great place and I will continue to return even if the naysayers don't seem to "get it". Steve, keep up the good work!! It suits me just fine.

Reviews.Title: “We love Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: him_and_eye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and four others stayed at Playa Maya a few days prior to hurricane Wilma and then for a few days after. We feel we are very lucky to have been at Playa Maya for this experience! Steve and Delmy treated us as friends and guests of the hotel. We never felt uncomfortable asking for or about anything. The staff there is full of character and always happy to do anything for you. Food and drinks were fabulous too! The rooms are very spacious, very clean, and very comfortable The greatest part was how well they took care of us for the hurricane, they got us rooms at another hotel off the beach, gave each of us a bag with some food, water, candles, and a lighter. And even still more...on the second day of the hurricane Steve came to check on us to make sure we were ok and doing alright. That same day later on Steve's wife Delmy and her family came and brought us food that they had cooked at their home for us along with more water, candles, and more. The point is that they cared! No one else's original hotels came to check on them. Without Playa Maya our hurricane experience would have been many times worse. We can't thank Steve and Delmy enough. We plan on going back as soon as possible and with our children!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: turriri
Reviews.Content: The Playa Maya was one of the nicest places we have had the pleasure to stay at during our vacation. You couldn't ask for a better location, right on the beach but only a block away from all the action on 5th Ave. The staff was pleasant and hardworking. Raciel, from the restaurant, always made sure we had a cervaza or two while we were enjoying the beach. Our room was wonderful even though the balcony could be a little larger. We still enjoyed sitting out there staring at the ocean and listening to the waves. Does this hotel have all the bells and whistles of some of the monster resorts in Cancun, probably not, but that's why we love Playa Del Carmen and the Playa Maya, because it's not Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: RDFtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with Playa Maya prior to Wilma and after. I found the rooms very clean and just what there web site advertised. I am a well traveled individual and typically stay in family owned smaller hotels on or near the beach. I have not run across a more helpful and courtious staff than the one at Playa Maya. Prior to the hurricane the beach was very nice. After the hurricane it was erroded but building back nicely in just days. If you are not familur with the beach in Playa it actually travels to the north and south. There always seems to be enough beach in this area for the hotel guests to spread out. I will be staying here again and I will be recommending it to my friends and co-workers. If you are looking for a nice beachfront hotel this is the place. This is the type of hotel that will make a good vacation great. I read the recent reviews and I will assure you that this place is not a dump and the staff is wonderful. I am posting my e-mail so if anyone has any question of the quality of this hotel they can e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Xcalacoco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for five nights in mid-September and were vey pleased. Reasonable rates, on the beach, one block from 5th Av., good food, and uncrowded. Check their website. Because of family, we could have again stayed at an ultra resort nearby for less money. We wanted a low key, central location and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a high standard and cozy beach hotel. My experience with this hotel and the people that run it has been superb on all occasions. The rooms are wonderful (check out the Jacuzzi room), and the food is great (try that coconut shrimp), and it is so nice to be right on the beach. My vacation has really started when enjoy my walk along the sand past the beach bars to the main entrance. No need to drag any luggage across the sand either, as the helpful and cheerful staff are ready to take care of that for you. I’ve stayed at this hotel three times now and have just booked again for my fourth stay. This is my favorite beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still dreaming of the Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: Peachtree
Reviews.Content: After choosing the Playa Maya with the help of Tripadvisor we were extremely happy with our choice. Our positive experience began as soon as we arrived as we were allowed to check in almost 2 hours earlier than normal. The staff at the reception desk was always very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. They helped us arrange a rental car with a local company for an excellent rate. Our room was spotless when we arrived. When I say spotless I mean spotless. This was possibly the cleanest hotel room I have ever had the privilege of staying in! The beach out front of the hotel was beautiful. There was never an issue about availability of beach chairs as there are only 20 rooms at this hotel. We were greeted every morning by Playa Maya's top-notch waiter, Joaquin. He was never more than a few steps away and always eager to be of service. We had lunch on the beach every day as the food(ie. nachos with pico de gallo, coconut shrimp, tacos) was fresh, tasty and arrived quickly. We came to love the beach-only access. We found that there is nothing better than spending a wonderful night on 5th Avenue; heading to the Blue Parrot for drinks on the beach and then making the 200 yard walk back along the beach to the Playa Maya. We loved every minute of our stay and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before (and after) hurricane Wilma. And we had a fantastic time. The hotel might not be high luxury, but it is really clean, pleasant, airy, friendly, good value, and in a great location. The staff were friendly and approachable, and as it is run by a family, you feel included and welcome. We loved the fact it was right on the beach, and still is after the hurricane! A few rocks were exposed but quickly covered again by the sea, and within a couple of days it was great for swimming again. The hotel was pretty much unscathed. And finally (and hoping no-one else has to go through a hurricane like Wilma) we have to say that the support, help and care we received from Playa Maya before, during and after the hurricane was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To each his own. But in my opinion you can do much better in Playa. We stayed for five days recently and could not wait to check out! The staff was very rude and unproffesional. The breakfast was not as advertised. The pool useless. And the worst thing is the beach. WHAT BEACH? You are crowded like sardines in a can. The beach is one of the thinnest on the whole stretch. The beach guy was the only one that we encountered who smiled and did a proper job. We encountered a couple of problems and the manager ( Steve) could have cared less. He was of no help. Try Hotel El Farao or the Blue BEach or even the Blue Parrot. You will be happy that you did.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a sub-standard hotel in every aspect. These positive reviews I read must have come from some folks with pretty low standards. My experience with this hotel and the people that run it has been disappointing. The rooms are low end, the hallways are dark, the food is barely edible, and there is no entrance. You must trudge through the sand and another (nicer) hotel's dinning room to get there. They do seem to be pretty saavy internet jockeys by keeping there PR more positive than it should be. I wouldn't be surprised if they plant their own positive reviews for every honest negative one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Playa in June for the last 5 days of our honeymoon. We were looking for somewhere that we could have some r & r after spending a week driving around the Yucatan. We booked it after reading the excellent reviews by other guests on Trip Advisor and we can both definitely say that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We found all the members of staff to be polite and courteous. We dealt with a new member of staff who was working on reception and he was able to help us, with a little help from the manager, but everyone has to start somewhere and we've all been 'in training' when we start a new job!. We had no problem with that whatsoever. Our king size balcony room was perfect and we particularly liked the welcome beers and sweets in the fridge, and the towel sculptures were entertaining too!. The room was always clean and tidy when we came back from beach. Breakfast was good, with a different choice every day and always plenty to eat. Lunches were delicious too especially the shredded coconut prawns. It was lovely to be able to sit and eat your meals under the palapas with the sand between your toes. All in all we had a a very relaxing and enjoyable stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...”
Reviews.Author: GeneralZod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I discovered PdC in February 2003, and have been back every year since. It has it all; beautiful beaches, nightlife, great food, great atmosphere, lots of activities, and all for very reasonable prices. The first two times we stayed there, we stayed at the El Tukan Condotel on 5th. The hotel is nice enough, the staff is friendly and with the exception of a family with noisy kids in the room next door (2004), we never had any real problems. That said, we knew that for our third trip, we wanted to stay at the Playa Maya, based on all of the positive feedback that I had read on the Playa Info forums. To say the least, I was not disappointed. The hotel is flawlessly maintained, the location is superb (right on the beach) and the rooms are well sized, clean and comfortable. We stayed for a total of 12 days, and didn't have a single problem. The entire staff is very friendly and the process of booking the hotel was a pleasure (unlike the El Tukan). Suffice it to say, we will be staying at the Playa Maya on all of our future vacations in Playa. If you read any negative reviews on this site, about this hotel, disregard them. It's a shame, no matter how nice the destination, some people aren't happy unless they're complaining.

Reviews.Title: “did not fall in love with playa maya”
Reviews.Author: mmonkey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Playa Maya for part of our honneymoon in June. We had several problems upon trying to check in, the person at the desk seemed un trained in how to handel the check in process and had to check on everything with the manager by phone, although this manager was aparently in the building. The manger finaly came out of hiding not to appologize to us or help things run smoothly but to verify my signature on my credit card, and then quickly left again. We were not greeted or even smiled at by anyone that worked at the desk for our entire stay. The man that sets up the chairs could teach the rest of the staff a thing or two about customer service, he was very pleasant and helpful. The room was basic and clean but nothing special. It was air condtioned and a safe was available in the room. The beach at Playa Maya is not the best along the strip, if you are intersted in nice beach there are a few beatiful spots a short walk away. Playa Maya's is pretty small and very close to the resaurant which is usually playing music, good for sipping margaritas but not for a nap. Overall my stay could have been greatly improved if the staff was more welcoming, but the manger here will never admit that anything could be done to better help the customers. Upon complaints about blatant mistakes in the handeling of our reservation I recieved a page long email nit picking my every word. A simple apologie and a smile would have sufficed. I am sure the mager will respond to this post and try to explain how the staff was actauly correct somhow, but this forum is for unbaised customer reviews so I though you all shoud know how playa maya treated me. I will definatly return to playa del carmen it is a wonderful place ~ check out hotel Lunata not on the beach but beatiful rooms with a genuine staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not great..........”
Reviews.Author: jrenep
Reviews.Content: The beach location of the hotel was nice. Not as crowded as other spots on the beach strip, which was nice, there were no fishing boats obstructing the view. The room was basic and clean. My biggest complaint would have to be with service, maybe I was just spoiled by the service in all the other places we stayed on this trip in Cancun, and Tulum. At Playa Maya, the only helpful staff member that I found was the guy that set up your beach chairs and umbrella on the beach. We arrived early for check in, early because I was very ill and decided to head over to Playa Maya earlier than planned from Tulum, to get out of the heat and take a nap. The receptionist was rude and explained to me that we could not check in untill 3 or 2 at the earliest. Not because the room wasn't ready or available, but because that is what time check in is. After reading all the reviews, I really thought Playa Maya would have been more accomadating. Overall, everyone that sat at the front reception desk was not very friendly. They just kind of glanced at you as you passed by. Everywhere else we stayed on this trip the staff would greet you: Good Morning, Good Evening, How are you doing? etc. We ate at the restaurant three times. The food was okay. Nothing to get excited about. My french fries were cold, but I dealt with it. My biggest complaint is that each time we ate there, I had to ask for salsa. And they would bring it ten minutes later. The delay amazed me. The restaurant was not busy at all, there were at least four waiters on duty. And still a whopping 10 minutes to get some salsa. Green habanero salsa from a bottle, by the way, not freshly prepared. The continental breakfast was toast and scrambled eggs. No pastries, bagels or fruit, as previously advertised. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Done Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose the playa maya for my honeymoon because of the reviews posted on this website, so I figured I should add my thoughts as well. Everything is done right at the Playa Maya! Our room was pristine upon arrival and was maintained in similar fashion everyday by the maid. Every morining, we at the breakfast provided by the hotel, which was much more than we expected when we were told it was free, they served eggs, chocolate crosaints, toast, coffee, and juice. After that, they had a guy whose sole job was to set up your beach chairs and umbrella were you wanted it! He would lay out your towel and watch over your belongings while you were in the water. So we would sit in our beach chairs and read and go in the ocean periodically all day. While in these beach chairs, you could order drinks and lunch from the waiter. If you weren't downing the beers in your bucket of beers (50 pesos) fast enough, they would refill the ice to keep them cold. All members of the staff were friendly and accomodating. I work in a similar industry and I beleive it would be relatively easy for me to spot problems quickly and I found none.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachfront Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from 8 days at the Playa Maya Hotel in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. The Playa Maya advertises itself as "your beachfront home" and I definitely felt at home during my stay. The beach and swimming at the Playa Maya are wonderful. Lounge chairs are set up with padding and umbrellas and food and drink service from the restaurant/bar, whether inside, under the palapa, or on the beach itself is impeccable. Raphael and all the staff deserve praise. We also enjoyed the music on the beach very much, as well as the availability of a first-rate massage. Fresh beach towels are provided daily. Maighty, Anna, and the rest of the front desk staff are friendly, efficient, and fun to talk with. The rooms are cleaned immaculately every day. The location is perfect for 5th Ave. shopping and dining, as well as exploring off 5th. Day trips to Cozumel and Tulum were easy to do and enjoyable. My favorite part of the trip was being comfortable on the gorgeous beach, eating, drinking, reading, swimming, and relaxing. I've already told several people about Playa Maya since my return two days ago, and my parents are planning a trip there before long.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Maya is the Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Summer05
Reviews.Content: Since Emily caused us to cut our July trip a few days short, my husband and I decided to go back for a 4 day trip to Playa del Carmen last week. Having been a little extravagant at the Riu Palce and Fiesta Americana Grand Coral Beach last month, we decided to scale down money-wise this time. I have to admit, I'd heard so many good things about Playa Maya, I didn't think it could possibly live up to it all. I was certainly wrong! Playa Maya was everything and MORE than I expected! We loved our Deluxe Terrace room with a hammock, pub table and chairs, and also 2 Adirondack chairs and small table. The view was supposedly "obstructed," but only by the roof of the restaurant, which I felt only added to the beauty of the view. I have some evening photos of the full moon shining down on the ocean and the hotel that are beautiful. Our room was quite large with plenty of drawers and storage for my husband's diving equipment and my excessive suitcases! Everything had a very clean, new feeling to it and the room was very comfortable with a nice coziness. We especially liked the nice walk in shower. The restaurant was excellent-be sure to try the Shrimp Tacos and Guac! I was in Heaven when we ordered Pina Coladas and they made them the "original" way with fresh pineapple juice and creme of coconut instead of the premix that most hotels-even the Riu Palace-use now. The Banana Coladas were even better and made with fresh bananas! The pool is small and the sundeck only had 4 chairs on it, BUT I never saw anyone use it, so you really have it all to yourself! There is a nice, wide beach, the palapa with tables for meals or drinks, and a beachside masseuse. We found the entrance on the beach to be a definite plus. Our driver went to the front desk upon arrival and immediately came back with 3 Playa Maya employees to carry our luggage to the reception area. Check-in was very smooth. Ana was very helpful to us throughout our stay-very sweet young lady! There is always a night security guard at the entry. Since you enter from the sand, and the entry, right beside the restaurant, is small, it's impossible for anyone to get by him, the bartender, and the front desk to get to the rooms. We felt very secure in our room. The location--on the beach, a block from 5th Ave. and close to several excellent restaurants-can't be beat. We were very impressed and will surely return to Playa Maya. My only disappointment was that we didn't get to meet Steve! Understandable, though, because he is so busy promptly returning all of e-mails the hotel receives. Hope to see him next time. It is obvious that his staff has been well trained and, as a team, does an excellent job of making the hotel run smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Playa Maya! We arrived two days after Hurricane Emily, which scored a direct hit on the Riviera Maya. We found that the staff had recovered quickly and just about everything was ship-shape. The hotel's terrific web site kept us well informed. In another day or two the pool and cable were back in operation too. We are a family of five, and were happy and comfortable in a suite made up of two connecting rooms each with a balcony overlooking the ocean. Playa del Carmen is not the best place to find a room that holds all five of us, and we had no interest in an all-inclusive resort. The rooms have a "new" feel with huge tiled showers and plenty of space. The hotel is very clean, just as the tripadvisor reviews said! The cafe on the beach was very pleasant, we ate most of our meals on the beach. The pool is compact but refreshing and big enough for a dip and games with the kids. Most of all, the staff is terrific and took great care of us. Ana and Mayte at the front desk are great, and even taught us how to call our beach-tunnelling eight-year-old a "sandcrab" in Spanish. Our only bit of constructive criticism is that the staff wasn't able to arrange trips for us to Mayan ruins at Tulum and Chichen Itza, or with a day trip to Xel-Ha. We had to do that ourselves, checking with neighboring hotels and tour offices on the Avenida, and we managed just fine once we learned to avoid the Mayan Palace time-share salesmen. We would gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful way to spend a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: NAPMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year-old son and I spent a week at Playa Maya in April 2005. We really enjoyed the hotel, beach and Playa del Carmen over all. The staff at Playa Maya were all friendly and helpful (muchas gracias to Racielle, Ernesto and Joaquin for the great beachside service). Melissa was a gem. The staff is so good at keeping an eye on everything that at one point when we left our bag to go for a walk along the beach, Delmy noticed that it wasn't quite secure and some money was sticking out. She picked up our bag and stored it for us until we returned! My only regret is that I didn't quite pick up the whole money exchange and probably undertipped a time or two. The hotel is very family friendly - our room had a little bed for my son, and a private jacuzzi area outside the room. The beds were very comfortable and the a/c worked wonderfully. Everything was kept very immaculate and the food was wonderful. We ate quite a few meals here and was never disappointed. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It”
Reviews.Author: psa24
Reviews.Content: The vacation my wife and I had at Playa Maya hotel was a wonderful experience. We had a great time. This was our 5th visit to Playa del Carmen and this was the best experience we had with all of the hotels. The staff was top notch. Mayte and Joaquin are just a couple of the staff who were a pleasure to deal with. ALL of the staff was great and very friendly, from the hotel desk to the security guards. The hotel is immaculate. Our cleaning lady was the best and had a very pleasant disposition. It was a pleasure coming back from the beach early afternoon to a cleaned room. This luxury was almost non-existent in past experiences with other hotels. I have to credit the management of this facility to put together such a great staff and pleasant environment. I can't begin to explain the great condition of the room. From the AC that actually worked well to the water pressure in the shower, everything was perfect. Even the bed was very confortable which I find rare in Mexico. The hotel is right on the beach. Breakfast, lunch or drinks under the palapa on the beach was sooo relaxing, not to mention the hammock swings. The only negatives are out of the control of the hotel. The beach directly in front of the hotel was worn and rocky. From what I understand this changes constantly and could be rocky one day and sandy the next. Still this was no problem at all though. A 50-100 yard stroll to the north has one of the best beaches in the area. Also with the hotel having "beach only access" there was the minor issue of sand in your shoes or sandals when heading into town. Really, that was no big deal. If you want value this hotel can not be beat. We paid $130 USD per night with a deluxe ocean view room. This is from a hotel ON THE BEACH! Do yourself a favor if you are debating between this place and other similar hotels in the area and chose Playa Maya. You won't be disappointed. We will DEFINATELY return here.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: sunset94971
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Playa Maya and had a great time. Our main goal was to relax and enjoy the beach, which we had no trouble doing! Our deluxe balcony room offered an excellent view of the ocean. The staff at the hotel were great. Raciel always worked hard to serve up great food and drinks. He remembered our special requests daily, and it was much appreciated. Alberto always smiled as he set our chairs up in our favorite spot. He also had an umbrella handy after too much sun. Juan (our buddy) worked very hard to make our room nice. We had some fun conversations with him & felt sad that we wouldn't see his smiling face after our last day. Anna was always very sweet, and gave us good suggestions when asked. We would definately stay at this hotel again, and plan on returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got married in Playa Del Carmen at the end of April. We didn't have the wedding at the Playa Maya but I booked my Irish family in as guests for one week. All in all I had a fairly elderly and nervous aunt and uncle and two cousins as well as some friends who stayed there. The rest of the wedding party stayed at various other hotels in Playa Del Carmen but we all agree Playa Maya was the best value. Its a lovely little hotel on a good stretch of beach, the restuarant is great - best coconut prawns and tacos, fab margheritas and the staff were wonderful. They quickly realised that we had people staying there and they were so flexible and treated my family and friends wonderfully. Steve - the manager also hosted a small informal drinks evening for us one night and they went way and beyond what they needed to do. The staff were wonderful and my family felt very safe there. When we go back to Playa we will only stay at the Playa Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A couple of years ago, I stayed at the Playa Maya. It was then that I decided that I would make this hotel my home-away-from-home so that I could work on a book project. This time, my stay consisted of four wonderful weeks. Steve and Delmy, plus their awesome staff: Joaquin, Mayte, Anna, Mari, Paloma, Feliciano, Jose Luis, Ernesto, Alberto, and Juan went out of their way to make sure that I was comfortable and had everything I needed: a spotless room, delicious food, excellent service, and great drinks. Thanks to them, I was able to finish a big chunk of my project. I must add that I highly recommend this hotel for women who are traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: desjardk
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Playa Maya on our first visit to Playa del Carmen, last October, and we found it to be exactly what we wanted: clean, quiet, well located, and friendly. We had a hassle-free stay that helped make this one of my more memorable and relaxing vacations. We stayed in a deluxe ocean view room, which was an excellent choice as we spent most evenings sitting on our balcony, drinking Sol, and staring at the ocean - I feel relaxed just thinking about it. The hotel staff was very helpful with advice and assistance with activities, dining, etc., and by the end of the week we really felt like part of the family. It sounds corny, but it's true. We felt very welcome at this hotel and were sad to say goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: lhs624
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Playa Maya from May 4-May 8, 2005. The location was wonderful. Quiet but close enough to the action. The beach was fairly eroded when we were there so we felt as though there wasn't much room on the beach since most of the sand was taken up by the big palapa covering the dining area. We felt crowded and a bit too close to the other guests at the hotel. I know the beach erosion isn't the hotel's fault but if you want huge beach with lots of room, this is not the hotel for you. There are wider stretches of beach just a couple of blocks north of the hotel if you want to walk but we wanted to just roll out of bed and onto the beach! Our room was nice, clean and comfortable. We had to change rooms once because of a reservation mix up not related to our reservation. It wasn't that big of a deal but I don;t think we were the only ones affected by it. Unfortunately, the owners were on vacation while we were there. But I guess everyone deserves some time off. As a result I felt that the remaining staff weren't able to help us with some of questions regarding excursions. with the information on the playa maya website, i was hoping to get a recommendation on deep sea fishing but no one at the hotel knew of the person recommended on the website or any other place to call. Disappointing. Also, we had an early morning excursion so we missed breakfast. One of the women at the front desk said that if we had told them, they would have put aside some pastries for us to take with us. So when we had another early morning excursion, I spoke to another woman at the front desk and she said that there was no way we could do it. I told her my conversation and asked her to look into it but she never did. Other than that, we liked the location, the cleanliness, the free internet at the front desk (when the staff weren't on it) and the value. We would probably recommend Playa Maya to our friends. I am guessing that when the owners are present, the experience is better.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the Playa Maya a winner”
Reviews.Author: philhansen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned to the States from one week at the Playa Maya Hotel in Playa del Carmen. At first, I was quite displeased with our room. We recieved room 101 with the deluxe terrace on the ground floor. I told our agent with Worldlinks that we wanted a room with a view of the ocean. We could see the ocean but it was an obstructed view looking partially at the ocean and partially at the rooftop of the Playa Maya beach club bar. My wife, Starlene calmed me down and we decided just to go with what we were given. The owner/manager Steven Ryberg called the next day explained that it was the room that Worldlinks and I had decided upon and that he would be more than happy to switch me to another room but the hotel was fully occupied. By that time, I only wanted to get into vacation mode and really didn't want to press the point any longer, so Steve and I mutually agreed to let it be. It was probably what the Good Lord wanted us to have anyway because I continued to strain my right knee so being on the ground floor turned out to be a blessing. Our room was spartan but clean. The bathroom a bit small but clean and functional. The water pressure is half of what it is in the states because it is gravity fed from the rooftop but will get you clean. Very high quality thick towels. They only give you the minimun though. One wash, hand and body towel per person, per day. Good quality TV with remote, small refrig, excellent air conditioning, and probably one of the very best hotel king size beds we have slept on. It was the same size wide but it seemed just a bit shorter than a standard king. The sheets crisp, white, cool, clean with probably 180 to 200 thread count. Very good quality pillows also. The sleep quality was excellent because of where the Playa Maya is located. It is located between two older hotels, the Pelicano and the Alhambra on the beach. It was very quiet throughout every night and we never heard any of the goings on from 5th Avenue which at times can be very noisy. The Playa Maya beach club, open to all, serves the best valued cocktails in Playa del Carmen. At least of what we found. Also some of the best food for the consideration given. Nothing too extravagent on the menu but the quality exceeded the prices. Thank you to Racielle and Juacien, two wonderful young amigos who were our servers during the week. A short comment about the staff. Melissa, Anna and Mayta thank you so much for all of your help, advice and service to Starlene and I. We all know that there are quite a few other people behind the curtain who help make the success of a hotel. We want to thank you all, for cleaning our room, washing our clothes, helping us pack up unruly larger gifts, your graciousness and sweetness of character overall. Who you all are made our vacation a memorable experiance. Thank you. A quick note about Playa del Carmen. Beautiful, but in a place of development in that it can become something very wonderful or tragic. The water, electrical, sewage and roads do not seem to be keeping pace with the explosive growth of the community. Many Mexican establishments, especially resturants do not see the importance of clean restrooms or toilets with toilet seats. Hawkers, in front of their shops can be rude, caustic and annoying, especially the nearer you are to the Cozumel ferry area. Often, many service people verbally hussel you for tips. A practice that would be a terminating event for most service employees in the U.S. Many of these people have not yet understood that by husseling they are degrading themselves and with my wife and I usually devalue their gratuity from 15% or better to 10% or less. Never once was I ever husseled by any employee of the Playa Maya. That was a small blessing. In conclusion, the Playa Maya was clean and quiet with the best quality I saw for a reasonable rate in PDC. I believe that for an $80. to a $150 budget, chances are you will do worse if you stay at another hotel near the 5th avenue area. Although my wife and I will probably not return to PDC we do reccommend this hotel to other adventurers and sun-seekers.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Mexico rendevous”
Reviews.Author: LakeSammamish
