Reviews.Content: For the third year we (hghschool classmates/spouses from 1972) have visited Mexico (March 17 -25) for a spring break vacation. We have been to Puerto Vallarto, Cozumel and Playa del Carmen. Every trip has been a unique experience and a blast. We stayed at the Westin in Puerto Vallarta and liked the big resort experience, the Pacific coast of Mexico and the character of PV. In 2004 we stay at the Presidente Intercontinental on Cozumel and had a super time too, enjoyed the snorkeling and diving directly from the hotel but did have to rely on cab service to visit town and were isolated from adjacent hotels and services. This year we stayed at the Playa Maya - another unique experience in a very nice small hotel, right on the beach and within walking distance of everything. All of the hotels offer unique experiences. the Playa Maya is very nice, very friendly and has super staff...........they were very tolerant of our "empty nester" and we are here to have a good time behavior. A special thanks to Jacquin - we really appreciate his friendly - customer service ethic and the same goes for everyone at the Playa Maya. Thank You all for a wonderful time!!

Reviews.Title: “2005 kite group”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kite Group 2005 We have been bringing our friends to the Playa-Maya Hotel for three years now, in Feb of 2005 we almost filled the hotel (altogether in Playa Del Carmen we received approximately 75 friends). Steve and Delmy are great hosts and we love the hotel and services provided. When we get to the hotel each year, we say "we're home". The rooms are great and the staff is wonderful. Thanks to everyone for making our vacations wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Feb 3-17/05 marked our second trip to Playa del Carmen staying at the Playa Maya. It felt like coming home when we walked through the sand to the front lobby. This hotel is fun during the day, quiet at night, extremely clean, well maintained as evidenced by the continuous upgrades and improvements. (By the way, I almost got lost in the new plush towels and the breakfast was a perfect start to the day). The staff is great and I've never seen anyone work harder than "the beach chair guy". This, by-far, is our favorite destination and hotel. Delmy and Steve are very accessible and sincerely want to hear your thoughts or concerns about their property. They want your stay to be pleasant and will bend over backwards to accomodate special requests such as a Super Bowl Party. Melissa at the front desk was an added bonus, always smiling and friendly and a great help in booking adventures and in times of distress, such as walking under the wrong bird. Not a friendlier crew could be found. (Raciel, Luis, Juaquin, Enrique and the list goes on). This is not a glitzy hotel, furnishings are sparse, but everything that you need is there including hair dryers, safe, fridge. Rooms have lots of space to move around and the beds are very comfortable, not slabs like others in Mexico and as mentioned before, the hotel is kept very clean. Food and drinks are great and comparable in price to other places in town. The beach is the best stretch, in our opinion, in this area and the beach chairs with the new cushions are great. The beach only access actually made us feel more secure. The pool is small but very refreshing, if only to just sit and dangle your feet in after a long day on the beach. In closing, I would like to thank Delmy and Steve for once again making our stay such a pleasurable one. We are still thinking hard on next year and if by chance we can return to Playa del Carmen, we would never consider staying anywhere else. Hope to see again. SOON! The Arsenault's

Reviews.Title: “How refreshing to find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like others who post, I am a regular visitor to Mexico, and a travel consultant who specializes in travel to Mexico.One,2,3,4,and 5 star hotels and resorts,you name it I've stayed in them over the past 20 years.My first visit to Playa Del Carmen was in 1985, my how it has changed.To be quite frank I do not particularly like the sprawl that has taken over the charming old fishing village.When my husband and I checked into the Playa Maya we were thrilled at what we saw.A small intimate charming boutique hotel with a Mediterranian flare.Clean,great location,friendly staff and a darn good restaurant for breakfast and dinner.I love sitting on the beach with my toes in the sand, sipping on my pina colada and eating cerveche.This is why most of us Mexico maniacs come every year to this friendly country.In a nut shell,the Playa Maya is one heck of a deal for a beach front property in the fastest growing city in Mexico.The beautiful views of the Caribbean, clean rooms,great location,and accomodating staff are reason enough for me to stay at the Playa Maya again and recommend it to my clients and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Well worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: JackoIII
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa Maya for 10 days in early January. Here is my review of the hotel and what it had to offer. Please keep in mind that I am well-traveled in Mexico and in other places throughout the world including Spain, Jamaica, Portugal, France and Morrocco. This was my 6th visit to the country and I have stayed in All Inclusives and Independently Arranged boutique hotels. I must say that we thoroughly enjoyed our vacation, as we always do in Mexico. While we like to try staying at new places, eating at different restaurants, and exploring new places, we have come to enjoy the independently arranged boutique hotels, like Playa Maya better than the All Inclusives. I do have to say that this time around, the Playa Maya was one of our favorite places to stay. First the positives: - Very prompt and courteous check-in..say hi to Filo for me! - Their beach attendent, Feliciano cheerfully lugged our heavy suitcases at check-in as well as promptly had our cushioned beach chairs ready for us each day with a smile. - Service was great, people were very kind and wanted to suit your needs. - Noone was ever discourteous to us in any way - Great location as the entrance leads right out onto the beach and the main drag, 5th avenue is right around the corner, yet the hotel is perfectly quiet from the sometimes raucous 5th avenue activity. - Super Clean hotel. - Nice music around their beach palapa restaurant area. - Great bar/drink service. - Personalized attention by the owner, Steve - I really enjoyed the variety of rooms that I could pick from to ensure I had what I wanted when I arrived! Now the negatives: (and these are only little, picky items) - They don't serve dinner in the evening at their great, casual beach restaurant (although they did happily prepare the fish we caught one evening). We enjoyed many fine lunches there (try the coconut shrimp)! - The pool, which is smaller than most, was delightfully designed and a nice quiet reprieve when you didn't want to be on the beach (which was hardly ever!). As with most good hotels, you really get to pick and choose the room that you want to meet your specific requirements. If you want a great, clean hotel with a super friendly staff; outside the door, wonderful beach location; great beach restaurant for easy access to munchies and a cold one when you really need it, and you are looking for a hotel with easy access to the fun on 5th avenue, without all the noise at night..then the Playa Maya is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this great beachfront hotel, as did our friends. We loved it! The staff is terrific, the rooms (we were in the Garden Room) were roomy and super clean. The maids made different arrangements with our towels every day (my friend & I compared the different designs - a pair of swans, interlocking hearts, etc. - I know this sounds girly, but it was a nice touch). The rooms had cable TV, and there were several channels in English. The hotel provides comfortable beach chaises, with huge beach towels. The hotel is centrally located such that you are but one block from the main restaurant/bar drag. The beachfront bar was terrific (the waiters patiently accepted my somewhat slaughtered Spanish and my husbands tendency to put an "o" on every word as if that somehow made it understandable). We look forward to booking again!

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Place”
Reviews.Author: highlandlight
Reviews.Content: We are big fans of small hotels or inns and the Playa Maya fits the bill. In an area full of all-inclusive mega-resorts, we were so happy to find a small unpretentious but charming hotel right on Playa del Carmen's fantastic white sand beach. It's crammed in cheek by jowl with other small hotels, but this did not detract from the comfort of the place. The rooms are spacious, extemely clean, simply and attractively furnished. The hotel personnel are very friendly and helpful. The location couldn't be better if you like easy access to Avenida Quinta where all the action is but want a quiet night's sleep and a view of the blue, blue ocean. We went in December for the second time since we liked it so much the year before. This was another find for us from TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!!”
Reviews.Author: rba828
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Playa Maya from Feb. 3rd thru Feb. 8th and absolutely loved it!! The friendly employees and service couldn’t be beat. Our room was very clean and beautiful and we had a great unobstructed view. Every morning after we left the room it would be promply cleaned and they would leave towel art and bottled water. The pool is small, but my husband and I had little interest in that since the beautiful ocean and waves were only feet away. We saw people hanging around the pool, but never saw anyone in it. The food is excelent and people staying all over PDC go there to eat. You’ve got to try the Playa Maya coconut shrimp, it’s the best we have had. The beach in front of the hotel was probably one of the best areas with very few rocks and not as crowded as other places up and down the beach. Juaquim always had a couple cold Dos Equis waiting for us and made our experience at the Playa Maya even better with his kindness and attention to detail. If you can’t find a lounger on the beach the guys at the Playa Maya will find one for you and set it up wherever you want. We will definatly be returning to the Playa Maya in the future. One thing to keep in mind is that this hotel has quite a following and some of the (smart) regular visitors actually make reservations for the same time next year as they check out. Make your reservations way in advance! The Playa Maya only had one room available for the first week of our stay in PDC, and after that we unfortunately had to switch hotels. We were so spoiled at the Playa Maya that the second hotel didn’t have a chance and on several occasions we deserted our new hotel to hang out at the Playa Maya. We highly recommend this hotel, it is fabulous. Thanks for the Super Bowl party Steve!

Reviews.Title: “OK place-- not the best though”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights. The staff was very nice and attentive, the beach was lovely & the hotel was clean. Nice airconditioning if that's what you're into. Wasn't happy with a few things though. The "free" breakfast included white bread toast & butter and coffee. That was all, plus they were a half hour late opening the restaurant for breakfast. We were told we had a garden room with a garden patio & hot tub. It ended up being a basement room (so not much light) with a shaftway that had some plants in it and a small hot tub. That was no "garden patio"! The photos on the internet were decieving. The patio did not look at all like the shaftway that it was. Also, the hotel is so tiny-- and it's crammed in between 2 other hotels... the pool is pretty much useless... it's tiny and the entrance to the tiny lobby (which isnt really a lobby-- it's more like a hallway) is a bridge that goes over the pool. So there's really no sun there and you feel sort of dumb sunning yourself there while people are walking back and forth. No one ever used the pool there. We had a rental car, and they had 2 spots on the street that the hotel used. You needed a key to unlock the spot to park there, and one nite we came back at 10 PM, and the guy with the key had gone home, so we had to go look for a parking spot elsewhere. They also played loud bad hip hop music in the bar which I hated (but that's just my taste).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I went to Playa Maya in April of 2003 and we had incredible time. The hotel is spotless, cute, and has a great staff. I believe we were the first couple ever to have gotten engaged while staying at the Playa Maya (my proposal spot has since been replaced by a cool patio). Although the Avenida has a ton of great restaurants (and so does the beach) we found ourselves eating most our meals right at Playa Maya. The food is excellent and I long for having breafast and coffee on the beach. When Steve and his staff found out we got engaged, they went out of their way to make us feel good. My family called from the US and wanted to buy us a bottle of champagne. Since the Playa Maya bar didn't stock it, they went far past the Avenida to find a place to get us a great bottle. We came back to our room and there it was in an ice bucket, with some other nice treats. Usually when I travel I'm anxious to get home. I did NOT want to leave Playa Maya. It'll be a repeat destination for us many times. You can't go wrong staying at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Playa Maya for our 2nd time for 8 days in Mid-January. Great staff, great location. We especially liked how being on the beach between streets made it so quiet despite being close to 5th. My wife's favorite part of the hotel is the small workout area that directly overlooks the sea. Playa Maya has to be one of the cleanest places we've ever stayed at. From the owners to the staff, everyone seems to go the extra mile to make sure you're enjoying your stay.

Reviews.Title: “a week of Paradise at Playa Maya”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Playa del Carmen and I am very pleased that we chose Playa Maya Hotel. I couldn't wipe the smile off my face as I stepped out of our hotel entrance right on to the beach! There was a little Mexican man scurrying about setting up our umbrellas and padded lounge chairs in little conversational groupings. His pleasantness, diligence and attention to detail was repeatedly evident in the entire Playa Maya staff and management. Our room was spacious and immaculately clean. I loved the quiet beach-front only access to the hotel, because it made it seem secluded, even though bustling 5th Avenue was right around the corner. I noticed several times during the week that repeat customers were being greeted like old friends. I plan to be one of them!
